loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
For the past five years, Augustina has been a petty trader in the local market of Bawalashie community, a suburb of Accra in Ghana. She is a forty-year-old woman, married, with four kids who are schooling. She lives with her family in the same community in a rented apartment.  She is a busy petty trader who sells cassava, charcoal, tinned tomatoes, yams, maize, etc. on top of a table in the local market. 

Augustina loves being a merchant, the business through which she earns a living for her family. She does not have sufficient working capital to run the business. With the loan, she wants to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality stock to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs, charcoal, etc. for re-sale

loans.name: Marizol

texts.es:
La señorita Marizol es socia del Banco Comunal “La Juleñita” del distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chuchito, en el departamento de Puno; tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil soltera y sin hijos, posee estudios de superior completa (administración) 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 09  años, ella refiere que su negocio es la compra y venta de alcohol para uso en cocina y la artesanía (bordados en bayeta); su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir bayeta y lana para sus bordados.
Con este préstamo de S/ 800.00 nuevos soles el mismo que se compromete a paga en 06 cuotas mensuales; dicho préstamo le será útil en la compra de cilindros de alcohol para uso industrial y de cocina; debido a que es la época de mayor venta de este producto. Su sueño es poder exportar su artesanía (bordados), para lo cual ella viene juntando todas sus ganancias a fin de lograr dichos sueños. 
Ella se muestra muy agradecida a los créditos que viene otorgando Manuela Ramos para el desarrollo de las mujeres.
texts.en:
Marizol is a member of La Juleñita Communal Bank in the district of Juli, Chuchito province, department of Puno. She is 27 years old, single, has no children, and has a college degree in administration. She has worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for 9 years. Her business is buying and selling alcohol for use in the kitchen and handicrafts (embroidered fabric). Her first loan was 300 soles ($100), which she used to buy fabric and thread for her embroidery. With this loan of 800 soles ($250), which she will repay over 6 months, she will buy containers of alcohol for industrial and kitchen purposes, as this is the best time of year to sell this product. Her dream is to be able to export her handicrafts (embroidery), so she has been saving her earnings to make this dream come true. She is very grateful to have received the loans from Kiva partner Manuela Ramos, which lends money for the development of women.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy containers of alcohol for industrial and kitchen-related purposes

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La señora Elena es socia del Banco Comunal “Miraflores”, barrio 18 de enero, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; de 29 años de edad, tiene 03 hijos, es casada y posee estudios de secundaria incompleta.
Trabaja hace 01 año y mas con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su negocio es la compra, engorde y venta de ganado vacuno, su primer préstamo fue de S/.500.00 nuevos soles que le sirvió para completar capital y comprar un toro más.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1200.00 Nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 03 meses de manera puntual, el dinero lo destinará en la compra de alimento balanceado, semilla de alfalfa, y apoyo técnico (medicinas, vitaminas, etc.) para poder engordar su ganado y vender a un mejor precio en las ferias ganaderas de Pilcuyo o Ilave. Con lo cual obtendrá mayores ganancias y ayudará en la educación de sus hijos
texts.en:
Señora Elena is a member of the community bank "Miraflores", in the 18 de enero neighborhood, district of Pilcuyo, Province of El Collao, Department of Puno. She is 29 years of age, has three children, is married, and has some high school education.

She has worked for over a year with the Manuela Ramos Movement. Her business is the purchase, raising, and sale of cattle. Her first loan of S/.500.00 nuevos soles added to her capital and allowed her to purchase another bull.

With this loan of S/. 1200.00 Nuevos soles ($375), an amount she is committed to paying back promptly in 3 months, she will purchase cattle feed, alfalfa seeds, and supplies (medicines, vitamins, etc.) to be able to raise her cattle and sell it at a better price in the livestock shows in Pilcuyo or Ilave. With this, she will make better earnings and will be able to help in the education of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase feed, alfalfa seeds, and supplies (medicines, vitamins, etc.) to be able to fatten her cattle and sell it at a better price in the livestock fairs in Pilcuyo or Ilave. With this, she will be able to earn more and help in her children's education

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a thirty-eight-year-old father of two children who are currently in school. He operates a grocery store in his neighborhood. He started his operation eight years ago. He sells products like rice, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oils, assorted biscuits, candies, evaporated milk, etc. With the loan, he wants to buy cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice, canned foods and drinks and cooking oil to increase his stock of goods. With increased stock of greater variety, he hopes to increase his income to provide for the educational needs of his children. He wants to support his children to the university level.  He would appreciate the assistance very much. He is a member of the community group called To God Be the Glory Trust Group. In this group members assist and support one another in handling repayment.

loans.use: To increase the stock of goods in his grocery store.

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: Abdoulaye est dans le transport urbain et inter-urbain. Avec son car il arrive à entretenir sa famille. Ce brave homme sollicite ce prêt pour l'entretien de son moteur. Il a une expérience avérée dans le secteur du transport.
texts.en:
Abdoulaye is in urban and inter-urban transport. With his mini-bus, he manages to support his family. This hard-working man is requesting a loan to use to have his motor serviced. He has considerable experience in the transport sector.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: having his motor serviced

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis A. is 35 years old. He is married and has six children. The eldest is in senior high school while the rest are in primary school in the village. His wife is a petty trader.  Francis is a local manufacturer of palm oil.  Palm oil is produced from palm nut fruits. The palm nut fruit is processed through various stages to obtain the palm oil.  Palm oil is used to prepare many local dishes. His production is on a small scale because he lacks capital to buy machines for processing.

In addition to his palm oil business, for the past eight years he has also operated a grocery shop. He sells items like sugar, biscuits, evaporated milk etc. in his community. He says this business has slowed due to current food prices and the economic crunch in the world market. 

He wants to use the loan to buy more palm nuts to produce palm oil in larger quantities. He will also use the loan to purchase rice, sugar, milk, biscuits, and other canned foods to supply his grocery store.

Francis believes this will help him earn more income to provide for his family and finance his children's education. 
Francis belongs to a village bank called God Will Provide.

loans.use: To buy more palm nut fruits and grocery products to restock his inventory.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
La señora Valentina es socia del Banco Comunal “Las estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca” del centro poblado de Chipana, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno; tiene 47 años de edad, de estado civil viuda y con 01 hijo, posee estudios de primaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 01 año, ella refiere que su negocio es la compra y venta de ganado menor; su primer préstamo fue de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió para engordar ganado menor y venderlo en las ferias ganaderas de Pilcuyo.
Actualmente ella viene trabajando con el mismo negocio, con este préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles el mismo que se compromete a paga en 05 cuotas mensuales; el dinero le servirá para comprar ganado (porcinos y ovinos) y engordarlos para su venta en la época de carnavales. Con las ganancias ella ayuda en el sustento de su hijo y su educación. 
Ella esta agradecida por la ayuda que le brinda Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Señora Valentina is a member of the community bank “Las estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca” in the center of Chipana, district of Pilcuyo, Province of El Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 47 years of age, is a widow, has one son, and completed her elementary school education.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for a year. She works in the purchase and sale of small livestock. Her first loan of S/ 500.00 nuevos soles served to fatten her livestock for her to sell at the livestock fairs in Pilcuyo.

Now she continues to work in the same business. With this loan of S/ 500.00 nuevos soles ($175), which she has committed to repay in 5 monthly payments, she will buy livestock (sheep and pigs) and fatten them for sale during the carnival season. With the earnings, she helps to support her son and his education.

She is grateful for the help that Manuela Ramos provides to her.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase livestock (pigs and sheep) and fatten them to sell during the carnival season.  With the earnings she will help support her son and his education.

loans.name: Obaa

texts.en:
Obaa Y. is 56 years old. She is married with six children and lives in Koforidua, in the Ashanti region of Ghana, with her family. Currently one of her children is in senior high school and the rest are learning trades such as hairdressing. She sells fruit (mostly bananas) and cooking utensils in the neighborhood. She sells the bananas to travelers on the main road in her community.  She balances her stock of cooking utensils on her head and moves around to sell them. 

In addition to this, she has added plastic bowls to her inventory. By selling a variety of products, she can manage when demand for one product drops. 

She will use the loan to restock her inventory so her business can move forward.  She hopes to earn more income to support her children. Obaa belongs to a group called ‘Yesu edinkunim’ which means Christ Is Victorious.

loans.use: To buy increased supplies of bananas, cooking utensils and plastic bowls.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
La señora Maria es socia del Banco Comunal “Las estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca”, del centro poblado de Chipana, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; de 33 años de edad, tiene dos hijos, es viuda y posee estudios de primaria incompleta (quinto de primaria).
Trabaja hace un año con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 nuevos soles y se siente contenta porque le permitió comprar lechones para engordarlo y luego venderlo.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1100.0 nuevos soles, monto que destinará a compra de  ganado vacuno y ternero para poder engordarlos y venderlos en las ferias ganaderas de Pilcuyo, Ilave; ella de esta manera contribuirá a mejorar la calidad educativa de sus hijos; asimismo se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo sus cinco cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Señora Maria is a member of the community bank "Las estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca”, in Chipana, district of Pilcuyo, Province of El Collao, Department of Puno. She is 33 years of age, has two children, is a widow, and has a 5th grade education.

She has worked for a year with the Manuela Ramos Movement and raises pigs. Her first loan of S/ 300.00 nuevos soles made her happy becuase it allowed her to buy piglets to fatten and to later sell.

With this loan of S/ 1100.0 nuevos soles ($350), she will buy cattle and calves to be able to fatten and sell them in the livestock fairs in Pilcuyo, Ilave. In this way she will contribute to bettering the quality of her children's education. Also, she commits to punctually pay back her loan in 5 monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle and calves to be able to fatten them and sell them in the livestock fairs in Pilcuyo, Ilave; she, in this way, will contribute to better quality education for her children.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.fr: A. Rosalie a 41 ans et elle s’est mariée avec EKEMON Theodore. Ils ont 4 enfants ensemble. Rosalie n’a pas eu la chance d’aller a l’école, mais tous de ses enfants sont scolarisés. Elle fait la restauration depuis 20 ans. Les autres crédits qu’elle avait reçu lui ont permis d’augmenter son niveau d’activité et d’aider son mari avec les frais de scolarisation des enfants. Dans l’avenir elle voudrait commencer par acheter les cossettes d’igname en gros. L'igname, c'est une nourriture locale sous forme de tubercule.
texts.en:
Rosalie A., 41, is married to Theodore Ekemon and they have four children. Rosalie herself did not have the good fortune to attend school, but all her children are in school. She has been working in the food service business for 20 years. Her previous loans have permitted her to expand her business and to help her husband with school fees for their children. In the future, she would like to begin buying cocoyam grits wholesale. Cocoyams are a root crop consumed locally.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of foodstuffs used in preparing cooked food

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa A. is 50 years old. She is married and has four children. All her children have finished junior high school and are now working. She lives with her husband in Koforidua, a suburb of Offinso, in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Yaa is an achiever and a resourceful mother. She loves selling goods, the business through which she makes a living. 

Yaa has sold bananas and plantains by the roadside in Koforidua for more than ten years. She treks to surrounding villages in the community to purchase bulk stock of bananas and plantains from the farmers. Yaa buys the unripe bananas in bulk and covers them with plantain leaves in the bush. She leaves them there until they are ripe, when she gets them and sells them to her customers.   

Because she lacks adequate working capital, she is not able to buy enough stock to make enough profit to support her family. With the loan, she wants to purchase bulk supplies of bananas and plantains so she can scale up her sales. She wants to use part of the profit to support her children.
Yaa belongs to a village bank called ‘Chance’.

loans.use: To purchase bananas and plantains.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Luisa es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Rio Blanco”, centro poblado D. Chipana, distrito D. Pilcuyo, Provincia D. El Collao, Departamento D. Puno; D. 52 años D. edad, tienen 06 hijos, y es viuda; asimismo posee estudios D. primaria completa.
Trabaja hace dos años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su negocio es la compra, engorD. y venta D. ganado, su primer préstamo fue D. S/.300.00 nuevos soles que los invirtió en la compra D. alimento balanceado para engordar su ganado.
Con este préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 05 meses D. manera puntual, el dinero lo destinará en la compra D. ganado vacuno (02 toros), los que engordará y venderá en mayor precio en la feria D. Pilcuyo o Ilave; ello le servirá para poder ayudar en los estudios superiores D. sus hijos, puesto que ese es el anhelo D. ella.
texts.en:
Señora Luisa is a member of the community bank “Las Brisas del Rio Blanco”, in Chipana, district of Pilcuyo, Province of El Collao, Department of Puno. She is 52 years of age, has 6 children, is a widow, and has completed elementary school.

She has worked for two years with the Manuela Ramos Movement. She buys, fattens, and sells livestock. She invested her first loan of S/.300.00 nuevos soles in the purchase of feed to fatten her livestock. With this loan of S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles ($925), that she commits to repaying punctually in 5 months, she will buy cattle (2 bulls) that she will fatten and will sell at a better price in the Pilcuyo or Ilave fair. This will enable her to help in the higher education of her chidlren which is her greatest wish.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cattle (2 bulls) to fatten and sell at a better price in the fair in Pilcuyo or Ilave; this will allow her to be able to help in the higher education of her children, her greatest wish.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua T. is 45 years old. She is married and has four children. Two of her children are married and the other two are traders in the community market. She lives with her husband in Koforidua, a suburb of Offinso, in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Akosua is an achiever and a resourceful mother. She loves selling goods, the business through which she makes a living. 

For more than ten years, Akosua has been selling bananas and plantains by the side of the road in Koforidua. She treks to surrounding villages in the community to purchase bananas and plantains from farmers.  Akosua buys unripe bananas in bulk and covers them with plantain leaves in the bush. She leaves them there until they are ripe, and then picks them up to sell to her customers. For lack of adequate working capital, she is not able to buy enough stock to make enough profit to support her family.  With the loan, she wants to purchase a larger supply of bananas and plantains to enable her scale up her sales. Akosua belongs to a village bank called ‘Chance’.

loans.use: To purchase bananas and plantains.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La señora Celia es socia del Banco Comunal “Las estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca”, sector cuatro Patja, en la comunidad de Chipana, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; de 31 años de edad, tienen dos hijos, y es casada y posee estudios de secundaria completa.
Trabaja hace un año con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos e inicio su negocio de compra y venta de animales menores su primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 nuevos soles que los invirtió en la compra de animales (ovejas).
Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, monto que pagará en 05 meses de manera puntual, el dinero lo destinará a comprar ganado menor (ovinos) para engordarlo  y venderlos en la feria de Pilcuyo, de esta manera contribuirá a mejorar la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señora Celia is a member of the community bank “Las estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca”, sector four of Patja, in the community of Chipana, district of Pilcuyo, Province of El Collao, Department of Puno. She is 31 years of age, has two children, is married, and has completed high school.

She has worked for a year with the Manuela Ramos Movement and started her business in the purchase and sale of small animals. She invested her first loan of S/.300.00 nuevos soles in the purchase of animals (sheep). With this loan of S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles ($175) that she will punctually repay in 5 months, the money will be used to buy small animals (sheep) to fatten and to sell in the Pilcuyo fair. In this way, she will contribute to the improvement of her children's education.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase small animals (sheep) to fatten and sell in the fair in Pilcuyo and in this way she will contribute to bettering her children's education.

loans.name: Aminatou

texts.fr: I. Aminatou a 43 ans et elle s’est mariée avec AKINDE Mohamed. Ils ont 5 enfants, Kabirou, Rachidath, Ramantou, Karim et Rachad, tous scolarisés. Depuis 15 ans elle fait la restauration. Sa spécialité est la vente de bouillie, une nourriture à base de farine de maïs. Les revenus de ses autres crédits l'ont aidé à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Dans l’avenir, Aminatou voudrait acheter toute sa marchandise en gros.
texts.en:
Aminatou I. is 43 years old and is married to Mohamed AKINDE. They have five school-attending children : Kabirou, Rachidath, Ramantou, Karim and Rachad. For 15 years, Mrs. I. has been working in the catering business. Her specialty is porridge made from cornmeal. The income she earned thanks to the previous loans helped her in providing for her family. In the future, Aminatou would like to buy all her supplies wholesale.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn for her catering business

loans.name: Ande Liguéye Group

texts.fr: Depuis une dizaine d’années, les femmes du groupement évoluent dans le domaine de la teinture. Elles possèdent leur propre matériel de teinture et disposent de leur atelier. De plus, elles ont renforcé leurs compétences en suivant plusieurs formations de teinture. A Mékhé, cette activité est en pleine expansion et un marché est à pourvoir. C’est pourquoi, le projet de teinture représente une réelle opportunité. Ce projet permettra d’acheter les matières premières (tissus et les produits de teinture) en grande quantité qu'elles vont teindre et vendre dans les marchés environnants pour fair valoir leur savoir-faire artisanal dans le domaine de la teinture.
texts.en:
For twelve years, the women of the group have been advancing in the field of dyes and tinting cloth. They own their own dyeing equipment and have their own workshop. In addition, they have enhanced their skills by taking several training course in this trade. In Mékhé, this business is actively expanding, and there is a market to be served. This is why the dye project represents a real opportunity. This project will allow the purchasing of raw materials (cloth and dye-related products) in large quantities. The group members are going to dye their materials and sell them in the surrounding marketplaces in order to put their artisanal know-how to good use.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Dyes and tinting work

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana W. is 46 years old. She lives in Koforidua, a suburb of Offinso, in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Her husband left her when she was sick and on the verge of dying, but God saved her life. She has been divorced for about five years and has five children. Three of her children have completed junior high school and the rest are still in the village school.
She is an entrepreneur, artisan, and innovator and above all she understands the market trends pertaining to her work. 
Juliana manufactures coal pots and sells them in the villages. Her brother taught her how to make the pots. She has 10 years of experience in the field. She uses metal for her manufacturing; it is cut into pieces and designed into sizes, after which she does the final design and welds the pots for sale. It is uncommon for women to do such work, but she says she loves doing it because it brings her satisfaction. Since demand for her products has become very high, she needs more funds to increase production.  She needs your assistance to buy materials like metal plates, rods etc. for manufacturing. With the loan she believes that she will have sufficient resources to make enough profit to provide her children with good educations. She said her help to realize that dream comes from you alone.

Juliana belongs to a village bank called ‘Nyame Bekyere’ which means God will Answer.

loans.use: To buy metal supplies.

loans.name: Yolina Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora Yolina es socia del Banco Comunal “Las estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca” del centro poblado de Chipana, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno; tiene 21 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y tiene 01 hijo, posee estudios de secundaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace poco tiempo, ella refiere que su negocio es la compra y venta de ganado menor (porcinos y ovinos); su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir dos pares de porcinos para engordarlos y comercializarlos en las ferias ganaderas de Pilcuyo.
Con este préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles el mismo que se compromete a paga en 05 cuotas mensuales; el préstamo le servirá para poder adquirir mas ganado (porcinos y ovinos), y poder engordarlos para las fiestas de carnavales, época en la cual existe mayor demanda de carne en la zona. Con las ganancias ella podrá ayudar en el sustento de su hogar y en el futuro poder comprarse un auto para el acopio y traslado de su ganado a otros lugares.
texts.en:
Señora Yolina is a member of the community bank "Las estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca” in Chipana, district of Pilcuyo, Province of El Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 21 years of age, lives with her partner, has one son, and has completed high school.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for a short time. She buys and sells small animals (pigs and sheep). Her first loan of S/ 300.00 nuevos soles was used to buy two pairs of pigs to fatten and sell in the livestock fairs in Pilcuyo.

With this loan of S/ 500.00 nuevos soles ($175) that she commits to repay in 5 monthly payments, she will be able to buy more livestock (pigs and sheep) and will be able to fatten them for the carnival holidays, a season when there is a greater demand for meat in the region. With these earnings she will be able to help to support her household and, in the future, will be able to buy a car for the gathering and moving of her livestock from place to place.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more livestock (pigs and sheep) and to be able to fatten them for the carnival holidays, a season when there is a greater demand for meat in the region.  With the earnings, she will be able  to help support her household and to buy a car to gather and move her livestock from place to place.

loans.name: Atta

texts.en:
Atta Y. is 60 years old. She is married and the mother of eight children. Currently all her children are independent with the exception of her youngest, who is in school. She was born and lives in Koforidua in the Ashanti region of Ghana. 

She loves selling goods, the business through which she makes her living.  She has been selling bags of maize and cola for thirty years to support her family. Maize is a popular cereal food that supplies carbohydrates in diets. Cola is purchased mostly by the northerners in Ghana. It is not known what it does for the body but most people chew and enjoy it.  She takes delivery of stock directly from farmers. This enables her to avoid middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. With this loan, she wants to buy maize and cola in bulk to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her home and business. Atta belongs to a village bank called ‘Yesu edinkunim’ which means God is Victorious.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize and cola.

loans.name: Carina Aquilina

texts.es:
La señora Carina es socia del Banco Comunal “Miraflores”, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; de 28 años de edad, tiene 01 hijo y uno mas en espera, es conviviente y posee estudios de secundaria completa.
Trabaja hace 01 año con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su negocio es la compra, engorde y venta de ganado vacuno, su primer préstamo fue de S/.500.00 nuevos soles que le sirvió para adquirir alimento balanceado para engordar sus vacunos. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 03 meses de manera puntual, el dinero le servirá para completar su capital y adquirir mas toros para engorde y venderlos en tres meses a un mejor precio en las ferias ganaderas de Pilcuyo o Ilave. Las ganancias le servirán para poder ahorrar y comprarse una casa en Ilave para sus hijos. 
Ella se siente muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por su apoyo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carina is a member of the “Miraflores” Community Bank in the district of Pilcuyo, in the province of El Collao, in Puno. She is 28 years old, has one child, and one child on the way. She is married and has completed secondary school. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for one year. Her business is to buy, fatten, and sell cattle. Her first loan was for 500 soles, which she used to acquire balanced food to fatten her cattle. With this loan of 500 soles, which she promises to repay punctually in 3 months, she will have more capital and will acquire more cattle to fatten and sell in three months at a better price in the livestock fairs in Pilcuyo or Ilave. She will save her earnings so that she can buy a house in Ilave for her children. She is very thankful to Manuela Ramos for their support.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire more cattle to fatten and sell in three months at a better price in the livestock fairs in Pilcuyo or Ilave. She will save her earnings so that she can buy a house in Ilave for her children.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa M. is 20 years old. She is married with no children and she is very happy. She lives with her family in Koforidua, in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She owns and operates a beauty salon in her neighborhood. Adwoa is a very skillful and talented hairdresser. She has two apprentices who are currently training to learn her skills. She believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service. So she wants to use the loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like pomade, shampoo, activators, hair dryers etc. to serve her customers well. 
 
Adwoa belongs to a village bank called Chance.

loans.use: To buy more hair products for her salon.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
La señora Marisol es socia del Banco Comunal “Miraflores”, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; de 23 años de edad, tiene 01 hijo, es conviviente y posee estudios de secundaria completa.
Trabaja hace 04 meses con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su negocio es la elaboración de sogas, su primer préstamo fue de S/.500.00 nuevos soles que le sirvió para adquirir materia prima (hilos nylon, lana, etc.) para continuar elaborando sogas. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 03 meses de manera puntual, el dinero le servirá para dar un giro a su negocio, puesto que desea mejorar el negocio de una tienda de abarrotes debido a su condición y a la alta competencia de su negocio anterior. Las ganancias le servirán para poder ayudar en los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marisol is a member of the “Miraflores” Community Bank, in the district of Pilcuyo, in the province of El Collao, in Puno. She is 23 years old, has one child, lives with her partner, and has completed secondary school. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 4 months. Her business was the production of ropes. Her first loan was for 500 soles, which she used to acquire the raw materials (nylon threads, wool, etc.) to make ropes. With this loan of 500 soles, which she promises to repay punctually in 3 months, she will give a draft to her business, so that she can improve her grocery store business because of her condition and her solid experience from her previous business. The earnings will be used to help pay for her child’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To give a draft to her business, so that she can improve her grocery store business because of her condition and her solid experience from her previous business. The earnings will be used to help pay for her child’s education.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia M. is a 34-year-old woman. She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. She lives with her family in Koforidua, a suburb of Offinso, in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Emelia is an achiever and a resourceful young woman. She loves selling goods, the business through which she makes a living. 

For more than five years, Emelia has been selling fruits such as bananas and oranges by the side of the road in Koforidua. She treks to surrounding villages to purchase bananas and oranges from farmers.  Emelia buys unripe bananas in bulk and covers them with plantain leaves in the bush. When they are ripe, she picks them up to sell to her customers. For lack of adequate working capital, she is not able to buy enough stock to make enough profit to support her family.  With the loan, she wants to purchase bananas and oranges in bulk, so she can scale up business growth. She believes the loan will enable her to earn more income to support her family. She wants to use part of the profit to support her children's education.
  
Emelia belongs to a village bank called ‘Nyame yekese’ which means God is Great.

loans.use: To purchase bananas and oranges.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal “Las estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca” del centro poblado de Chipana, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno; tiene 40 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 03 hijos, posee estudios de secundaria incompleta (cuarto de secundaria). 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 01 año, ella refiere que su negocio es la compra y venta de ropa; su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir ropa para su comercializarlos en las ferias de Pilcuyo e Ilave.
Con este préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles el mismo que se compromete a paga en 05 cuotas mensuales; el préstamo le servirá para poder comprar casacas al mayor, dada la época de lluvia,  y los comercializará en las ferias. Con las ganancias ella ayuda en la educación superior de sus hijos y en el sustento diario de su hogar. 
Ella se muestra muy agradecida por los créditos que viene otorgando Manuela Ramos para el desarrollo de las mujeres.
texts.en:
Mrs. Margarita is a member of the “United Stars of Titicaca” Community Bank in the town of Chipana, in the district of Pilcuyo, in the province of El Collao, in Puno. She is 40 years old, is married, and has 3 children. She has finished only a quarter of her secondary education. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 1 year. Her business is buying and selling clothes. Her first loan was for 300 soles, which she used to acquire clothes to market in the fairs in Pilcuyo and Ilave. With this loan of 500 soles, which she promises to repay in 5 monthly installments. The loan will be used to buy jackets at wholesale, given the time of the rain, and will market them in the fairs. With the earnings, she helps pay for the higher education of her children and for the daily sustenance of her family. She is very thankful for the loans offered by Manuela Ramos for their development of women.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The loan will be used to buy jackets at wholesale, given the time of the rain, and will market them in the fairs. With the earnings, she helps pay for the higher education of her children and for the daily sustenance of her family.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu S. is 53 years old. She is married with five children. Her husband works repairing bicycles. Her oldest child is in senior high school while the rest are in primary school in the village. She manufactures palm oil and sells bananas to support her family. Palm oil is produced from palm nut fruits. Palm oil is used to prepare many local dishes. Her production is on a small scale because she has insufficient capital to buy machines for the processing.

In addition to the palm oil business, she also sells fruits by the roadside in the community where she lives. She says this business has slowed down due to current food prices and the economic crunch in the world market. 

She wants to use the loan to buy more palm nuts to increase her efficiency and produce palm oil in larger quantities. She will also use the loan to purchase bananas so that she can supply them to her customers on a regular basis. Salamatu believes this will help expand her business to earn more income, so she can support her family and finance her children's education. 

Salamatu belongs to a village bank called God will Provide.

loans.use: To buy more palm nut fruits and bananas to expand her business.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia es socia del Banco Comunal “Las estrellitas Unidas” del centro poblado D. Chipana, distrito D. Pilcuyo, Provincia D. El Collao, en el departamento D. Puno; tiene 47 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada y tiene 05 hijos, posee estudios D. primaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 02 años, ella refiere que posee un negocio D. tienda D. abarrotes; su primer préstamo fue D. S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir mercadería y surtir su negocio.
Actualmente ella requiere un préstamo D. S/ 1200.00 nuevos soles el mismo que se compromete a paga en 05 cuotas mensuales; con el préstamo ella pretenD. adquirir ganado menor para engorD., principalmente para las fiestas D. carnavales donD. existe mayor demanda D. la carne D. chancho y oveja. Con las ganancias ayuda en la educación D. sus hijos y en el sustento diario D. su hogar. 
Ella se muestra muy agradecida por los créditos que viene otorgando Manuela Ramos para el desarrollo D. las mujeres.
texts.en:
Mrs. Julia is a member of the “United Stars” Community Bank in the town of Chipana, in the district of Pilcuyo, in the province of El Collao, in Puno. She is 47 years old, is married, and has 5 children. She has completed primary school. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 2 years. She has a grocery store. Her first loan was for 300 soles, which she used to acquire merchandise and supply her business. At present, she needs a loan for 1200 soles, which she promises to repay in 5 monthly installments. With this loan, she expects that she will acquire young cattle to fatten, mainly for the carnival parties, where there is a large demand for pork and sheep. With the earnings, she will help educate her children and will proviD. sustenance for her family. She is thankful for loan from Manuela Ramos for their development of women.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire young cattle to fatten, mainly for the carnival parties, where there is a large demand for pork and sheep. With the earnings, she will help educate her children and will provide sustenance for her family.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia T. is 50 years old. She is married and has seven children. Three of Afia's children are still in school and the rest are now adults. She lives with her family in Koforidua, a suburb of Offinso, in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Afia is an achiever and a resourceful mother. She loves selling goods, the business through which she makes a living. 

For more than 10 years, Afia has been selling plantains and cassava by the side of the road in Koforidua. She treks to surrounding villages in the community to purchase cassava and plantains from the farmers, which she then sells to her customers. For lack of adequate working capital, she is not able to buy enough stock to make enough profit to support her family.  With the loan, she wants to purchase a larger supply of plantains and cassava to enable her to scale up her business growth. 

Afia belongs to a village bank called ‘Yesu edinkunim’ which means God is Victorious.

loans.use: To purchase a large supply of plantains and cassava.

loans.name: Mari

texts.en: Mari S. is 52 years old. She is married and had seven children. Unfortunately two of her children have passed away.  Two others are in school, and the rest are married. She sells porridge in her neighborhood. Porridge is one of the popular local foods; it is enjoyed as breakfast by almost all Ghanaians. It is prepared from milled maize or millet grains, which is boiled and eaten with sugar, milk and bread or eaten with what we call Kose. Kose is prepared from milled beans and it is fried with cooking oil, so in just 20 minutes it is ready to be served with the porridge. With a large customer base, she wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, beans, sugar and milk to increase production. She hopes to earn a good income to support her children in school. Mari belongs to a village bank called ‘Yeda Nyame ase’ which means We Thank God.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for her porridge business.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La señora Andrea es socia del Banco Comunal “Las estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca”, D. la comunidad D. Chipana, distrito D. Pilcuyo, Provincia D. El Collao, Departamento D. Puno; D. 50 años D. edad, tiene seis hijos, y es casada y posee estudios D. primaria completa.
Trabaja hace dos años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos e inicio su negocio D. compra y venta D. frutas su primer préstamo fue D. S/.500.00 nuevos soles que los invirtió en la compra D. mercadería.
Con este préstamo D. S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, monto que los invertirá en comprar frutas variadas (tuna, manzana, naranja, papaya, piña, etc.) D. tal forma ella podrá vender más y tener más ganancias, también menciona que lo hace para mejorar la calidad educativa D. sus hijos; asimismo se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo en cinco cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Andrea is a member of “The United Stars of Titicaca” Community Bank, in the community of Chipana, in the district of Pilcuyo, in the province of El Collao, in Puno. She is 50 years old, has 6 children, is married, and has completed primary school. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 2 years and began her business of buying and selling fruit. Her first loan was for 500 soles, which she will invest by purchasing merchandise. With this loan of 800 soles, which she will invest by buying a variety of fruit (prickly pear, apple, orange, papaya, pineapple, etc.) so that she will be able to sell more and have more earnings. She does this to improve the education of her children. She promises to repay the loan punctually in 5 monthly installments.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a variety of fruit (prickly pear, apple, orange, papaya, pineapple, etc.) so that she will be able to sell more and have more earnings. She does this to improve the education of her children.

loans.name: Diambar Group

texts.fr:
http://www.sem-fund.org/mekhe.php : 
Grâce au commerce qui leur a permis de s’organiser, d’accéder à des responsabilités, de gagner en autonomie, d’être  valorisées au sein de leurs familles et de leur communauté, Les femmes du groupement "Diambar"  viennent auprès de Kiva solliciter un prêt pour renforcer leur capacité. Le fonds acquis, elles auront la possibilité d'acheter des produits (vaisselle, fruits, légumes, vêtements, chaussures, pagnes)à bas prix et les revendre à bon prix dans les marchés et particulièrement lors des cérémonies religieuses comme le Gamou de "Tivaouane" et de "Pir" comme Mekhé est situé non loin de ces 2 périphériques.
texts.en:
http://www.sem-fund.org/mekhe.php : Thanks to the commerce that has enabled them to get organized, to rise to responsibility, to earn money autonomously, and to be valued within their families and communities, the women of the group "Diambar" are here to request a loan from Kiva to strengthen their abilities. Once the funds are acquired, the women may buy goods (dishes, bowls, fruit, vegetables, clothing, shoes, cloth) at low prices and resell them at good prices in the marketplaces and particularly at religious ceremonies, such as the Prophet’s birthday celebration (le Gamou) in the cities of Tivaouane and Pir, since Mekhé is located close to these two outlying communities.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Rio Blanco”, centro poblado de Chipana, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; de 36 años de edad, tienen 01 hijo, y es casada; asimismo posee estudios de secundaria completa.
Trabaja hace cuatro años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su negocio es la compra, engorde y venta de ganado su primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 nuevos soles que los invirtió en la compra de ganado (ovejas).
Con este préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 05 meses de manera puntual, el dinero lo destinará en la inversión de su tienda, puesto que es uno de sus anhelos; por ello comprará mercadería de abarrotes y enseres de primera necesidad, sin descuidar el engorde de ganado, de esta manera contribuirá en el bienestar de su hijo y ahorrará para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Margarita is a member of “The Breeze of the Rio Blanco” Community Bank, in the town of Chipana, in the district of Pilcuyo, in the province of El Collao, in Pino. She is 36 years old, has 1 son, and is married. She has also completed secondary school. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for four years. Her business is to buy, fatten, and sell livestock. Her first loan was for 300 soles, which she invested by buying livestock (sheep). With this loan of 3000 soles, which she promises to repay punctually in 5 months. The money will be invested in her store, since that is one of her desires. Because of this, she will buy merchandise, including groceries and other necessary goods, without neglecting fattening livestock. In this way, she will contribute to the well-being of her son and will save to buy a house.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her store, since that is one of her desires. Because of this, she will buy merchandise, including groceries and other necessary goods, without neglecting fattening livestock. In this way, she will contribute to the well-being of her son and will save to buy a house.

loans.name: María Duela

texts.es:
La señora María es socia del Banco Comunal “Miraflores”, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; de 42 años de edad, tienen 05 hijos, y es casada y posee estudios de secundaria completa.
Trabaja hace 01 año con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su negocio es la compra, engorde y venta de ganado vacuno, su primer préstamo fue de S/.500.00 nuevos soles que le sirvió para adquirir alimentación para sus toros.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 03 meses de manera puntual, el dinero lo destinará en la compra de ganado para engorde (01 toro) y compra de bebidas gaseosas para completar su tienda de bebidas que también posee y vende en las ferias de Ilave y Pilcuyo; ello le servirá para poder ayudar en los estudios de sus hijos y llenar mas su negocio de bebidas.
Ella se siente muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por su apoyo.
texts.en:
María es a member of the Miraflores Communal Bank in the district of Pilcuyo, El Collao province, department of Puno. She is 42 years old, has 5 children, is married, and completed a high school education. She has worked for the past year with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos, and her business is buying, fattening, and then selling cattle. Her first loan of 500 soles (about $175) helped her buy food for her cattle. With this loan of 1,500 soles ($475), which she will repay punctually over 3 months, she will buy a bull for fattening. In addition, she will buy soft drinks for her store and to sell in the Ilave and Pilcuyo markets. The loan will help her to pay for her children’s studies and stock her beverage business. She is very grateful to Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for their help.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a bull for fattening and buy soft drinks for her store and to sell in nearby markets

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
El señor  Héctor González S. el tiene su casa que le otorgaron por medio de una empresa Mexicana el cual van pagando por medio de la empresa y le van  descontando. Pero el motivo por el cual esta pidiendo que le presten es por que su casa es muy pequeña para su familia el tiene 2 hijas y un bebe de 4 meses. La casa solo cuenta con 2 habitaciones,  ya extendió paredes en la parte de enfrente pero no completa para comprar el material y mano de obra para  instalar el techo.
El señor y su esposa trabajan en una maquiladora para sostén de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Héctor González S. has a home which he got through a Mexican business that finances homes. The reason he is requesting a loan is because his home is very small for his family, as he has two little girls and a 4-month old baby. The house only has two bedrooms and he extended the walls in the front of the house, but he doesn’t have the money to buy the material and labor to install the roof. Héctor and his wife work in a maquiladora (assembly plant) to support their family.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy material for roof

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Acapulco Group

texts.es: El grupo "Acapulco" es un grupo conformado D. 13 socias ya van por su segundo ciclo donD. todas ellas han demostrado capacidad D. administración D. fondos así como responsabilidad en sus pagos. Las socias se dedican actividades en el rubro  comercial D. productos como pan, ropa, comida, cosméticos por catalogo, abarrotes y a la prestación D. servicios D. construcción, carpintería y al servicio domestico. La competencia es granD. en especial en el rubro comercial pero la experiencia D. las socias prevalece ante cualquier contingencia. El crédito esta destinado a la compra D. insumos, materiales y herramientas para poder brindar un mejor servicio y obtener mejores ingresos para mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The Acapulco group is a group formed of 13 members now going for their second cycle where all of them have demonstrated the capacity to administer funds with responsibility in their payments. The members are dedicated to activities in the area of selling products like bread, clothes, food, catalog cosmetics, and providing services like construction, carpentry, and domestic services. There is a lot of competition, especially in the commercial field, but the experiences of the members prevails before any contingency. The credit is destined to the purchase of ingredients, materials to be able to proviD. a better service and get better incomes to improve the quality of life of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Gloria Bilma

texts.es:
La señora Bilma es socia del Banco Comunal “Miraflores”, comunidad de Sacaria Titicachi, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; de 43 años de edad, tienen 03 hijos, y es casada; asimismo posee estudios de secundaria completa.
Trabaja hace 01 año con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su negocio es la compra, engorde y venta de ganado; así como la venta de frutas en los mercados de Ilave y Pilcuyo, su primer préstamo fue de S/.500.00 nuevos soles que le sirvió para más mercadería (frutas).
Con este préstamo de S/. 1200.00 Nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 03 meses de manera puntual, el dinero lo destinará en la compra de más frutas (pepinillos, platano, manzanas, etc. de acuerdo a la época), para venderlos en las ferias de Ilave y Pilcuyo; ello le servirá para poder ayudar en los estudios de sus hijos y en su alimentación diaria.
Ella agradece a Manuela Ramos por el apoyo que  viene brindando en el desarrollo de sus negocios.
texts.en:
Bilma is a member of the Miraflores Communal Bank in the Sacaria Titicachi community, in the district of Pilcuyo, province of El Collao, district of Puyo. She is 43 years old, has 3 children, is married, and has a high school education. She has worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for the past year. She has a business buying, fattening, and selling cattle. She also works selling fruit in the Ilave and Pilcuyo markets. She used her first loan of 500 soles (about $175) to buy more merchandise (fruit). With this loan of 1,200 soles ($375), which she will punctually repay over 3 months, she will buy more fruit (pepinos, plantains, apples, etc., depending on the season) to sell in the Ilave and Pilcuyo markets. The loan will help her pay for her children’s studies and her daily groceries. She is grateful to Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for its support that it gives through business development.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruit (pepinos, plantains, apples, etc., depending on the season)

loans.name: Cheveres Group

texts.es: El grupo "Chéveres" esta representado por la señora Liliana y conformada por 18 miembros que cursan su segundo ciclo demostrando unión, honestidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos. En su mayoría los socios (as) se dedican a la prestación D. servicios como domesticas, constructores, trasporte público D. pasajeros, niñeras y empleadas en empresas privadas, también se dedican a la venta D. productos como pan, comida y otros. La competencia en el ámbito laboral es granD. pero las socias saben que vale más su experiencia y su responsabilidad para realizar mejor su trabajo y tener mejor ingreso. El destino del financiamiento es la compra D. insumos, materiales y herramientas D. trabajo para brindar un mejor servicio y para tener mejores ingresos y mejorar su calida D. vida y la D. sus familias.  Los socios (as) cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios como lo que han demostrado en su anterior ciclo es por esa razón que la fundación Agrocapital les da su confianza
texts.en:
The “Chéveres” group is represented by Liliana and has 18 members that are in their second loan cycle demonstrating unity, honesty and responsibility in their payments. The majority of the members work as domestic employees, builders, providers of public transportation, childcare workers and employees in private businesses. They also work selling products such as bread, prepared food, and more. The competition in the labor market is high but the members know that their experience and responsibility are important in order to improve their businesses and have greater income. The financing will be used to buy consumables, materials and tools for their respective businesses in order to proviD. better serve and have greater income and improve each member’s quality of life and that of their families. The members have experience as a unified group and have demonstrated this in their previous loan cycle and therefore the Agrocapital foundation has every confidence in this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La señora Graciela es socia del Banco Comunal “Miraflores”, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; de 34 años de edad, tiene 01 hijo, es madre soltera y posee estudios de secundaria completa.
Trabaja hace 01 año y un mes con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su negocio es la compra, engorde y venta de ganado vacuno, su primer préstamo fue de S/.500.00 nuevos soles que le sirvió para completar capital y comprar más ganado (toros).
Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 03 meses de manera puntual, el dinero lo destinará en la compra de alimento balanceado, semilla de alfalfa, y solicitar asistencia técnica para poder engordar mejor a su ganado; ello le permitirá vender a un mejor precio y obtener mayores ganancias para poder ayudar en los estudios de sus hijos y juntar dinero para poder comprarse un automóvil para hacer ruta de servicio.
texts.en:
Graciela is a member of the Miraflores Communal Bank in the district of Pilcuyo, province of El Collao, department of Puno. She is 34 years old, has one son, is a single mother, and has a high school education. She has worked for the past year and a month with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos. Her business is buying, fattening and selling cattle. With her first loan of 500 soles ($175), she bought more cattle. With this loan of 500 soles ($175), which she has promised to repay punctually over three months, she will buy balanced nutrition, alfalfa seeds, and hire an expert to help her better fatten her cattle. This will allow her to sell them at a better price and earn a better income. This, in turn, will help her pay for her son’s studies and save money to buy a car to do a service route.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy balanced nutrition, alfalfa seeds, and hire an expert to help her better fatten her cattle

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
M. M. HERMELINDA 
La señora Hermelinda es socia del Banco Comunal “Miraflores”, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; de 37 años de edad, tiene 02 hijos, de estado civil casada y posee estudios de secundaria completa.
Trabaja hace 01 año con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su negocio es la compra, engorde y venta de ganado vacuno, su primer préstamo fue de S/.500.00 nuevos soles que le sirvió para adquirir alimentación para sus ganados.
Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 03 meses de manera puntual, el dinero lo destinará en la compra de alimento balanceado, semilla de alfalfa, y asistencia técnica para poder engordar mejor a los ganados que posee; ello le permitirá vender a mejor precio sus toros y obtener mayores ganancias para pode ayudar en los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is a member of the Miraflores Communal Bank in the district of Pilcuyo, province of El Collao, department of Puno. She is 37 years old, has two children, is married, and has a high school education. She has worked for the past year with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos. Her business is buying, fattening and selling cattle. With her first loan of 500 soles ($175), she bought food for her cattle. With this loan of 500 soles ($175), which she has promised to repay punctually over three months, she will buy balanced nutrition, alfalfa seeds, and hire an expert to help her better fatten her cattle. This will allow her to sell them at a better price and earn a better income. This, in turn, will help her pay for her children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy balanced nutrition, alfalfa seeds, and hire an expert to help her better fatten her cattle

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda  tiene 50 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. DesD. hace 5 años trabaja cada día en el comercio ambulante, y en este tiempo ha visto el fruto D. su esfuerzo por lo que está muy animada D. seguir adelante con su trabajo. Yolanda venD. productos nativos D. su zona (queso, choclos y truchas), con varios días D. anticipación adquiere su mercadería D. las zonas rurales lejanas. Como los productos que venD. son frescos y a bajo precio garantiza la venta rápida D. toda su mercadería por lo que ha decidió aumentar su capital D. trabajo y D. esa manera tener más ganancias. Esta es la quinta vez que Yolanda tiene un préstamo con MFP, y es una D. las socias D. su grupo más comprometida y solidaria para realizar diferentes actividades, además los impulsa a todos para emprender labores nuevas en su banco comunal. Yolanda esta solicitando este dinero para incursionar en al venta D. carne, al cual comprará al por mayor para venderla en el mercado D. su ciudad.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 50 years old and she lives with her husband and two children. For the past five years she has been working every single day as an ambulatory salesperson. During this time she has seen the fruits of her labor and she is very excited about continuing to move forward in her job. Yolanda sells products that are native to her region, like cheese, corn and trout. She obtains the products from rural areas a few days before she begins to sell them. Since the products that she sells a fresh and her price is low, she always sells out of her merchandise quickly. Because of this she would like to increase the capital of her business and purchase more merchandise. This way she will be able to increase her earnings. This is the fifth time that Yolanda has received a loan through MFP, and she is one of the members of a group that is most committed and shows the most solidarity. She also helps to motivate people to do jobs in the communal bank that are new to them. Yolanda is asking for this loan so that she can begin to sell meat, which she with buy wholesale and then sell it at the main market of her city.

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Get into selling meat

loans.name: America Esperanza

texts.es: América Esperanza A. vive en Cojutepeque dentro del departamento de Cuscatlán, y vive únicamente con su esposo Raúl, juntos, trabajan cada mes para podes  cubrir los crecientes gastos económicos. América con perseverancia y voluntad, ha montano un modesto puesto en el mercado, donde vende frutas y verduras cada día. Junto a su esposo, solicitan un préstamo para comprar nueva mercadería y más frutas, y así hacer crecer su puesto de frutas un poquito más.
texts.en:
América Esperanza A. lives in Cojutepeque in the region of Cuscatlán, El Salvador. She lives with her husband Raúl, and together they work each month to be able to cover the increasing economic expenses. Through perseverance and will, América has started a modest market stall where she sells fruits and vegetables each day. Together with her husband, she is asking for a loan in order to purchase new merchandise and more fruit, and thus be able to grow her fruit stand a bit more.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her business (fruit sales)

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Hijos Del Dios Group

texts.es: El grupo " Hijos D. Dios " esta representado por la señora Carmen Teresa y conformado por 14 miembros que en su mayoría se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos y D. artículos como  cotillones, abarrotes, C. cola y tarjetas para celulares. La competencia en el ámbito comercial es difícil, pero los socios (as) saben salir adelante con esfuerzo y honestidad. El destino del crédito es para la compra D. insumos y materiales para poder mejorar sus ingresos y la calidad D. vida D. sus familias. Los socios (as) tienen experiencia trabajando con grupos solidaR. debido a que van cursando juntos su segundo ciclo dentro D. la Fundación Agrocapital demostrando capacidad en la administración D. los fondos otorgados y responsabilidad con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
The "Hijos D. Dios" group is represented by Mrs. Carmen Teresa and consists of 14 members who primarily sell cosmetics and items such as paper supplies, groceries, C. Cola, and cell phone cards. The competition in the commercial market is difficult, but the members know that in order to be successful honesty and effort are needed. The loan will be used to buy consumables and materials in order to improve their businesses and the quality of life of their families. The members have experience working as a united group as they have been learning together and are in their second loan cycle with the Fundación Agrocapital, demonstrating their capability in administering their loans and being responsible with their obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza vive  en casa de su tía con su esposo y sus dos hijos pequeños. Se dedica a la venta de quesos y truchas, viaja los días jueves de cada semana a su pueblo natal donde adquiere toda su mercadería para luego ofrecer sus productos a los puestos del mercado o también a sus clientes de forma particular de forma ambulante en el mercado, Maritza utiliza grandes baldes que son sus principales herramientas de trabajo donde transporte sus quesos y pescados. De esta manera garantiza los ingresos necesarios para su hogar, aunque su trabajo es cansado por las largas horas que camina con el peso de sus baldes, ella seguirá con este negocio y tiene miras a seguir creciendo, y este ímpetu de progreso lo demuestra también en la producción de tejidos en estilo crochet, los cuales envía a una de sus tías a la ciudad de Lima para venderlos. Es la segunda vez que Maritza está solicitando un préstamo con MFP, en la primera ocasión demostró ser responsable en sus pagos y luego voluntariamente se retiró, pero regresó para trabajar y fue admitida nuevamente por ser una de las socias de su banco comunal que demuestra ser unida y solidaria. Maritza solicita este dinero para abastecerse de mayor mercadería y aprovechar que en esta época del año presenta mayor cantidad en ventas, con el monto que solicita podrá adquirir 100 quesos que están valorizados en 150 soles y con la otra mitad comprara 18 kilos de trucha.
texts.en:
Maritza lives in her aunt's house with her husband and their two small children. She earns a living by selling cheeses and trout. She travels every Thursday to her home town where she acquires all her goods to then sell to vendors and also to individual clients through street or market sales. Maritza uses large buckets as her principal work tools, and in the buckets she transports her cheeses and fish. Through this work she ensures the necessary income for her home. Although her work is tiring due to the long hours that she walks with the heavy buckets, she will continue with this business and with a view towards continuing to grow. She also demonstrates this drive for progress in her crochet works, which she sends to one of her aunts in the city of Lima to be sold. This is the second time that Maritza is requesting a loan through MFP; the first time she proved herself to be responsible with her payments and then later withdrew [from the program]. But she returned to work and was admitted again as one of the members of her communal bank, showing her unity and solidarity. Maritza is requesting this money to increase her inventory with more goods and take advantage of the greater sales at this time of year. With the funds she is requesting she will be able to acquire 100 cheeses which will cost 150 soles, and with the other half she will buy 18 kilos of trout.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her sales inventory

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina tiene 37 años, es viuda  y vive con sus 3 hijos menores  en una casa arrendada. Ella vende papa desde hace un año, en un inicio se colocaba en los pasadizos de un mercado cercano a su casa para ofrecer su producto, su situación económica de ese entonces no era buena, pero con persistencia y dedicación ha podido progresar bastante, aumentó poco a poco su mercadería y así pudo arrendar un puesto en el mercado central de su ciudad, donde atiende generalmente por las mañanas para que por las tardes pueda estar con sus pequeños. En épocas de mayor venta decide atender su negocio durante todo el día generalmente los fines de semana y hay más trabajo en los meses de cosecha, (Marzo y Abril). La estabilidad de su negocio le permite a Paulina a planificar su futuro, ya que desea ser una gran distribuidora de papa en su ciudad. Es la tercera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, y son casi 18 meses con su banco comunal donde es una de las que impulsa la unidad de su grupo y la que persevera a pesar de los inconvenientes que se puedan presentar, además que disfruta del trabajo en equipo. Paulina está solicitando este préstamo para comprar al por mayor sacos de papa, cada saco está valorizado entre 100 y 150  soles y tiene 100 kilos de producto.
texts.en:
Paulina is 37 years old, is widowed and lives with her 3 young children in a rented house. She has been selling potatoes for one year. At the beginning she would set up in the passageways of a market near her house to sell her product. Her economic situation at that time was not good, but with persistence and dedication she has been able to make much progress, growing her inventory little by little and as well being able to rent a kiosk in the central market of her city. There, she generally works in the mornings in order to be with her young ones in the afternoon. During the peak sales times of the year she has decided to run her kiosk all day during weekends. There is also more work during harvest months (March and April). The stability of her business has allowed Paulina to plan her future, and as such she would like to be a large potato distributor in her city. This is the third time that she is requesting a loan through MFP. She has been with her communal bank nearly 18 months, where she is one of those who promotes unity of her group, who perseveres in spite of the difficulties that arise, and who also enjoys working as a team. Paulina is requesting this loan to buy wholesale sacks of potatoes. Each sack costs between 100 and 150 soles and each contains 100 kilos of product.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her sales inventory

loans.name: Norma Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Alicia es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Rio Blanco”, centro poblado de Chipana, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; de 33 años de edad, tienen 03 hijos, y es casada; asimismo posee estudios de secundaria completa.
Trabaja hace cuatro años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su negocio es la compra y venta de maíz, su primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 nuevos soles que los invirtió en la compra de maíz.
Con este préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 05 meses de manera puntual, el dinero lo destinará en la compra de ganado vacuno (toros), los que engordará y venderá en la feria de Pilcuyo; ello le servirá para poder construir su casa en Chipana para el bienestar de su hijo.
texts.en:
Alicia is a member of the Las Brisas del Rio Blanco (The White River Breezes) community bank in the town of Chipana, in Pilcuyo district, El Collao province and Puno Department. Alicia is 33 years old, and is married with three children. She completed high school and for the past four years has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos, a women's advocacy organization, buying and selling corn. Alicia invested her first loan of 300 nuevos soles in the purchase of corn, but this loan of 3000 nuevos soles, an amount which she has promised to repay punctually in five months' time, is destined for the purchase of bulls. Alicia will fatten them and sell them at the Pilcuyo market. The profit will make it possible for her to build a house in Chipana for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bulls

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: Susana tiene 56 años y vive con su  hijo. Trabaja cada día para progresar en todas las cosas que está dispuesta a realizar, es por ello que decidió emprender su propio restaurante con los ahorros que tenía, se asoció con su madre para trabajar juntas y repartirse las ganancias. La labor de Susana empieza los fines de semana cuando compra los ingredientes y víveres para los platos que va a preparar y todos los demás días  en la mañana prepara los alimentos para venderlos a medio día, también ofrecer desayunos y usualmente cena. Susana está muy animada para seguir adelante, ya van 3 años de haber iniciado su negocio y está dando buenos resultados. Para el futuro Susana  está planificando mejorar su restaurante y arrendar un local más amplio y elegante. Es la segunda vez que está solicitando un préstamo con MFP, ella es una cliente muy puntual en sus pagos y  le agrada reunirse con su banco comunal porque le ha enseñado un valor muy importante, que es el ahorro. El dinero que requiere es para implementar su negocio con la comprar nuevos juegos de mesas y sillas, valorizados en 250 soles cada uno, ella comprara 2 juegos.
texts.en:
Susana is 56 years old and lives with her son. She works every day in order to progress in any way she can. Because of this she decided to start up her own restaurant with the savings she had. She partnered with her mother to work together and share the profits. Susana's work starts on the weekends when she buys the ingredients and supplies for the dishes that she is going to prepare on the following days. In the mornings she prepares the meals to be sold at mid-day; she also offers breakfast and usually dinner. Susana is very motivated to get ahead; it has already been 3 years since starting her business and it is giving good results. For the future Susana is planning to improve her restaurant and rent a larger and more elegant location. This is the second time that she has requested a loan through MFP. She is a very punctual client with her payments and appreciates partnering with her communal bank because it has taught her a very important value, which is savings. The funds she needs are to be used to set up her business with the purchase of new sets of tables and chairs, costing 250 soles each. She will buy 2 sets.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase furniture for her business

loans.name: Carolina Guadalupe

texts.es: Carolina Guadalupe B. de Rosales reside en el municipio de Apopa junto a su esposo, su madre  e hijos. Carolina a pesar de no haber cursado ni  la primaria ha sacado adelante su negocio por más de diez años, especializándose en la panadería, y actualmente amplió sus ventas y ha montado un pequeño depósito de bebidas. Carolina y su esposo solicitan un crédito para surtir más de bebidas su tienda y abastecerse de materia prima para su panadería, ya que el precio de esta ha subido en el mercado. Este crédito les permitirá percibir más ganancias para mantenerse económicamente a flote.
texts.en:
Carolina Guadalupe B. de Rosales lives in the municipality of Apopa with her husband, mother and children. Despite not having attended elementary school, Carolina has gotten ahead with her business for over ten years. She has a bakery and has recently expanded her business to include beverage sales. Carolina and her husband are requesting this loan in order to fill their shop with more beverages and to obtain the ingredients they need for their bakery. This loan will allow them to earn greater profits so that they can stay economically afloat.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods for their bakery and beverage shop

location.town: Apopa en el departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Esperanza Mirtala

texts.en:
Esperanza Mirtala H. lives in the Dolores canton of the Ilopango municipality. Her small business consists of the traveling sale of the typical candies she produces in her home. The candies are traditional and she sells them at a very low price. Esperanza lives with her young son. Up to now his monthly food and housing expenses have not allowed him to receive an adequate education, a fact that fills Esperanza with sadness, but at the same time gives her the courage and impetus to improve her life. Esperanza requests a loan to buy raw materials and expand her business, allowing her to direct her life toward a promising future.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

Esperanza Mirtala H. vive en el cantón Dolores en el municipio de Ilopango. Su pequeño negocio, es una venta ambulante de dulces típicos, que ella misma fabrica en su casa, los dulces son tradicionales y los vende a un muy bajo precio. Esperanza vive con un hijo pequeño, aún menor de edad. Hasta el momento sus múltiples gastos mensuales de vivienda y comida, han impedido que su hijo reciba la educación adecuada, hecho que llena a Esperanza tanto de tristeza, como de valor y aliento para superarse. Esperanza solicita un préstamo para comprar materia prima, extender su negocio y encaminar su vida a un futuro prometedor.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her candy business.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
La señora Aurora es socia del Banco Comunal “Las estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca”, D. la comunidad D. Chipana, distrito D. Pilcuyo, Provincia D. El Collao, Departamento D. Puno; D. 46 años D. edad, tiene cinco hijos, y es casada y posee estudios D. secundaria completa.
Trabaja hace tres años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos e inicio su negocio D. compra y venta en abarrotes su primer préstamo fue D. S/.300.00 nuevos soles que los invirtió en la compra D. abarrotes como sacos D. arroz, azúcar y otros.
Con este préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, monto que destinará a comprar por mayor abarrotes ya que ella desea tener más mercadería para aumentar las ventas, también menciona que desea poner combustible, D. esta manera contribuirá a mejorar la calidad educativa D. sus hijos; asimismo se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo en cinco cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Ms. Aurora is a member of the “Las Estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca“ Microfinance Institute in the community of Chipana, district of Pilcuyo, El Collao province in the department of Puno. She is a 46-year-old married mother with 5 children. She completed high school.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three years. She started her general store business with her first 300.00 PEN loan, which she invested in purchasing groceries like sacks of rice, sugar, and other goods.

With this 3,000.00 PEN loan, she will purchase more groceries because she wants to boost sales. She also states that she would like to sell fuel, thus she can contribute to the improvement of her children’s quality of education. She promises to make her payments on time in five monthly installments.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
La señora Aurora es socia del Banco Comunal “La Juleñita” del distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chuchito, en el departamento de Puno; tiene 48 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y con 01 hija a su cuidado, posee estudios de primaria incompleta. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 09 años, ella refiere que su negocio es la venta de comida al paso (“salchimote”); su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir maíz para la preparación de sus platos al paso.
Con este préstamo de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que se compromete a paga en 04 cuotas mensuales; dicho préstamo le servirá para mantener su capital; con ello podrá comprar mas maíz para continuar preparando comidas al paso; las ganancias las viene invirtiendo en la educación de su hija, puesto que anhela sacar profesional a su hija; asimismo en el futuro piensa comprarse un auto para uso de transporte de pasajeros. 
Ella se muestra muy agradecida por el apoyo que Manuela Ramos viene brindando a las mujeres.
texts.en:
Ms. Aurora M. is a member of the “La Juleñita” Microfinance Institute in the district of Juli, Province of Chuchito, in the department of Puno. She is a 48-year-old mother with a live-in partner and 1 daughter under her care. She was unable to complete elementary school.
