She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 9 years. She has a street food business in which she sells “salchimote” (Peruvian dish made of fried corn and sliced sausages). She used her first 300.00 PEN loan to obtain corn to prepare her meals.

With this 300.00 PEN loan, which she commits to repaying in 4 monthly installments, she will purchase more corn to keep preparing her street food. She has been investing the profits in her daughter’s education because she dreams of her one day becoming a professional. In the future, she is planning on purchasing a vehicle that she will use for public transportation.

She is very grateful for the help that Manuela Ramos has been giving to women.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more corn for street food preparation

loans.name: Lisset Guadalupe

texts.es: Lisset Guadalupe M.  vive en el municipio de Cojutepeque en la zona oriental de El Salvador . Lisset vive con su esposo y dos hijos aún pequeños. A sus 28 años Lisset se anima  aprender lo básico en cosmetología, para así  instalar una pequeña sala de belleza en su propia casa,  ya que se les era imposible subsistir solo con el sueldo de su esposo. Para incrementar sus ingresos  Lissett ha surtido su sala de belleza con productos básicos para el cuidado del caballo; pues sus clientes aprovechan en comprarlos cuando están recibiendo sus servicios de sala de belleza. Actualmente Lisset pide solicita un crédito para ampliar la   variedad de sus productos y así incrementar sus ventas .
texts.en:
Lisset Guadalupe M. lives in the municipality of Cojutepeque, in the zone of El Salvador. Lesset lives with her husband and two young children. At the young age of 28, she is learning the basics about cosmetology. This way she will be able to open her own business from her home, since living off her husband's salary is not possible. In order to increase her profit, she has added beauty products such as shampoos, conditioners. This way her clients are able to purchase these products while getting a haircut, etc. She currently requests this loan in order to puchase more products, this way increase her sales.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hair products for her beauty salon

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Gladys Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Gladys es socia del Banco Comunal “La Juleñita” del distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chuchito, en el departamento de Puno; tiene 33 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y con 03 hijos a su cuidado, posee estudios de secundaria completa 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 5.5 (cinco años y medio) años, ella refiere que su negocio es la compra y venta de y los bordados en bayeta; su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir maíz como insumo básico en la preparación de sus platos.
Con este préstamo de S/ 700.00 nuevos soles el mismo que se compromete a pagar en 06 cuotas mensuales; dicho préstamo le será útil en la compra de maíz; por otro lado también podrá adquirir bayeta para seguir haciendo bordados; ella tiene el sueño de tener su propio local de comida al paso; por ello viene juntando todas sus ganancias a fin de lograr sus sueños. 
Ella se muestra muy agradecida a los créditos que viene otorgando Manuela Ramos para el desarrollo de las mujeres.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the "La Juleñita” Community Bank of the Juli district, Chuchito province in the Puno department. She is 33 years old, lives with her partner and three children. She has a high school education. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for five and a half years. She notes that her business is buying and selling embroidered cloth. Her first loan was for 300 soles with which she was able to acquire maize as her basic ingredient for the preparation of her dishes. With this loan of 700 soles, she has promised to repay it in six monthly installments. This loan will be useful to purchase maize. It will also let her acquire cloth so she may continue embroidering. She has a dream to have her own restaurant. For this, she is gathering all of her earnings to achieve her dreams. She demonstrates that she is grateful for the loans that Manuela Ramos has granted for the development of women.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase maize and also to allow her to acquire cloth to continue making embroidery.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es:
El señor José Luis M. y su esposa la señora Patricia Juárez tienen una bonita familia de 2 hijos menores de edad y los cuales están estudiando. 
  A su vivienda le está haciendo falta un cuarto al frente para sus niños tengan su propio espacio y vivan mejor, es por eso que solicita esté préstamo para realizar la mejora lo mas pronto posible. Planea pagarlo con sus ingresos como ingeniero de instalación de Internet.
texts.en:
José Luis M. and his wife Patricia Juárez have a beautiful family of 2 young children who are in school. Their house needs a front bedroom so that their children will have their own space and have better living conditions. For this reason he is requesting a loan in order to carry out this improvement as soon as possible. He plans to pay this loan with his income as an Internet installation engineer.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Add a front bedroom to their home

loans.name: María

texts.es:
La señora María es socia del Banco Comunal “Miraflores”, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; de 41 años de edad, tienen 04 hijos, y es casada; asimismo posee estudios de primaria completa.
Trabaja hace 01 año con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su negocio es la compra y venta de productos de la región (chuño, habas, quesos, etc) en los mercados de Arequipa, su primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 nuevos soles que le sirvió parar más mercadería.
Con este prèstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 03 meses de manera puntual, el dinero lo destinará en la compra de más mercadería (chuño, quesos, etc.), para venderlos en los mercados de Arequipa; ello le servirá para poder ayudar en los estudios de sus hijos y en el bienestar de su hogar.
Ella agradece a Manuela Ramos por el apoyo que  viene brindando en el desarrollo de las mujeres en el campo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria is a member of Banco Comual “Miraflores”, in Pilcuyo ,El Collao, Puno. She is 41 years old, has 4 children and is married. She has an elementary school education. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for a year, and her business is the purchasing and selling of regional products (chuño, lima beans, cheeses, etc.) in the various markets in Arequipa. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which she used to purchase merchandise. With this loan of 800 PEN, an amount she is committed to paying back promptly in 3 months, she will purchase more merchandise to sell in Arequipa’s markets. This will help her pay for her children’s schooling and the upkeep of her home. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for her support, which is promoting the development of rural women.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing more merchandise to sell in Arequipa’s markets.  This will help her pay for her children’s schooling and the upkeep of her home.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia es socia del Banco Comunal “Las estrellitas Unidas del Titicaca”, sector dos, en la comunidad D. Chipana, distrito D. Pilcuyo, Provincia D. El Collao, Departamento D. Puno; D. 45 años D. edad, tienen cuatro hijos, y es casada y posee estudios D. primaria incompleta (cuarto D. primaria).
Trabaja hace un año con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su negocio es la compra y venta D. animales menores (ovejas) su primer préstamo fue D. S/.300.00 nuevos soles que los invirtió en la compra D. animales (ovejas).
Con este préstamo D. S/. 1800.00 Nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 05 meses D. manera puntual, el dinero lo destinará a compra D. toros maltones para engordarlos y venderlos en la feria D. Pilcuyo o Ilave, D. esta manera contribuirá en la educación superior D. sus hijos y en sustento familiar diario.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Community Bang "The United Small Stars of Titicaca", second sector, in the community of Chipana, district of Pilcuyo, Province of El Collao, Department of Puno. Aged 45, she has four children and is married. She didn't complete her primary studies, but did reach fourth graD.. For the last year she has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement. Her business is the purchase and the sale of young animals (sheep), and her first loan was for 300 Soles which she invested in purchasing the animals (sheep). With this loan of 1800 Soles, which she has promised to repay in five months in a punctual manner, the money will be destined to purchase bull calves in order to fatten them and then sell them at the market in Pilcuyo or Ilave. In this way she will be able to contribute to the further education of her children and the family's daily sustenance needs.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase young calves to fatten and sell at market.

loans.name: Martha Judith

texts.es:
La señora Martha es socia del Banco Comunal “Miraflores”, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; de 34 años de edad, tiene 03 hijos, es conviviente y posee estudios de superior completa (técnico en turismo).
Trabaja hace 01 año con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su negocio es la Panadería, su primer préstamo fue de S/.500.00 nuevos soles que le sirvió para adquirir insumos y elaborar panes de diferentes variedades. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 03 meses de manera puntual, el dinero le servirá para poder adquirir más insumos (harina, azúcar, etc.) para continuar su negocio y elaborar más panes. Las ganancias le servirán para poder ahorrar y ampliar su negocio, así como comprarse una amasadora industrial para facilitar su trabajo. 
Ella se siente muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por el apoyo que viene brindando.
texts.en:
Martha is part of the Communal Bank “Miraflores” located in the district of Pilcuyo, in the province of Collao. She is 34 years old, has three children, and has specialized training in tourism. She has worked for one year with the Manuela Ramos Movement. Her business is a bakery, and her first loan was for 500 new soles, which she used to acquire the resources to make her different varieties of bread. With this loan of 500 new soles, which Martha will repay in three months, she will acquire more resources (flour, sugar, ect.) in order to continue her business and make more bread. The earnings will allow her to save and grow her business with the purchase of a mixing machine. Martha feels very appreciative to the Manuela Ramos Movement for its support.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of more ingredients (flour and sugar) to grow her business and save and buy a mixer.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
La señora Hermelinda es socia del Banco Comunal “La Juleñita” del distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chuchito, en el departamento de Puno; tiene 32 años de edad,  de estado civil conviviente, tiene a su cuidado 02 hijos y posee estudios de secundaria incompleta (segundo de secundaria)
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 06 años, posee un negocio de venta de productos de entretenimiento (CDs musicales, videos, Vds., casetes reproductores, etc) así como artículos de aseo y limpieza (detergentes, jabones, etc.); su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir más mercadería para su negocio.
Con este préstamo de S/ 2500.00 nuevos soles el mismo que lo pagará en 06 cuotas mensuales; dicho préstamo le servirá para poder incrementar mercadería en su negocio (adquirir mas CDs y artículos de limpieza); así como para poder adquirir materiales (lana, bayeta, etc.) para realizar trabajo en artesanías en épocas de pedidos; de esta manera ella ampliará su negocio y con las ganancias podrá comprar una casa en el futuro y ayudará en la educación de sus hijos
Ella agradece de sobremanera a Manuela Ramos por el apoyo brindado a las mujeres en este tipo de actividades.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is a member of the Communal Bank “ La Julenita” of the district of Juli, in the Province of Chuchito. She is 32 years old, lives with her partner and her two children, and has an incomplete high school education. She has worked with the Manela Ramos Movement for 6 years, and has her own business selling entertainment products such as music CD’s, videos, and cassettes. Also, she sells cleaning supplies like detergents and soaps. Her first loan was for 300 new soles with which she was able to acquire more merchandize for her business. With this loan of 2,500 new soles, which she will repay in six monthly installments, she will purchase more merchandize for her business. The increase in sales will help her buy materials like wool and cloth to expand her business to the production of artisan products for order. With this business model Hermelinda hopes to increase her profits so as to one day buy a house and help with the costs of her children’s education. Hermelinda is extremely appreciative of the Muanuela Ramos Movement for their support of women in this type of work.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Puchase of merchandize (Cd's, videos, and cassettes)

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “Miraflores”, distrito D. Pilcuyo, Provincia D. El Collao, Departamento D. Puno; D. 52 años D. edad, tiene 05 hijos, es casada y no posee estudios.
Trabaja hace 02 años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su negocio es la compra, engorD. y venta D. ganado vacuno, su primer préstamo fue D. S/.500.00 nuevos soles que le sirvió para adquirir alimento balanceado para engordar sus vacunos. 
Con este préstamo D. S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 03 meses D. manera puntual, el dinero le servirá para poder adquirir ganado (02 toros) y continuar dedicándose al engorD. y venderlos en las ferias ganaderas D. Pilcuyo o Ilave. Las ganancias le servirán para poder ayudar en los estudios superiores D. sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank “Miraflores” located in the district of Pilcuyo, in the province of El Collao. She is 52 years old, has five children, is married, and has no education. She has worked for 2 years with the Manuela Ramos Movement. Her business consists of the purchase, raising, and sale of cattle. Her first loan was for 500 new soles and that helped her purchase feed for her cattle. With this loan of 2000 new soles, which will be repaid in three months, Rosa will purchase two bulls, and continue raising her other cattle and sell them at the fairs. Her earnings from that will allow her to help with the costs of her children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchas of 2 bulls and feed for her cattle

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “La Juleñita” del distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chuchito, en el departamento de Puno; tiene 33 años de edad,   tiene a su cuidado 3 hijos y posee estudios de secundaria completa 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 06 años, posee un negocio de venta de repuestos; su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir mercadería (mas repuestos) para su negocio.
Con este préstamo de S/ 2800.00 nuevos soles el mismo que lo pagará en 06 cuotas mensuales; dicho préstamo le servirá para poder incrementar mercadería en su negocio y de esta manera incrementar la capacidad de su tienda; con ello piensa obtener mejores ganancias las que piensa invertir aún más en su negocio y en la educación de sus hijos, puesto que están en edad escolar.
 Ella se compromete a pagar su préstamo, tal como lo hizo anteriormente y agradece de sobremanera a Manuela Ramos por su apoyo a las mujeres.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank “La Julenita” in the district of Juli in the province of Chuchito. She is 33 years old, has three children, and has a high school education. She has worked with the Manuel Ramos Movement for 6 years, and has her own business selling spare parts. Her first loan was for 300 new soles and she used it to purchase merchandize for her business. With this loan of 2,800 new soles, which Rosa will repay in 6 monthly installments, she will purchase and sell more products with the purpose of expanding her business. She hopes to increase her income, and with that invest back into her business and the education of her children. Rosa promises to repay her loan, just like she did with her last one, and she sends her thanks to the Manuela Rosa movement for their support of women.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandize (spare parts) for retail

loans.name: Edilberta

texts.es:
Edilberta es socia del Banco Comunal Pura Vida.
Edilberta es viuda, tiene 55 años y 10 hijos, Edilberta vende golosinas, frutas en la puerta de un colegio ubicado en el distrito de Carmen Alto, Edilberta también se dedica a la crianza de animales como gallina, conejo.
Edilberta necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de chocolates, galletas, caramelos.
Edilberta sueña con terminar de construir su casa, tener una tienda y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Edilberta is a member of the Communal Bank “Pura Vida”. She is 55 years old, a widow, and has 10 children. She sells small treats and fruits near the entrance of a high school located in the district of Carmen Alto. Edilberta also breeds and raises animals such as chickens and rabbits. She needs a loan of 1,000 new soles to purchase more merchandize such as chocolates, cookies, and candies for her retail business. Edilberta dreams of finishing the construction of her house, owning her own store, and helping her children reach the culmination of there studies.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chocolates, cookies, and candies

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.es:
La señora Antonieta pertenece al banco comunal “Las Brisas” vive en el  Jr. Mariscal Cáceres Nº 116, distrito y provincia de Bellavista y departamento de San Martín. Tiene 46 años y es madre de 3 hijos 1 es mayor de edad y 2 aun dependen de ella, es conviviente,  Antonieta con el primer prestamo de S/ 300.00 decide invertir en la venta de menú que es a lo que se dedica, tiene 8 años trabajando con el banco.

En la actualidad cuenta con una casita propia local donde vende comida junto a su pareja que le apoya constantemente, dicho negocio le permite un ingreso diario con lo que puede pagar el prestamo puntualmente.

Con este prestamo de S/ 1, 000 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprara arroz, azúcar en sacos , leche, conservas en cajas, etc., para poder preparar el menú diario y  atender a sus clientes que son muy exigentes, además comprara materiales para mejorar su casa donde atiende diariamente.

Antonieta esta muy contenta de todo lo que ha logrado con el apoyo de Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Antonieta belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Brisas” and lives on Jr. Mariscal Cacere N 116 in the district and province of Bellavista. She is 46 years old, and the mother three children. One is older, but she still cares for two of them, and lives with her parnter. Antonieta used her first loan of 300 new soles to invest in the sale of homemade food, which she has done for 8 years through the bank. She has a little house where she sells her meals with the help of her partner. This business allows her to maintain a daily income with which she uses to pay back her loan payments. With this loan of 1,000 new soles, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy rice, sugar, milk, jars, ect. to be able to make the daily specials and attend to her clients who are very demanding. In addition to that she will buy materials to improve her home which is also her restaurant. Antonieta is very happy about everything she has achieved with the help of the Manuela Ramos Movement.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, milk, jars, ect. to be able to make the daily specials

loans.name: Corazon De Jesús Group

texts.es: El grupo de mujeres con el nombre de Corazón de Jesús dicho grupo es originario de la comunidad del cantón Cojxac del Departamento de Totonicapán  ellas vienen trabajdo desde hace cinco años en la elaboracion de canastas de plasticos, dicho producto  lo vende en el departamento de Huehuetenanfo y Mazatenango, el grupo corazon de Jesús a visitado varias entidades en solicitar un credito la cual se le ha denegado  porque los requisitos son demasiados, ella escucharon un anuncio por la radio que en la Asociación Asdir dan creditos Grupales  y ello nos visita para poderlos ayudar con un credito, que con ello le permiteria aumentar su capital de trabajo y poder surtir su mercaderia, para las epocas de semana Santa, y con los ingresos que obtiene le permite a cada una de las integrantes del grupo llevar bienestar a los miembros de su familia.
texts.en:
The "Heart of Jesus" group of women are natives of the community in the district of Cojxac in the Department of Totonicapan. They have been working for the last five years in the manufacture of plastic containers, the product which they sell in the department of Huehuetenango and Mazatenango. The "Heart of Jesus" group visited various organisations looking for credit, which they were refused because the conditions were too demanding. Then, they heard an announcement on the radio that Asdir Association was giving out group credits and so they visited us so we could help them with a loan, which would permit them to increase their work capital and to stock-up their merchandise for the Easter period. With the income they obtain, this will permit every member of the group to ensure the well-being of the family members.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work Capital

loans.name: Belcka Marilin

texts.es:
La señora Belcka pertenece al banco comunal “Las Brisas”, vive en el barrio Inti yacu – Nva Esperanza, del distrito de Bellavista, provincia Bellavista, departamento San Martín. Tiene 26 años y es madre de 2 hijos quienes todavía dependen de ella, es casada, su esposo trabaja repartiendo alimento para cerdos. 
Belcka con el primer préstamo adquirido decide invertir en compra de chanchos lo que realiza desde hace 4 años.

En la actualidad compra chanchos pequeños y los cría en un corral en la casa de su suegra, lo que los vende al por mayor y menor en el mercado de su ciudad  y a los vecinos, esto genera ganancias mensuales lo que permite pagar el prestamo con puntualidad.

Con este prestamo de S/.1, 000 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprara una chancha (madre) de raza, lo que le permitirá aumentar su crianza.

Belcka refiere que el banco le ha permitido progresar e independizar sus ganancias por lo que esta muy agradecida.
texts.en:
Belcka belongs to the community bank "The Breezes", and lives in the Inti Yacu suburb of Nueva Esperanza town, in the district of Bellavista, in the province of Bellavista, in the department of San Martin. She is 26 years old and is the mother of 2 children who are still dependent on her. She is married and her husband works delivering food for pigs. Belcka used the first loan she acquired to invest in the purchase of pigs, her occupation for the last four years. Currently, she buys piglets and raises them in a pen in the house of her mother-in-law, and then sells them both wholesale and retail, in her town market and to her neighbours. This generates a monthly income which permits her to pay back her loan punctually. With this loan of 1000 soles, which will be repaid in six months, she will buy a sow-pig (breeding pig), which will permit her to increase her livestock numbers. Belcka remarks that the bank has allowed her to progress and make independent earnings, for which she is very grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a sow to use for breeding stock

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes.
Victoria es separada, tiene 39 años y 3 hijos, Victoria viaja a las ferias de la región 2 veces por semana en donde compra carneros, cerdos, luego los beneficia en su casa y lo vende en los restaurantes, sus ventas son al crédito.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 2700 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerdos y carneros.
Los sueños de Victoria son tener casa propia, una carnicería.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Community Group, 'Tulipanes'. Victoria is separated, she is 39 years old and has 3 kids. She travels to the region's markets twice a week to buy rams and pigs which she later prepares at home and sells them in restaurants. She makes sales on credit. Victoria needs a loan of 2700 soles; money which will be invested in buying pigs and rams. Victoria's dream is to have her own house and a butcher shop.

Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes. Victoria es separada, tiene 39 años y 3 hijos, Victoria viaja a las ferias de la región 2 veces por semana en donde compra carneros, cerdos, luego los beneficia en su casa y lo vende en los restaurantes, sus ventas son al crédito. Victoria necesita un préstamo de 2700 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerdos y carneros. Los sueños de Victoria son tener casa propia, una carnicería.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs and rams/Para la compra de cerdos y carneros.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
La señora Betty pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”, vive en la calle las flores de Las Brisas de Tarapotillo, distrito de Tarapoto, departamento de San Martín. Tiene 35 años y es madre de 2 niños. Es casada, su esposo se dedica al transporte (motocarrista). Con el primer prestamo de S/. 300 decide invertir en bolsas para chupetes, un conservador, refrescos, algunos artículos como papel higiénico, peines, etc,  que los ofrecía en el campo deportivo frente a su casa. Tiene 8 años trabajando con el banco.

En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega en su propia casa, donde vende abarrotes, frutas de todas las variedades, perfumería, artículos para regalo, etc.
Esto le genera ganancias diarias lo que le facilita el pago puntual de las cuotas del banco.

Con este prestamo de S/2,500 que será pagado en 6 meses, comprara sandalias de distintas calidades y tallas, toallas, sombrillas en docenas, que son productos que todavía le falta en el negocio y son pedidos de sus clientes.

Betty refiere su alegría de salir adelante y progresar gracias al apoyo del Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Miss Betty belongs to "Los Eucaliptos" Bank. She lives on Flores de las Briasa Tarapotillo street, Tarapoto district, San Martin department. She is 35 years old and has two children. She is married and her husband is a taxi driver. With the first loan of S./300 she will purchase bags for lollipops, a cooler for sodas, some personal hygene products, combs, etc. which she will be selling on the sports field across from her home. She has been working with the bank for 8 years.

In reality she has her own mini-mart at home in which she sells groceries, fruits, perfume, gifts, etc. These give her enough earnings to pay off her loans at the bank.

With the loan of S/2,500 which will be paid back in 6 months, she will purchase sandals of various qualities and sizes, towels, unbrellas by the dozen. These are all products requested by clients but she lacks at her business.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sandals, towels, umbrellas and other needs for her store.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Carmen pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Brisas”, vive en la  Av. Lima s/n, D. distrito y provincia D. Bellavista, Departamento D. San Martín. Tiene 42 años y es madre D. 3 hijos, 1 es mayor D. edad y 2 aun dependen D. ella. Es casada su esposo se dedica a la construcción D. viviendas.
Carmen se inicio  con ayuda D. su esposo solo con S/ 100.00 lo que deciD. invertir en venta D. refrigerios en una mesita al frente D. su casa. Tiene 5 años trabajando con el banco el que le ha ayudado para implementar mejor su negocio.

En la actualidad cuenta con un local propio frente al hospital D. la cuidad, donD. ofrece refrigerios, comida y todo tipo D. bebidas gasificadas a los que acuden a dicho nosocomio y transeúntes, esto le permite un ingreso diario con el cual paga las letras D. banco con puntualidad.

Con este prestamo D. S/ 3.000 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprara bebidas como gaseosas, agua mineral en paquete y además, mantequilla en cajas, harina y azúcar en sacos, etc, para la preparación D. bocaditos, lo que le permitirá ofrecer variedad a sus clientes.

Carmen, esta muy agradecida con el Banco Comunal por que le permite realizarse como mujer.
texts.en:
Carmen belongs to the Community Group 'Las brisas', and she lives on Lima Avenue s/n, in the district and province of Bellavista, in the Department of San Martin. She is 42 years old and has 3 kids. One is an adult and 2 still depend on her. She is married and her husband works in housing construction.

Carmen started with the help of her husband and with only 10000 soles which she decided to invest in selling soft drinks from a table in front of her house. She has been working with the group for 5 years and it has helped her to stock her business.

She now has her own stall in front of the city's hospital where she serves soft drinks, food and fizzy drinks to all those who go to the hospital as well as passers-by. This gives her a daily income with which she pays the group punctually.

With this loan of 3000 soles which she will repay over a period of 6 months, she will buy drinks like fizzy drinks, minieral water in bottles and more, tubs of butter, flour and sacks of sugar etc to prepare snacks which will allow her to offer her clients more variety.

Carmen is very grateful to the Community Group as it allows her to fulfill herself as a woman.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy drinks like fizzy drinks and bottled mineral water and more, as well astubs of butter, flour and sacks of sugar to make snacks which will allow her to offer her clients more variety/comprar bebidas como gaseosas, agua mineral en paquete y además, mantequilla en cajas, harina y azúcar en sacos, etc, para la preparación de bocaditos, lo que le permitirá ofrecer variedad a sus clientes

loans.name: Angeles De La Paz Group

texts.es:
El Banco Ángeles D. la Paz inicia su tercer ciclo con  16 socias. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. comida, verduras, frutas, bebidas, ferretería, abarrotes en general y brindan servicio D. taxi.

Como es el caso D. Francisca que es separada, tiene 60 años y 4 hijos, Francisca venD. comida D. manera ambulatoria y también en ferias, tiene una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes en su casa. Francisca necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz y azúcar.

Mientras que Maria es casada, tiene 45 años y 3 hijos, Maria se dedica a la compra y venta D. verduras. Maria necesita un préstamo D. 300 soles que invertirá en la compra D. zanahoria, cebolla.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles,  haciendo un total D. 12,800 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, aceite, tomate, cebolla, gallina, cerdos, plátano, naranja, manzana.

Los sueños D. las socias son construir su casa, ampliar sus negocios y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
The Community Bank 'Angeles D. la Paz' ('Angels of Peace') is starting its third cycle with 16 members.

The members have different types of businesses like selling food, vegetables, fruit, drinks, hardware, groceries in general and offering a taxi service.

In Francisca's case, she is separated and is 60 years old with 4 kids. Francisca sells food on foot and also in markets, and she has a small grocery stO. in her house. Francisca needs a loan of 900 soles; money that she will invest in buying rice and sugar.

In Maria's case, she is married, 45 years old and has 3 kids. Maria dedicates herself to buying and selling vegetables. Maria needs a loan of 300 soles which she will invest in buying carrots and onions.

The members need different loan amounts like 300 soles, 600 soles and 900 soles, making a total of 12,800 soles of loans for the Community Bank.

Their loans will be invested in buying rice, sugar, oil, tomatoes, onions, hens, pigs, plantain, oranges and apples.

The members' dreams are to build houses, enlarge their businesses and for their kids to finish their studies.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, tomato, onion, hens, pigs, plantain, oranges and apples/Para la compra de  arroz, azúcar, aceite, tomate, cebolla, gallina, cerdos, plátano, naranja, manzana.

loans.name: Dinora Elena

texts.es:
La señora Dinora pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Paz II”, vive en el pasaje Leoncio Prado s/n – AAHH. Las Brisas del Cumbaza, distrito de Tarapoto, departamento de San Martín. Tiene 22 años y es madre de una niña. Es conviviente, su pareja trabaja como docente quien le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Con el primer prestamo de S/ 300 decide invertir en un  teléfono para brindar atención de llamadas a los vecinos del lugar. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco.

Actualmente cuenta con un locutorio un su propia casa, brinda atención de llamadas a celular y teléfono fijo aprovechando que en el lugar no existe un servicio como este, esto le permite un ingreso diario para poder pagar las cuotas del banco.

Con el prestamo de S/. 1,500 que será pagado en 4 meses comprara tarjetas para teléfono celular  y otro celular que le permita dar mayor atención a sus clientes ya que solo cuenta con uno.

Dinora agradece la oportunidad al Banco Comunal de realizarse como persona y poner su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Dinora belongs to the Community Bank 'La Paz II', and she lives in the pasaje Leonicio Prado s/n - AAHH. Las Brisas del Cumbaza, in the district of Tarapoto, in the department of San Martin. She is 22 years old and she has a daughter. She lives with her partner who works as a teacher and whom she helps with the household costs. With the first loan of 300 soles she decided to invest in a telephone to offer a telephone service to her neighbors. She has been working with the Bank for 2 years.

She currently has a telephone booth in her house and takes calls from cell phones and landlines, taking advantage of the fact that there is no other service like this in the area. This gives her a daily income so that she can pay the Bank's installments.

With the loan of 1500 soles, which she will repay over a period of 4 months, she will buy phone cards for cell phones and another phone which will allow her to serve her clients better as she currently only has one phone.

Dinora is grateful for the opportunity that the Community Bank has given her to fulfill herself as a person and in having her own business.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cell phone cards and another cell phone which will allow her to serve her clients better as she currently only has one phone/Comprar tarjetas para teléfono celular  y otro celular que le permita dar mayor atención a sus clientes ya que solo cuenta con uno.

loans.name: Tomasa  Dolores

texts.es: Doña Tomasa es originaria de la comunidad de Chiyax Primero del departamento de Totonicapán seún la hitoria esta comunidad es conocida como la zona diez de Totonicapan  en aquel tiempo existia una tiene de consumo diario donde uno conseguia su producto por diez centavos, en esta comunidad se encuentra un lugar llamado las cuevas de San Miguel  en aquellos tiempo  cuando la iglesia Catolica de Totonicapan  sequemo vieron los vecinos salir un angel de la iglesia ha ese  lugar hoy fecha muchas personas visitan este lugar, es lo que nos conto doña Tomasa al momento de hacerle el estudio economico de su credito, doña tomasa vende calzado de damas y niños en el municipio de Salcaja Quetzaltenango y San Francisco el Alto hoy requiere de un credito  para ampliar su negocio, ya que es la epoca de inicio escolar dos mil nueve en donde hay mucha venta en la cual doña tomasa quiere aprovechar.
texts.en:
Tomasa is a native of the community of Chiyax Primero in the Department of Totnicapan. According to custom, this community is known as the tenth zone of Totnicapan and at some point in the past there used to exist a grocery shop where it used to be possible to buy products for just ten cents. In this community there is a place called "the Caves of St Michael" and in these times whilst the Catholic Church of Totonicapan was burning, the neighbours saw an angel leave the church and go towards the caves. Today, Tomasa told us whilst completing the economic assessment of her loan, many people visit this place. Tomasa sells women's and children's shoes in the town of Salcaja Quetzaltenango and San Francisco el Alto and today she needs a credit to expand her business, as it's the beginning of the 2009 School Year and as a result there a lot of sales of which Tomasa wants to take advantage.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Capital

loans.name: Elvia Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Elvia pertenece al Banco Comunal “La unión hace la fuerza”, vive en el Jr. Amorarca 228, del distrito de Tarapoto, departamento de San Martín, Tiene 42 años y  es madre de 3 hijos, 1 es mayor de edad y 2 todavía dependen de ella, es soltera. Hace muchos años empezó con venta de comida en un local de su propia casa.

Actualmente cuenta con una bodega donde vende abarrotes y artículos de primera necesidad, y además cabinas de Internet a donde acuden los vecinos y universitarios ya que esta muy cerca del lugar de estudios, esto le permite un ingreso diario que le ayuda a pagar el prestamo con puntualidad.

Con este prestamo de S/ 1,500 que será pagado en 6 meses,  comprara mercadería para la bodega como arroz en sacos, jabón en cajas, detergente, y bebidas gasificadas.

Elvia esta muy contenta de pertenecer a la familia de Manuela Ramos ya que le permite proyectarse y crecer como empresaria.
texts.en:
Elvia belongs to the Community Group 'La union hace la fuerza' ('Unity breeds strength'), and she lives on Jr. Amorarca 228, in the district of Tarapoto, in the department of San Martin. She is 42 years old and she has 3 kids, one of whom is an adult. The other 2 still depend on her. She is single. She started selling food from a stall in her house many years ago.

She now has a store where she sels groceries and primary need goods, as well as having internet booths where her neighbors and university students come as it is close to where they study. This gives her a daily income which helps her to repay her loan punctually.

With the loan of 1500 soles which she will repay over a period of 6 months, she will buy merchandise for the store, like sacks of rice, soap in boxes, detergent and fizzy drinks.

Elvia is very happy to belong to the Manuela Ramos family as it has allowed her to cast herself and grow as a businesswoman.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for the store like sacks of rice, soap in boxes, detergent and fizzy drinks/Comprar mercadería para la bodega como arroz en sacos, jabón en cajas, detergente, y bebidas gasificadas.

loans.name: Fraternidad Group

texts.es:
El Banco Fraternidad inicia su segundo ciclo con  14 socias. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta abarrotes en general, comida, frutas, cereales, ropa, venta D. animales y la agricultura.

Como es el caso D. Dolores que es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Dolores se dedica a la agricultura D. alfalfa, arverja que luego comercializa en el mercado D. abastos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Además Dolores tiene un pequeño taller D. confección D. prendas D. vestir.

Mientras que Juliana es casada, tiene 40 años y 5 hijos, Juliana venD. ropa en las diferentes ferias D. la región, y D. las ferias compra animales y cereales que comercializa en los mercados D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 1050 soles,  haciendo un total D. 6,450 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. semilla, papa, telas, mandiles, faldas, arroz, azúcar, fideo, frutas.

Los sueños D. las socias son educar a sus hijos, mejorar sus viviendas, tener una granja D. cuy y aumentar la producción en sus tierras.
texts.en:
The Bank 'Fraternidad' ('Brotherhood') is starting its second cycle with 14 members.

The members have different businesses like selling groceries in general, food, fruit, cereals, clothes, selling animals and in agriculture.

In Dolores's case she lives with her partner, is 30 years old and has 2 kids. Dolores dedicates herself to cultivating cress and carob beans which she later sells in the basic supply market in the city of Ayacucho. Moreover, Dolores has a small workshop making clothes.

In the case of Juliana, she is married and is 40 years old with 5 kids. Juliana sells clothes in the different markets of the region, and in the markets she buys animals and cereals which she sells in the markets in the city of Ayacucho.

The members need different loan amounts like 300 soles, 600 soles, 1050 soles, making a total of 6,450 soles in loans for the Community Bank.

Their loans will be invested in buying seeds, potatoes, material, aprons, skirts, rice, sugar, noodles and fruit.

The members' dreams are to educate their kids, improve their homes, have guinea pig farms and to increase their lands' production.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds, potatoe, materials, aprons, skirts, rice, sugar, noodles and fruit/la compra de semilla, papa, telas, mandiles, faldas, arroz, azúcar, fideo, frutas.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
La señora Esther pertenece al Banco Comunal “Maria Auxiliadora” vive en el  Jr. Rioja Nº 368 del distrito de Tarapoto, departamento de San Martín. Tiene 58 años y es madre de 6 hijos, 4 de ellos mayores de edad y 2 que aun dependen de ella. Es casada su esposo se dedica a la venta de ropa, recorriendo los pueblos mas lejanos. Con el prestamo de banco de S/. 300 decide invertir en carteras  y maletines para venderlos en el mercado.

En la actualidad cuenta con un local  donde coloca la mercadería que llega de Trujillo para luego venderlos a los vecinos y clientes que la conocen, y lo demás lo lleva a los pueblos a repartir en las tiendas al por mayor y menor sobre todo ropa interior para mayores y niños. Esto le genera suficientes  ganancias para pagar las cuotas mensuales del banco.

Con este prestamo de S/ 1,000 que será pagado en 4 meses, comprara ropa interior de todas las tallas modelos y colores en docenas, de tal manera que pueda tener variedad para ofertar a su clientela.

Esther refiere que el Banco Comunal es una excelente propuesta para las mujeres que desean trabajar y progresar
texts.en:
Esther belongs to the “Maria Auxiliadora" Community Bank. She lives in Jr. Rioja Nº 368 in the Tarapoto district, San Martín department. She is 58 years old and is mother to six children, four of whom are older and two who still depend on her. She is married. Her husband is dedicated to selling clothing, traveling to faraway towns. With the bank loan of S. 300, she decided to invest in handbags and suitcases in order to sell them in the market. Currently, she has a shop where good come from Trujillo and then she sells them to her neighbors and customers who she knows. The rest she takes to towns to distribute in stores at wholesale and retail prices. Mostly it's underwear for adults and children. This generates enough earnings to pay her monthly payments to the bank. With this loan of S. 1,000 which will be repaid in four months, she will buy underwear of all sizes and colors in dozens. In this manner, she can have variety to offer to her customers. Esther notes that the Community Bank is an excellent proposition for women who wish to work and progress.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy underwear of all sizes and colors in dozens. In this manner, she can have variety to offer to her customers.

loans.name: Euloly

texts.es:
La señora Euloly pertenece al banco comunal “Las Brisas” vive en el barrio Intiyacu – Nva Esperanza, del distrito de Bellavista, provincia Bellavista, departamento San Martín. Tiene 43 años y es madre de 3 hijos, 1 mayor de edad y 2 que aun dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja juntamente con ella en la elaboración de panes lo que iniciaron hace 2 años con el primer préstamo de S/ 300.00.

 En la actualidad sigue con el mismo negocio, y además venta de artículos de primera necesidad en un local de su casa, lo que genera ingresos para pagar el préstamo con puntualidad.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, el cual será pagado en 6 meses comprara harina, azúcar, mantequilla en sacos para  la preparación de los panes y además  gaseosas, y otras bebidas. 

Euloly esta muy agradecida con el banco por el apoyo y manifiesta que es un apoyo para todas aquellas mujeres que desean salir adelante.
texts.en:
Euloly belongs to the "Las Brisas" community bank. She lives in the neighbourhood of Intiyacu-Nva Esperanza in the district of Bellavista, in the province of Bellavista of the department of San Martín. She is 43 years old and the mother of three: she has one adult child and two children still dependent on her. She is married and her husband works with her to bake breads, a business they began two years ago with their first loan of S/300.00 soles. She still has the bakery business and now also sells staple foods from part of her home, which generates income to repay her loan on time. With this S/. 1,500.00 soles loan, which she will repay in six months, she will buy flour, sugar, butter in bulk in order to make breads, as well as soft drinks and other refreshments. Euloly is very grateful to the bank for their support and says that this is a support for all these women who want to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, butter in bulk in order to make breads, as well as soft drinks and other refreshments

loans.name: Ingrith

texts.es:
La señorita Ingrid pertenece al Banco Comunal “Maria Auxiliadora”, vive en el Jr. pasaje los Helechos Nº 103, Distrito de Tarapoto, departamento de San Martín. Tiene 26 años. Es soltera y estudia en una Universidad particular. Con el primer prestamo de S/ 300 decide invertir en el negocio que le dejaron sus padres comprando jabón en docenas, algunas marcas de shampoo, peines y otros. Tiene 4 años con el banco.

Actualmente cuenta con un stan muy surtido en el mercado principal de la ciudad, donde ofrece a sus clientes variedad de productos, y además artefactos y artículos  para regalos. 
Esto le genera ganancias diarias para pagar el prestamo puntualmente.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,100 que será pagado en 6 meses, comprara variedad de  perfumes y colonias de baño en docenas, para surtir un poco mejor el negocio.

Ingrid manifiesta su alegría de poder pertenecer a la familia de Manuela Ramos ya que le dieron la oportunidad de trabajar e crecer como persona y mujer.
texts.en:
Ingrid belongs to the "Maria Auxiliadora" community bank, and lives at No.103 Helecho Avenue, Tarapoto District, San Martin Department. She is 26 years old. She is single, and studies at a private University. With the first loan she received of 300 Soles, she decided to invest in the business her parents had left her, buying soap by the dozen and some brands of shampoo, combs and other such things. She has been a bank customer for four years. Currently, she has a very well-stocked stand in the town's principal market, where she offers her customers a variety of products and also things for gifts/ This generates her a daily income so she can repay her loan punctually. With this loan of 1 100 Soles which will be repaid within 6 months, she will buy a variety of perfumes and bath scents by the dozen, in order to stock her stall a little better. Ingrid makes clear her happiness at being able to belong to the Manuela Ramos family which has given her the opportunity to work and grow as both a human being and a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of perfumes and bath scents by the dozen to improve stock

loans.name: Lili

texts.es:
La señora Lili pertenece al Banco Comunal “La unión hace la fuerza” vive en el Jr. Manco Inca Nº 234, 9 D. Abril, distrito D. Tarapoto, y departamento D. San Martín. Tiene 56 años y es madre D. 3 hijos que aun dependen D. ella, es conviviente, su pareja trabaja como soldador en los pueblos y es quien le ayuda con los gastos D. la casa. Lili por iniciativa propia deciD. vender refrescos en el centro D. la ciudad lo que viene realizando desD. hace muchos años.

Actualmente sigue son el mismo negocio, viendo que muchas personas acuden al cementerio y es un lugar muy transitado deciD. ubicarse en la puerta, donD. sus clientes ya conocen el buen sabor D. sus bebidas esto le ayuda a obtener ganancias para poder pagar las cuotas del prestamo mensualmente.

Con este prestamo D. S/. 1,200 que será pagado en 6 meses, comprara 1 saco D. azúcar, 1 saco D. frejol soya, cebada en kilos, baldes nuevos, vasos y una mesa.

Lili manifiesta su alegría D. pertenecer a Manuela Ramos por el apoyo que le brinda.
texts.en:
Lili belongs to the Community Bank "Solidarity makes strength". She lives at No.234, Manco Inca and 9th of April avenues, in the district of Tarapoto and the Department of San Martin. She is 56 years old and is the mother of 3 children who are still dependent on her. She is a cohabitee and her partner works as a welder in the villages and it is he who helps her with the household expenses. Lili decided on her own initiative to sell soft drinks in the centre of the town, which she has been doing for many years now. Currently she is continuing with the same business, but seeing many peoplecoming and going to the cemetery where there is a lot of passing traffic she decided to locate herself at the cemetery door, where her customers know how good her drinks taste. This helps her to obtain an income with which to pay the monthly loan repayments. With this loan of 1200 soles which will be repaid in six months, she will buy one sack of sugar, one sack of soya beans, barley by the kilo, new buckets, glasses and a table. Lili has maD. clear her delight at belonging to Maunela Ramos for the help which they've given her.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, soya beans, barley, new buckets, glasses and a table

loans.name: Abejitas Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El Banco Abejitas Trabajadoras inicia su primer ciclo con  16 socias, muchas D. ellas viven en el mismo barrio. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. plásticos, comida, cosméticos por catálogos, verduras, frutas, abarrotes en general, ropa y pescado.

Como es el caso D. Aydee que es casada, tiene 31 años y 3 hijos, Aydee tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado en donD. venD. cebiche y chicharrones, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda D. sus hijas.

Mientras que Judith es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Judith tiene una bodega en su casa en donD. venD. verduras, abarrotes, carnes. Además Judith esta culminando sus estudios universitarios.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600soles,  haciendo un total D. 6,450 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. platos, ollas, azúcar, arroz, leche, cosméticos, cebolla, zanahoria, chompas, polos y frutas variadas.

Los sueños D. las socias son que sus hijos continúen sus estudios, ampliar su negocio, tener casa propia.
texts.en:
The Abejitas Trabajadoras (Little Worker Bees) microfinance institute is starting its first loan cycle with 16 members, many of whom live in the same neighborhood.

The members have different types of businesses, such as plastic sales, food sales, cosmetics by catalog, fruits, vegetables, provisions, clothing, and fish.

Aydee is a 31-year-old married mother with 3 children. She runs a restaurant in a rented business space, where she sells ceviche (citrus marinated fish) and pork rinds everyday with the help of her daughters.

Judith, on the other hand, is 30 years old, has a common law spouse and 2 children. She has a general store in her home where she sells vegetables, provisions and meat. Judith is also finishing her college degree.

The members of the group need different loan amounts—some 300.00 PEN, others 450.00 PEN, and still others 600.00 PEN—bringing the total to 6,450.00 PEN from the microfinance institute.

The loans will be invested in purchasing dishes, pots, sugar, rice, milk, cosmetics, onions, carrots, sweaters, T-shirts, and assorted fruit. The group members dream of helping their children continue with their studies, expanding their businesses, and owning their own houses.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dishes, pots, sugar, rice, milk, cosmetics, onions, carrots, sweaters, T-shirts, and assorted fruit

loans.name: Lludy

texts.es:
La señora Lludy pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres para el futuro II”, vive en el Jr. Tomas Villacorta Nº 371, distrito de Tarapoto, departamento de San Martín. Tiene 26 años y es madre de 1 niño, es conviviente su pareja se dedica a la docencia en una institución publica. Lludy con el primer prestamo de S/300 decide invertir en abarrotes para venderlos a los vecinos del lugar.

Actualmente cuenta con una pequeña bodega poco surtida, donde ofrece artículos de primera necesidad, además productos de belleza, lo que genera ingresos diariamente que le permiten pagar el prestamo con puntualidad.

Con este prestamo de S/.700.00 que será pagado en 4 meses, comprara 1 saco de arroz, aceite en caja, detergente de todos los tamaños y marcas, frutas y verduras para surtir un poco más el negocio.

Lludy manifiesta sentirse mejor por la oportunidad que le da Manuela Ramos para crecer como mujer y empresaria que es lo que desea ser en el futuro.
texts.en:
Ms. Lludy is a member of the “Mujeres para el futuro II” (Women for the Future II) microfinance institute. She lives in the Tarapoto district of the department of San Martin. She is a 26-year-old mother with a one-year-old son. Her live-in partner works as a teacher in a public institution. Lludy decided to invest her first 300.00 PEN loan in purchasing provisions to sell them to the local residents.

She currently has a mini market in which she sells only a few goods, such as basic need items and beauty products, which generates a daily income for her that helps her repay her loan punctually.

With this 700.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase 1 sack of rice, a box of cooking oil, assorted brands and sizes of detergent, fruits and vegetables in order to better stock her business. Lludy states that she feels good about the opportunity to grow as a female entrepreneur—which is what she wants to be in the future—that Manuela Ramos has given her.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, cooking oil, detergent, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
El  anhelo  de  superación  es una de las principales características que identifican a  de los salvadoreños  en el mundo.  María  Magdalena  Martínez  M. de 29 años es un ejemplo de ello,  cuenta con   una carrera universitaria,   además tiene  una librería  llamada Hefsi, ubicada en el centro del pueblo, en Tamanique La Libertad.

Maria tiene cuatro años de administrar su negocio  y desea incrementar el numero de  clientes y a su vez incrementar sus ingresos, por lo que ha solicitado a integral un préstamo que le permita surtir la librería y  tener accesorios que se demanda los estudiantes al inicio del año electivo. Su sueño es mejorar su calidad de vida y el de su esposo quien labora en una empresa,   donde su salario no es suficiente para cubrir los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
The desire for self-improvement is one of the main characteristics that distinguishes Salvadorans. Twenty-nine-year-old María Magdalena Martínez M. is the epitome of this characteristic. She has a university degree and her own bookstore called Hefsi, located in downtown Tamanique La Libertad.

Maria has managed the business for four years. She hopes to increase both her clientele and her income, which is why she has requested a loan that will allow her to restock her bookstore with the supplies that students need at the beginning of the school year. Her dream is to improve her and her husband’s quality of life. He works for a company, but he does not earn a sufficient amount of income to cover the family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school supplies

loans.name: Loydith

texts.es:
La señora Loydith pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Brisas”, vive en el Jr. Progreso Nº 209 del distrito y provincia D. Bellavista, Departamento San Martín. Tiene 58 años y es madre D. 3 hijos, ninguno depenD. D. ella, es casada,  su esposo se dedica a trabajos temporáneos dentro D. la ciudad. Loydith con el primer prestamo recibido D. S/ 300.00 deciD. preparar bocaditos. Esta 8 años con el banco.

En la actualidad ella hace bocaditos en cantidad, que los reparte a bodegas mercado, y pedidos y además prepara kekes, tortas, que hace en ocasiones especiales como bautizos, matrimonios, cumpleaños, etc. Esto le permite un ingreso regular para poder pagar el prestamo con puntualidad.

Con este prestamo D. S/ 1, 000, será pagado en 6 meses, comprara un horno eléctrico, lo que facilitara el trabajo que realiza y además disminuirá el gasto y el tiempo para realizar su trabajo.

Loydith manifiesta que el Banco Comunal es un excelente apoyo para las mujeres que desean progresar y crecer como empresarias.
texts.en:
Loydith belongs to the Las Brisas (“The Breezes”) cooperative bank. She lives in the Bellavista province, located in San Martín. She is 58 years old and the mother of three children, none of who still depend on her. She is married, and her husband dedicates himself to part-time jobs within the city. With her first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles, she decided to prepare finger foods. She has belonged to the bank for eight years. Currently, she prepares her snacks in quantity, which she distributes to stores and on order. She also makes cakes for special occasions such as baptisms, weddings, birthdays, etc. This allows her to earn a steady income so she can make her loan payments on time. With this loan of 1,000.00 Peruvian soles, to be repaid in six months, she will buy an electric stove that will facilitate her work and also lower her cost and time expenditures. Loydith states that the cooperative bank is an excellent source of support for women who want to get ahead and grow their enterprises.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase an electric stove that will facilitate her work and also lower her cost and time expenditures.

loans.name: Huamanguina Group

texts.es:
El Banco Huamanguina  inicia su primer ciclo con  15 socias, muchas de ellas viven en el mismo barrio. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta comidas, cosméticos, golosinas, bebidas, repuestos, abarrotes en general y fabricación de ladrillos.

Sus ventas lo realizan de manera ambulatoria, reparten de casa en casa, en los mercados y también en sus viviendas.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de prestamos como 300 soles, 600soles,  haciendo un total de 7,800 soles de prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra de platos, ollas, azúcar, arroz, leche, cosméticos, cebolla, zanahoria, chompas, polos y frutas variadas.

Los sueños de las socias son que sus hijos continúen sus estudios, ampliar su negocio, tener casa propia.
texts.en:
The Huamanguina Bank started its first cycle with 15 members, and many live in the same neighborhood. The members run a variety of businesses such as food sales, cosmetics, snacks, beverages, spare parts, groceries, and brick-making. They typically work as traveling saleswomen, selling door-to-door, at local markets, and also from their own homes. The members need different loan amounts such as 300.00 Peruvian soles, 600 soles, etc., totaling 7,800.00 Peruvian soles worth of loans to the cooperative bank. Their loan funds will be invested into the purchase of plates, pots, sugar, rice, milk, cosmetics, onion, carrots, sweaters, tops, and a variety of fruits. The members’ dreams including seeing their children continue with their educations, expanding and improving their businesses, and owning their own homes.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase dishes, pots, sugar, rice, milk, cosmetics, onions, carrots, sweaters, tops, and a variety of fruit.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es: El señor Luis Enrique es propietario de una tienda de abarrotes negocio que  tiene establecido 9 años que cuenta mucha clientela ya que sus clientes se van satisfechos porque producto que buscan ahí lo encuentran, el señor Luis esta solicitando este crédito para la ampliación de su negocio ya que le agregara el área de carnicería para seguir teniendo a sus clientes contentos y obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Luis Enrique is the owner of a grocery store, a business that has been established for nine years. He counts on a well-established customer base because they leave satisfied due to the fact that they can find all the products they are looking for there. Luis is requesting this loan to expand his business, to add a butcher shop in order to continue keeping his customers happy and increase his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For business expansion.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Loymira Margelith

texts.es:
La señora Loymira pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Samaritanas” vive en Jr. José Olaya Nº 782 – Sector Tacunga, distrito de Tarapoto, departamento de San Martín. Tiene 32 años y es madre de 2 hijos los que todavía dependen de ella. Es casada, su esposo le apoya en el negocio. Con el primer prestamo decide comprar pollos para venderlos en el mercado por kilos. Tiene 3 ciclos con el banco.

En la actualidad continua con el negocio de venta de pollos enteros y en cuartos en un puesto ubicado en el mercado de la ciudad, esto le genera ganancias diarias para el pago de las cuotas mensuales del banco.

Con este prestamo de S/. 800 que será pagado en 4 meses, comprara pollos vivos en cantidad de las avícolas que le permitirá vender a un precio mas cómodo y obtendrá mayores ganancias y además podrá ofrecer al por mayor a su clientela.

Loymira manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle surgir en su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Loymira belongs to The Samaritans' Municipal Bank. She lives on Jr. José Olaya Number 782, in the Tacunga division of the Tarapoto district, department of San Martín. She is 32 years old and the mother of two children who still depend on her. She is married and her husband supports her in the business. With the first loan she chooses to buy chickens to sell them in the market by the kilo. She has completed three cycles with the bank. Currently, she is continuing with her business of selling whole chickens and quarter chickens in a stand located in the city market. This will generate daily earnings for the monthly loan payments to the bank. With this loan of 800 soles ($250 USD) that will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy a large amount of live chickens from the poultry farms, allowing her to sell for a more reasonable price and obtain higher earnings and, furthermore, will allow her to sell in bulk to her customers. Loymira expresses her gratitude to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a large amount of live chickens from poultry farms to allow her to sell at a more reasonable price and obtain higher earnings and also allow her customers to buy in bulk.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
La señora Manuela pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Paz II”, vive en el pasaje Leoncio Prado Mza. D lote 19 – Las Brisas del Cumbaza, distrito de Tarapoto, departamento de San Martín. Tiene 38 años y es madre de 2 hijas, ninguno depende de ella. Es conviviente su pareja se dedica a dar servicio de motocarro por las calles. Con el primer préstamo de S/ 300 decide invertir en la compra de pollos y venderlos por kilos. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco.

Actualmente sigue con el mismo negocio y además cuenta con 1 motocarro propio, que trabaja todos los días para tener un ingreso que le ayude a pagar las cuotas del préstamo con puntualidad.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500 que será pagado en 4 meses comprara pollos en cantidad para repartirlos a las bodegas y venderlos por kilos en el mercado, además de dos llantas nuevas para su movilidad que le servirá para transportar los pedidos de sus clientes.

Manuela esta muy contenta por todo lo obtenido y agradece al Manuela Ramos quien le brinda el apoyo que necesita.
texts.en:
Manuela is a member of the communal bank called La Paz 2. She lives on a small street called Leoncio Prado in Las Brisas del Cumbaza, in the district of Tarapoto in San Martin. She is 38 years old and has 2 children, neither of whom are still dependent on their mother. Manuela lives with her husband and now works as a motor scooter driver, providing a taxi service. With the first loan she received, she bought chickens which she resold by the kilo. She's been working with the bank for 2 years.

She still continues with that business, and also has her own motorscooter for the taxi service which she operates every day. The business provides the income she needs to make regular payments on the loan. With the new loan, wihch she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase more chickens to sell to restaurants and in the market, as well as new wheels for her motor scooter.

Manuela is very satisfied with what she has achieved and appreciates very much the support she receives. .


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chickens to sell to the restaurants and markets, as well as new wheels for her motor scooter.

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Maria Mercedes pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos” vive en el Jr. 3 de Octubre Nº 351 - 9 de Abril, distrito de Tarapoto, departamento de San Martín. Tiene 37 años y es madre de 1 hija, que depende de ella. Es conviviente su esposo se dedica a la administración y manejo de motokar que han conseguido gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo. Con el primer prestamo de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de asados, juanes, tamales para venderlos por las tardes. Tiene 8 años trabajando con el banco.

 En la actualidad cuenta con un local de venta de comida, donde atiende todo el día con pensión y platos a la carta a los universitarios, además cuenta con 5 motokar que trabajan todo el día generando ingresos diarios para el pago puntual de las cuotas del banco.

Con este prestamo de S/ 3,000 	que será pagado en 6 meses arreglara un moderno local para un restaurant, comprara sillas, mesas, adornos para colocar en el centro de las mesas y también utensilios de cocina.

Maria refiere estar muy contenta con el banco por el apoyo que brinda a las mujeres que desean trabajar como ella.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Communal Bank called Los Eucaliptos. She lives in the district of Tarapoto in San Martin. She is 27 years old and lives with her daughter and husband. He has a motor taxi business that he acquired thanks to hard work. With her first loan, Maria invested in making grilled snacks and tamales which she sold in the afternoons. She's been working with the bank for 8 years. Today she has a small restaurant where she prepares and serves meals every day. They also count on 5 motor taxis which generate income needed to make regular payments on the loans.

With the new loan, which she'll repay in 6 months, she will fix up her restaurant, purchase chairs, tables and center pieces, as well as cooking utensils. Maria is very content with the bank and the support they provide to working women such as herself.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To set up a more modern location for her restaurant, purchase chairs, tables and cooking utensils.

loans.name: Pablo Ernesto

texts.es:
El señor Pablo Ernesto es trabajador de un famoso restaurante de repartidor
Su esposa es empleada domestica de una residencia, ellos luchan día con día para brindarles a su familia una estabilidad económica, poco a poco le han ido hacienda mejoras a su casita  por lo tanto ahora están solicitando este crédito para la ampliación de un cuarto ya que su familia esta creciendo y necesitan mas espacio para mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Pablo Ernesto is a delivery man for a famous restaurant. His wife is a maid for a residence. They fight day after day to offer their family economic stability. Little by little they have made improvements to their little home. However, now they are asking for this loan for the expansion of one of their rooms, given that their family is growing and they need more space for greater comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand their house

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
La señora Maura pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Brisas”, vive en la alameda Olmedo Cárdenas, distrito y provincia Bellavista, departamento D. San Martín, tiene 48 años y es madre D. 5 hijos, 4 mayores D. edad y 1 que aun depenD. D. ella, es casada, su esposo le ayuda en los preparativos para la venta D. comida que realizan en su casa, tiene 8 años trabajando con el banco con el primer prestamo deciden poner un pequeño puesto D. comida.

En la actualidad cuenta con un amplio restaurant bien implementado ubicado en su propia casa, donD. venD. menú a todos los vecinos y gente foránea que visita esa ciudad lo que le permite tener buenos ingresos para poder pagar el prestamo con puntualidad.

Con este prestamo D. S/, 2, 000 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprara materiales para construir la segunda planta D. su casa lo que será mas adelante un hostal, el cual le permitirá con el tiempo tener mayores ingresos.

Maura esta muy contenta con el apoyo del banco, ya que le permite proyectarse al futuro con entusiasmo
texts.en:
Maura is a member of the communal bank called Las Brisas. She lives on Olmedo Cardenas, in the district of Bellavista in San Martin. She is 48 years old and the mother of 5 children. 4 of her children are grown up now, and one is still dependent on Maura. Maura's husband helps her in the small restaurant they run from their house. She has been working with bank for 8 years. With her first loan, she set up the restaurant.

Today her restaurant is well established and each day she serves meals to local residents and visitors to the city. The business brings in good income to pay the loans back on time. With the new loan, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase materials needed to construct another level in their house, where she plans to set up a hostel which will help increase their income over time.

Maura is very content with the support she receives from the bank. It allows her to plan enthusiastically for the future.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to construct a second level in their home where she will run a hostel.  Along with the restaurant she runs from her house now, the hostel will help generate needed income.

loans.name: Mónica Maribel

texts.es:
La señora Mónica pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos” vive en el Jr. Leoncio Prado Nº 1073, distrito de Tarapoto, departamento de San Martín. Tiene 36 años y es madre de una pequeña niña. Es conviviente su pareja es ingeniero y es quien le apoya en todos los proyectos que emprende. Con el primer prestamo de S/ 300.00 decide invertir en productos de belleza para venderlos a sus vecinos y amigos. Tiene tres ciclos trabajando con el banco.
 
Actualmente cuenta con dos vitrinas de productos de belleza en su domicilio, productos que lo vende a sus amistades, clientes conocidos, vecinos y otros. Este negocio le genera  ganancias mensuales con lo que puede pagar las cuotas mensuales del banco con puntualidad.

Con este prestamo de S/ 1,500 que será pagado en 6  meses comprara una nueva vitrina y perfumes de todas las calidades, pues sus clientes son muy selectivos y exigentes.

Mónica manifiesta su agradecimiento al banco comunal por todo el apoyo que brinda a las mujeres que desean trabajar.
texts.en:
Monica is a member of the communal bank called Los Eucapliptos. She lives in the district of Tarapoto in San Martin. She is 36 years old and has a young daughter. Her husband is an engineer and he supports her with the projects she's involved with. With the first loan, Monica invested in beauty products to sell to friends and neighbors. She's received and paid back 3 loans already with the bank.

Today she has two display cases full of beauty products in her home. She sells to friends, well known customers, neighbors, etc. Her business brings her in monthly income which allows her to make timely payments on the loans. With the new loan, which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase a new display case and various perfumes of high quality, as her clients are quite demanding.

Monica is very grateful to the bank for the support they provide for working women.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a new display case for her beauty products, as well as various high quality perfumes as her customers are very demanding.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
La señora Noemí pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Zamaritanas”, vive en el Jr. José Olaya Nº 940, Distrito de Tarapoto, departamento de San Martín. Tiene 42 años y es madre de 3 hijos, 2 mayores de edad y 1 que aun depende de ella. Es casada. Con el primer prestamo de S/. 300 decide invertir en una maquina de coser de segunda mano, maquina que le permitió trabajar desde entonces para los vecinos. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco.

En la actualidad cuenta con un taller de costura en un local acondicionado de su domicilio, donde trabaja día a día según los contratos que tiene con las entidades como colegios, academias, empresas privadas y otros, esto le genera ganancias para pagar las cuotas mensuales del banco.

Con este prestamo de S/ 800.00 que será pagado en 4 meses, comprara hilos en docenas, cierres de todas las medidas y colores, telas en metros de distintas variedades que le ayudara con el trabajo que realiza.

Noemí manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y mujer.
texts.en:
Noemi is a member of the communal bank called Las Zamaritanas. She lives in the district of Tarapoto in San Martin. She is 42 years old, married and has 3 children. 2 of them are grown up and 1 is still dependent on Noemi. With the first loan, she invested in a second hand sewing machine which permitted her to do work for her neighbors. She's been working for 2 years with the bank.

Today she has a small shop set up in her home. Each day she does work under various contracts from the schools, private companies and others. This business generates income which enables her to repay her loans. With the new loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase necessary supplies such thread, zippers and fabric which she will use in her business.

Noemi is grateful for the support she receives to help build her business.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies needed for her seamstress business, such as thread, zippers and fabric.

loans.name: Leonel

texts.es: El Señor Leonel S. R. es originario de la zona 4 de Totonicapan  hacer 10 años don Leonel viene trabajando en la estructura Metalica como operatio, hace dos años  el inicia su propio negocio, en la cual poco a poco incrementava su vents en el negocio con la colaboracion de su esposa, de partes de las persona se tiene la confianza de la elaboracion de una puerta o una ventana etc. Don Leonel por el conocimiento que se tiene, actualmente tiene mucha demanda de su producto y lo que le falta ha el es el recurso economico en la cual ve la necesidad de solicitar un credito en las oficina de ASDIR con el unico objetivo de poder satisfacer la necesidad de sus clientes, y con las ganancias que obtien por cada producto elaborado le permite mejor su nivel de vida y principalmente la de su familia.
texts.en:
Leonel S. R. is from Zone 4 of Totonicapan. For ten years he has built metal structures. Two years ago, he and his wife started their own business. Because people trust them to build doors, windows, etc., little by little their sales have grown. Leonel is very well known for his work and there is great demand for his products. However, he lacks the economic resources necessary to satisfy his customers' requests, and so he is seeking a loan from Kiva's partner ASDIR. The money he earns from each object he constructs will enable him to improve his family's standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Pazzy

texts.es:
La señora Pazzy pertenece al Banco Comunal “ Las Brisas” , vive en Jr. Bolognesi 7ma cuadra, distrito y provincia de Bellavista, departamento de San Martín. Tiene 63 años y es madre de 1 hija mayor de edad que no depende de ella. Es conviviente, su pareja se dedica a la venta de repuestos de carros y motos. Pazzy con el primer prestamo recibido de S/ 300.00 decide empezar un negocio de venta de bebidas gasificadas en el mercado. Tiene 3 ciclos con el banco.

En la actualidad cuenta con un pequeño local en su propia casa  de venta de refrigerios, lo que le permite generar ingresos para pagar el prestamo puntualmente.

Con este prestamo de S/ 1, 500 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprara gaseosas de todos los tamaños y sabores, 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, harina etc. Para la preparación de sus refrigerios que vende a todos los trabajadores de su cuadra y transeúntes.

Pazzy esta muy contenta con el banco ya que le permite tener amistades y realizar lo que siempre quiso desde su juventud.
texts.en:
Pazzy belongs to “Las Brisas” (“Breezes”) Community Bank and lives in the Bellavista district of San Martín. She is 63 years old and the mother of one grown daughter. She lives with her partner, who sells spare parts for cars and motorcycles.
