This is Pazzy's third loan. With her first loan, of 300 Peruvian nuevos soles (approximately US $95), she decided to start a business selling soft drinks in the local market. Now, she has a small shop in her home where she sells snacks. The steady income from her shop will enable her to repay her loan on time.

With this loan, of 1,500 nuevos soles (US $475), she will buy a variety of soft drinks, one sack of rice, one sack of sugar, flour, and other ingredients necessary to prepare the snacks that she sells to the workers on her block and other passersby.

Pazzy is very happy with her association with the bank, not only for the new friends she has made but also because it has helped her to realize dreams she has had since her youth.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a variety of soft drinks, 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, flour, and other ingredients necessary to prepare snacks

loans.name: Rosa Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal “Maria Auxiliadora” vive en el Jr. Rioja Nº 341 del distrito D. Tarapoto, departamento D. San Martín. Tiene 70 años y es madre D. 5 hijos todos ellos mayores D. edad. Es viuda. Con el prestamo obtenido D. S/ 300 deciD. invertir en la compra D. abarrotes para venderlos a sus vecinos. Tiene 3 años trabajando con el banco.

En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega ubicado en su domicilio, que la genera ganancias para pagar las cuotas mensuales del banco.

 Con este prestamo D. S/ 1,000 que será pagado en 4 meses, comprara bebidas gasificadas, 1 saco D. azúcar, verduras frescas y frutas, jabón, fideos en paquetes, etc.

Rosa refiere estar contenta con el apoyo D. Manuela Ramos por que le permite progresar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the communal bank Maria Auxiliadora. Rosa lives at Jr. Rioja N 341, in the district of Tarapoto and in the department of San Martin. She is 70 years old and is a mother of 5 children who are all grown up. She is a widow. With the last loan of 300 Soles she has decided to invest in buying groceries so she can resell them to her neighbors. She has been working for the bank for the past 3 years. Right now her store is located insiD. of her house. The earnings that she makes from her business allow her to make monthly payments to the bank. With this loan of 1,000 Soles, which will be payed back in 4 months, she will be able to buy carbonated drinks, a huge sack of sugar, fresh vegetables and fruit, soap, packages of noddles, etc. Rosa is happy with the help she has received from Manuela Ramos because it has allowed her to make progress in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy carbonated drinks, a huge sack of sugar, fresh vegetables and fruit, soap, packages of noddles, etc.

loans.name: Tanith

texts.es:
La señora Tanith pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres para el futuro II”, vive en el jr. Napoleón Chu s/n, distrito de Tarapoto, departamento de San Martín. Tiene 26 años y es madre de una niña. Es conviviente, su pareja se dedica al transporte (motocarrista), es quien le apoya con las tareas  de la casa.
Tanith con el primer prestamo de S/ 300 decide invertir en frutas para venderlo en el mercado.

En la actualidad cuenta con un puesto en el mercado, donde vende frutas de la región, variando los productos todos los días para mejorar las ventas, esto le genera ganancias diarias para poder pagar el prestamo con puntualidad.

Con este prestamo de S/. 1,500 que será pagado en 4 meses, comprara frutas en sacos, plátanos de la región en racimos, cocos frescos en racimos, y además una parte comprara productos de belleza para la venta en su casa.

Tanith manifiesta su alegría por la oportunidad que le brinda Manuela Ramos de crecer como empresaria y realizarse como mujer.
texts.en:
Tanith belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres para el futuro 11" (Women For The Future II). She live is in Jr. Napoleón Chu s/n, in the distict of Tarapoto, and the state of San Martín. She is 26 years old and is the mother of a daughter. She lives with her boyfriend, who makes a living driving a taxi driver. He also helps her a lot with all of the housework. With the first loan that Tanith received she decided to invest in the purchase of fruit to sell at the market.

Presently, Tanith has a space in the market where she sells fruits from the area. She sells different fruits each day so that her sales will be better. She makes a profit each day and this makes her be able to pay her loan on time.

Now she is asking for a loan of 1,500 Soles, which she will pay back in 4 months. She will buy fruit in large sacks, bananas from the region, fresh coconuts, and she will also buy beauty products which she will sell from her house.

Tanith is very happy because of the opportunity that Manuela Ramos gives to her. She is growing as an entreprenuer and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruit in large sacks, bananas from the region, fresh coconuts, and beauty products

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Victoria pertenece al Banco Comunal “Maria Auxiliadora” vive en Martínez de Compañón Nº 1345, distrito de Tarapoto, departamento de San Martín. Tiene 44 años y es madre de 4 hijos, 3 son mayores de edad y 1 todavía depende de ella. Es soltera.
Victoria con el primer prestamo de S/ 300 decide invertir en la compra de gaseosas, refrescos, para venderlos en un local ubicado en su domicilio. Tiene 8 años trabajando con el banco.

Actualmente cuenta con una bodega de venta de abarrotes, en un lugar acondicionado de su domicilio, lo que genera ingresos diarios para pagar las cuotas del banco con puntualidad.

Con este prestamo de S/ 2.000 que será pagado en 6 meses, comprara 2 sacos de arroz, fréjol de todas las variedades, detergentes de todos los tamaños y marcas, azúcar en saco, jabón en caja  y además bebidas gasificadas.

Victoria manifiesta estar muy agradecida con el banco por el apoyo brindado y por la oportunidad de crecer como mujer.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the “Maria Auxiliadora” Community Bank and lives in the Tarapoto district of San Martín. She is 44 years old, single, and the mother of four children. Three of her children are grown, while one is still dependent on her.

Victoria has been working with the bank for eight years. She invested her first loan, for 300 Peruvian nuevos soles (approximately US $95), in the purchase of soft drinks to sell from a shop in her home. She has since developed her shop into a well-equipped grocery store which generates enough income to enable her to repay her loans on time.

With this loan (for 2,000 nuevos soles [US $625], to be repaid in six months), Victoria will buy 2 sacks of rice, a variety of beans, various brands and sizes of laundry detergent, sacks of sugar, cases of soap, and soft drinks.

Victoria is very grateful to the bank for their support and for the opportunity they have given her to grow as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her shop

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es:
La señora Violeta pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos” vive en el Jr. 3 de Octubre Nº 398, distrito de Tarapoto, departamento de San Martín. Tiene 27 años y es madre de dos niños. Es casada, su esposo se dedica a la docencia y es quien en todo momento le ayuda en la  casa. Violeta acaba de reingresar al banco después de un tiempo.

Actualmente cuenta con una bodega ubicado en su domicilio, donde ofrece artículos de primera necesidad, además de bebidas, golosinas y otros. Esto le genera ganancias diarias para el pago puntual de las cuotas del banco.

Con este prestamo de S/. 1,000 que será pagado en 6 meses, comprara ropas y zapatos de diferentes tallas y modelos que le permitirá ofrecer variedad a sus clientes que son muy exigentes.

Violeta refiere estar contenta con el banco por el apoyo que le brinda a todas las mujeres que desean trabajar y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Violeta belongs to “Los Eucaliptos” (“Eucalyptus”) Community Bank and lives in the Tarapoto district of San Martín. She is 27 years old, married, and the mother of two children. Her husband is a teacher and is very helpful at home. Violeta has just re-enrolled in the bank after a time away.

Violeta has a small grocery store located in her home, where she sells staple items as well as soft drinks, sweets, etc. She earns enough from her shop to guarantee the punctual repayment of her loan.

She is currently requesting a loan of 1,000 Peruvian nuevos soles (US $325), to be repaid in six months. Violeta will use the loan to purchase many styles and sizes of clothing and shoes so that she can meet the needs of her discerning clientele.

Violeta is very happy with the support the bank offers to all women who want to work and get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing and shoes

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”, vive en el Jr. Progreso Nº 172, distrito de Tarapoto, departamento de San Martín. Tiene 48 años y es madre de 3 hijos quienes todavía dependen de ella. Es conviviente, su pareja es jubilado en educación, quien le apoya en el negocio. Con el primer prestamo de S/ 300.00 decide invertir en el negocio de venta de abarrotes ubicado en su casa. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco.

En la actualidad continúa con el negocio de venta de abarrotes y golosinas  lo que genera un ingreso diario permitiendo el pago puntual de las letras del banco.

Con este prestamo de S/. 1,500 que será pagado en 6 meses, comprara artículos para regalos, 1 saco de arroz,  fideos en cantidad, menestras, bebidas gasificadas, etc.

Yolanda manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Yolanda belongs to “Los Eucaliptos” (“Eucalyptus”) Community Bank and lives in the Tarapoto district of San Martín. She is 48 years old, the mother of three dependent children, and lives with her partner. Her partner is a retired teacher and helps her with her business.

Yolanda has been working with the bank for two years. She used her first loan of 300 Peruvian nuevos soles (approximately US $95) to start a grocery store in her home. Her store currently generates enough income to guarantee the punctual repayment of her loan.

Yolanda is requesting a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles (US $475), to be repaid in six months. She will invest the money in gift items, one sack of rice, bulk beans, canned soups, soft drinks, and other merchandise.

Yolanda is very grateful to Kiva's partner Manuela Ramos for their support.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: El Señor Juan Francisco U. tiene 48 años, está casado y tiene cuatro hijos. La actividad económica de Don Juan es la compra y venta de cerdo, y la ubicación de su negocio está en una finca. Hace cinco anos que tiene este negocio, y Don Juan lo inició porque tuvo unos amigos que le aconsejaron que este tipo de negocio le podía ayudar a generar los ingresos suficientes para la manutención de su familia. El propósito de Don Juan es de comprar más cerdos en esta temporada ya que estos tienen diferentes utilidades. Por esta razón, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo designado a la compra de repuestos de su carretón, y además de eso lo ocupa para el traslado de los cerdos. Al final, sus deseos son de mantener este negocio ya que con este, él gana ingresos extras los cuales le permite dar comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Francisco U. is 48 years old, married, and has four children. Juan’s economic activity involves the purchase and sale of pigs, and the location of his business is at a farm. He has had the business for five years, having started because he had some friends who advised him that this type of enterprise would help him generate enough income to support his family. Juan’s intention is to purchase more pigs during this season, as they serve various functions. For this reason, the financing is to provide him with working capital designed to purchase spare parts for his trailer. The trailer also helps him with the transport of the pigs. Finally, his wishes are to maintain the business since it earns him extra income that allows him to provide additional comforts for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Don Antonio C. T. con residencia en el paraje choquisis final de la zona 4 Totonicapán  el solicita en las ofinas de la sucursal ASDIR Totonicapan un credito que con ello lo inverita en la compra de herramientas para la construccion ya que el viene ejerciendo la albañieria  desde hace más de treinta años, y en la fecha necesita herramienta adecuadas a las modernas construcciones. Y con los ingresos que obtiene  quincenalmente le permite satisfacers las necesidades de su familia  ya que tiene dos hijos que esta estudiando una carrera de diversificado, comenta don Antonio que es el regalo mas grade que pueda dejar a sus hijos graduados que dicha oportunidad don Antonio no lo tuvo.
texts.en:
Antonio C. T. lives in Zone 4 of Totonicapán. He has worked in construction for more than thirty years and is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner ASDIR in order to purchase the tools necessary to build more modern structures. With the income that he receives every two weeks he is able to meet his family's living expenses.

Antonio has two children in high school and he believes that education is the greatest gift he can give them, as it is an opportunity that he never had.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tools

loans.name: Ana Ethel

texts.es:
En el Mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega la señora Ana Ethel J. se dedica arduamente a su negocio de venta de ropa el cual ella comercializa en su propio tramo ofreciendo todo tipo de ropa de las diferentes marcas y para todo tamaño.

Ella es una dama que con sus múltiples esfuerzos ha logrado surtir su negocio de venta de ropa brindando mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. La razón por la cual ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de la ropa ya que al irse agotando el inventario requiere de dicha compra ya que por esto lleva a cabo su actividad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana Ethel J. works vigorously at her clothing business in the Central Market in the city of Chinandega. This is her own business where she offers all kinds of clothing of various brands and in all sizes. With great effort she has managed to run her clothes selling business and provide better living conditions for her family. She is seeking help from Ceprodel for a loan to buy clothing as her inventory has diminished and she needs to buy clothing inventory, as this is how she makes her living.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing inventory

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
El negocio de pulpería requiere en todo momento de inversión inmediata al agotarse el inventario con el objetivo de satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes. En el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Juana A. labora en su propio negocio de pulpería ofreciendo todo tipo de productos ofrecidos a sus clientes.

Por ser una dama muy trabajadora y con el deseo de que su negocio crezca y se desarrolle, ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de los productos y de esta forma continuar buscando la manera de prosperar su pulpería.
texts.en:
A general store requires constant and immediate investment when inventory is depleted in order meet its customer demands. Mrs. Juana A. works in her own general store in the Central Market in the city of Chinandega offering up all types of products for her customers. As she is a hardworking woman with the desire to grow and develop her business, she has applied for a loan from Ceprodel to buy products and thereby continue to find ways to grow her general store.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains

loans.name: María Estela

texts.es:
La señora María Estela O. se dedica a atender su tienda de venta de productos personales que posee desde hace 20 años en el mercado central de Chinandega.

Como todo negocio, sus inicios fueron muy duros pero gracias a su dedicación al trabajo ha logrado salir adelante y es por esta razón que espera en que Ceprodel le brinde el apoyo crediticio para la compra de mercadería con el objetivo de ofertarla y mejorar sus condiciones. Su negocio se ha venido desarrollando gracias al apoyo de Ceprodel  y es por este motivo que hoy en día continúa esforzándose grandemente.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Estela O. sells personal products at her store, which she has owned for 20 years in the Central Market of Chinandega. As in all business, her early beginnings were difficult but thanks to her dedication to her work she has succeeded. She hopes to receive a loan from Ceprodel to buy merchandise to sell and improve her living conditions. Her business has developed thanks to support from Ceprodel and this is the reason she continues to work untiringly.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Janixia Del Socorro

texts.es: Janixia del Socorro T. Solís tiene 31 años, esta casada, y tiene dos. La actividad económica de Doña Janixia es la venta de cosméticos y otros productos, y la ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante en su casa de habitación. Hace un ano que tiene este negocio, y ella inició a este negocio porque tenía que proporcionarle a sus hijos estabilidad en sus estudios. Doña Janixia empezó con pocos productos como pinturas de labios, sombra, rubor, delineador, y base, y después solo tenía que recoger el dinero para volver a comprar sus productos. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que necesita realizar la compra de cosméticos, perfumes y pinturas. Con este préstamo, Doña Janixia puede realizar los deseos de tener el dinero suficiente para trabajar con capital propio para daría estabilidad emocional y económica.
texts.en:
Janixia del Socorro T. Solís is 31 years old, married, and has two children. Janixia’s economic activity is selling cosmetics and a variety of other products, and the location of her business is in her home. It’s been one year since she started this endeavor, due to her need to provide stable educations for her children. Janixia started with just a few products, such as lipstick, eyeshadow, blush, eyeliner and foundation. Afterwards, she only needed to collect her money to buy more products with. The loan financing would serve as working capital to allow her to buy the cosmetics and perfumes. With this loan, Janixia will be able to realize her dream of having enough working capital to give her emotional and economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes tiene 42 años de edad, hace 17 años vive con su pareja, con padres de 5 hijos, los 3 menores viven con ellos en su casa propia. Hace 10 años se dedica en la venta de muebles usados en uno de los ambientes de su casa que destinó para la venta de muebles. Su actividad empieza cuando viaja a la ciudad de Lima, a un lugar denominada “La cachina” donde escoge y compra los muebles, una vez en su ciudad, su esposo y sus hijos realizan el trabajo de lijar y sacarles brillo con laca hasta que queden muy brillantes. Una vez terminada esta labor los muebles quedan así de nuevos, y puede cotizarlos a un precio considerable, pero también al alcance de los bolsillos de sus clientes. Con todos los retoques llega a ganar por mueble entre 300 y 500 soles, pero la dificultad es que demora algunos días en vender un mueble. Mercedes está feliz con su negocio, su esposo y sus hijos están ocupados en ello también, la mayor demanda de muebles es a finales de abril, cuando empieza la cosecha de café, porque la gente empieza a adquirir sus muebles, es el tiempo donde se pueda hacer capital y “guardar pan para mayo”. Mercedes está con muchas ilusiones de trabajar, ya que ha recibido el cargo de vocal en su banco comunal, y está comprometida a trabajar al servicio del grupo, asimismo efectuar los pagos puntuales, este es su 1er préstamo, del que está muy agradecida. El dinero que solicita es para comprar muebles, los cuales le servirán como capital para su negocio.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 42 years old and has lived with her partner for 17 years. They are the parents of 5 children, 3 of the youngest who live with them in their own home. For 10 years she has worked selling used furniture from her home. Her work starts with a trip to "La cachina" in Lima where she selects and buys the furniture. Once back in her home city, her husband and children perform the work of sanding and lacquering leaving them shining and like-new. She can then sell them for a higher price, which is still within reach of her customers' pocketbooks. After all of this pre-work, she earns about 300-500 soles per piece although it takes a few days to sell one piece. Mercedes is happy with her business especially since it involves her husband and children. The greatest demand for furniture is near the end of April when the coffee harvest comes in because then folks start buying furniture - it is the best time for earning capital and putting something away for a rainy day. Mercedes is eager to work especially since she has taken on the job of representative for her community bank and is committed to working for the group, and making payments on time. This is her first loan for which she is very grateful. The funds will be used to buy furniture which serve as capital for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Jacinto Bernabe

texts.es: Jacinto Bernabé A. M. tiene 33 años, está casado, y tiene una hija de 8 años. La actividad económica a la que Don Jacinto se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general, como faldas, camisas, y pantalones entre otros. Hace cuatro años que tiene este negocio, y la ubicación es de manera ambulante por lo que también labora en una tienda donde venden ropa. Don Jacinto inició en esta actividad económica con el objetivo de tener otra fuente de ingresos,  y su propósito es establecer un lugar fijo donde pueda ofertar sus productos. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo destinado para el crecimiento económico y la disponibilidad de mercadería donde se oferte variedad para los distintos gustos de sus clientes. Últimamente, su deseo es localizar un lugar en donde pueda encontrar la ropa que el vende a un menor precio y de esta manera, da más cómodos sus productos. Con respeto al futuro, los sueños de Don Jacinto son lograr que su familia salga adelante en la situación que atraviesan.
texts.en:
Jacinto Bernabé A. M. is 33 years old, married, and has one daughter who is eight years old. Jacinto’s economic activity involves the sale of general merchandise, such as skirts, shirts, and pants, among other items. He has had the business for four years, and he sells on foot and also works at a clothing store. Jacinto started his enterprise with the objective of having another source of income, and is goal is to establish a fixed location from which to offer his products. The loan financing would be destined as working capital, for economic growth, and to be able to meet the different needs of his customers by having more variety in his merchandise. Ultimately, his wish is buy the clothing he sells at a lower price that would allow him greater profits. With respect to the future, Jacinto’s dream is to help his family get ahead and past the situation they are in.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Paola

texts.es: PaoL. tiene 55 años D. edad, es separada desD. hace 17 años, actualmente vive con sus dos hijos y su madre anciana. Cuando aun vivía con el padre D. sus hijos se dedicaba al cultivo D. frutas cítricas y plátanos, trabajaban juntos, al separarse continuó haciéndolo soL., pero hace 4 años empezó a guisar y a vender comida, tiene 4 pensionistas fijos y los demás son clientes esporádicos, en esta actividad le va bien y más aun en tiempos D. cosecha aumentan sus clientes D. 10 platos que prepara a 20 platos diarios. Inicia su labor a las 5.00 am hasta las 3.00 pm diariamente, realizando una inversión D. 25 soles diarios y gana casi al doble, que le permite cubrir los gastos D. luz y agua y educación D. sus hijos. El pequeño local que ambientó para su negocio está en casa D. su madre, también venD. golosinas y gaseosas para tener ingresos extras. ElL. es una cliente que por primara vez solicita un préstamos con MFP, está muy entusiasmada  con esta oportunidad y sobre todo se compromete a realizar sus pagos en forma puntual. El dinero que solicita es para L. compra D. víveres para L. preparación D. sus platos y otra cantidad para aumentar L. cantidad D. golosinas que venD..
texts.en:
PaoL. is 55 years old and has been separated for the past 17 years. Currently she lives with her two children and elderly mother. When she lived with the father of her children they worked together cultivating citrus fruits and bananas. She has continued this work alone since they separated but 4 years ago she started cooking and selling meals - she now has 4 fixed boarders and remaining clientele of sporadic customers. This has been a fruitful activity for her, especially during harvest time when her customer demand of 10 meals per day increases to 20 meals per day. She starts her work at 5am and works daily until 3pm, investing about 25 soles daily and earning almost double that amount, which allows her to cover the electricity and water bills as well as her children's educations. The small locale, which she designed for her business, is in her mother's home, from where she also sells sweets and sodas to earn a bit of extra income. This is her first MFP loan request. She is very excited about the opportunity and has committed to making her payments timely. The requested funds are both to buy supplies for preparing her dishes and to increase the stock of sweets for sale.

Translated from Spanish by PameL. Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for creating her dishes/meals

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es: Segundina tiene 31 años de edad, vive con su pareja hace 17 años, es madre de 4 hijos, en la actualidad vive con uno de ellos y una nieta, su casa ubicada donde tiene sus campos de cultivo, a unos 7 Km. de la ciudad. Desde muy joven se dedica al cultivo de kion, achote y café, pero lo que siembra en mayor cantidad es el café, tiene sembrado 4 hectáreas, y ahora después de 7 meses está cosechando kion, ha vendido el kilo a 5 soles. Esta actividad a ella y su esposo les agrada mucho, para ellos el trabajar en la chacra no es dificultoso. Pero lo que más le agrada es sembrar café, porque no pierde, aunque no tenga buen precio en temporadas, lo seca y lo guarda para venderlo después. En cambio con el kion debe venderlo según el precio que se cotiza en el mercado en ese momento. Segundina tiene planes futuros de comprar un terreno en la ciudad para que sus hijos estudien ahí y se eviten caminar varias horas. Pese a la distancia en que vive y aunque no tiene ningún cargo, es la primera en llegar a las reuniones de su banco comunal, ella está muy contenta con su grupo, este es su 3er préstamo, y todo este tiempo ha demostrado pagar sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad. El dinero que solicita en esta ocasión es para la compra de fertilizantes e insecticidas para contrarrestar a los mosquitos que afectan a su chacra de café. También está muy agradecida con aquellos que hacen posible este crédito que le permite trabajar.
texts.en:
Segundina is a 31-year-old mother of 4 and has lived with her partner for 17 years. She currently lives with one of her children and a granddaughter. Her house is located on the lands which she cultivates, about 7 kilometers from the city. Since she was very young she has worked cultivating kión (ginger), achote, and coffee. What she enjoys planting most is coffee, of which she has sown four hectares. Now, after 7 months, she is harvesting kión, which she has sold at 5 soles/kilo. She and her husband enjoy this activity very much, as working on the farm is not difficult. What she enjoys most is planting coffee because she does not lose money - even when the market price is low during certain seasons, she just dries the coffee and saves it to sell later. The kión is different - she needs to sell it for whatever price is asked on the market at the moment. Segundina has future plans to buy land closer to the city so her children can study there and not have to walk hours to get to school. Despite the long distance she must travel, and that she has no responsibility within the group, she is the first to arrive at the community bank meetings. She is very happy with her group; this is her 3rd loan, and during this time she has shown she can make her payments responsibly. The money she has requested is to buy fertilizers and insecticides against mosquitoes, which impact her coffee farm. She is also very grateful to those who make this loan possible to help her keep working.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es: Soledad tiene 26 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con sus dos hijos y su hermana en la casa de su madre. Años atrás trabajaba como empleada doméstica en una casa en la ciudad de Lima, tuvo que regresar a Tarma por la enfermedad de su hija. Por el momento, desde hace 4 meses está ayudando a su tío en su puesto de venta de comida, empieza a las 6am hasta las 4pm y le pagan diario 15 soles incluidos el almuerzo. La meta de Soledad es sembrar en los terrenos de sus familiares con el apoyo de su hermana, porque sabe que la agricultura es rentable; pero su dificultad mayor es el dinero, para realizar la compra de fertilizantes, pero tiene la convicción de sembrar frutos cítricos y café, paralelo a ello, realizar trabajos eventuales mientras llega la primera cosecha de su café, es consciente que tiene que esperar. Soledad pese a sus dificultades, ha tratado de pagar sus cuotas en forma muy puntual, y todo este tiempo no ha caído en morosidad, asiste a todas las reuniones programadas por el asesor, de crédito y este es su 3er préstamo con MFP. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de plantas de café, y la compra de fertilizantes para que pueda efectuar su sembrío.
texts.en:
Soledad is 26 years old and is a single mother. She lives with her two children and her sister in her mother's house. Years back she worked as a maid in the city of Lima. She had to return to Tarma because her daughter was sick. For the moment she decided to help her uncle out for 4 months in a restaurant. She starts work at 6 am and gets off at 4 pm. They pay her daily 15 Soles (about $5) and also give her lunch.

Soledad's goal is to plant on her family's land because she knows that agriculture is profitable. Her sister will help her to work the land. Her only problem is that she does not have enough money to buy fertilizer. She is convinced that planting citrus fruits and coffee is the best choice. She will have to wait for her coffee to grow but in the mean time she will do other jobs. She know that it will take time for the coffee to grow.

Despite all of the difficulties that Soledad has faced, she has worked hard to make payments on her previous two loans on time. She has never been late on a payment and she attends all of the meetings and workshops to learn more about operating a business. This will be her third loan with MFP. The money that she is requesting will be used to buy coffee plants and fertilizer to promote a productive crop.

(Translated by Alexis of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Coffee Plants and Fertilizer

loans.name: Teodor

texts.es: Teodor tiene 38 años de edad, conviviente por 20 años con la madre de sus 4 hijos, actualmente están viviendo en una casa alquilada. Es un hombre dedicado a la agricultura desde muy joven, actividad que le apasiona, siembra café, plátanos, frutas cítricas, achote y kion, una vez realizadas las cosechas procede a preparar la carga para llevarlos a los mercados de la ciudad, y con el resto abastece al puesto de su hermana, quien algunas veces vende sus productos sin cobrarle nada, porque la esposa de Teodor tiene problemas de salud y esa es su forma de colaborar con él. Teodor tiene varias chacras cultivadas que requiere fumigado y al resto le falta la limpieza de las hierbas. Por cada cosecha puede ganar entre 200 a 300 soles. Sus anhelos son de tener un puesto igual al de su hermana y que su esposa mejore pronto, entonces puedan vender juntos sus productos sin causar molestias a sus familiares y de ese modo convertirse en un próspero comerciante. El es un cliente MFP muy puntual en sus pagos, en el ciclo pasado hacía las labores de secretario, cumpliendo con la redacción del libro de actas con eficiencia en cada reunión programada, este es su 3er préstamo. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes para sus chacras de sus cítricos y de café, para que de este modo pueda cotizar a un buen precio por ser productos de buena calidad.
texts.en:
Teodor is 38 years old and has lived with the mother of his four children for 20 years. Currently, they live in a rented house. He is a man who has been working in agriculture since he was very young, and he's very passionate about it. He plants coffee, plantains, citrus fruits, achote and kion. Once they are harvested, he prepares the crops to be transported to the city markets. The rest go to his sister, who sometimes sells them for no charge--Teodor's wife has health problems, so this is her way of helping him. Teodor has several fields that require fumigation, and the rest lack cleaning. Each harvest can bring in between 200 and 300 soles. One of his hopes is to have a job equal to that of his sister. Another is that his wife will get better so they can sell their produce together without being a burden to their relatives and thus become prosperous traders. As an MFP client, he is very punctual in his repayments. In the last cycle, as the secretary, he efficiently kept records of all program meetings. This is his third loan, which he will use to fertilize his citrus and coffee fields so he can sell higher-quality produce at a better price.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Yohana De La Concepcion

texts.es: La señora Yohana de la Concepción Alarcón tiene 33 años, está casada, y tiene dos hijos. La actividad económica a la que Doña Yohana se dedica es la venta de pollo y pulpería. Hace cinco años que tiene este negocio, y lo inició porque su marido estudió zootecnia y él le sugirió establecer una venta de pollo. Sus propósitos son de mantener su fuente de ingresos y a la misma vez, crecer un poco con el fin de seguirle proporcionando a su familia lo que necesita. Al comienzo, el negocio fue muy difícil ya que no tenían muchos clientes, y por eso, Doña Yohana estableció una pulpería que ofrecía otros productos necesarios del hogar, como golosinas, huevos, sopas, jabón y detergentes. Con esta combinación, su pequeño negocio pudiera salir adelante, y a ella le gustaría este financiamiento de Kiva para que la pulpería y la venta del pollo puedan continuar a ofrecer lo que sus clientes soliciten. Sus sueños son de suministrarle a sus hijos una buena educación para que lleguen a ser unos buenos profesionales, y con este sentido, a ella le gustaría mejorar su situación económica ya que el costo de la vida está cada día más difícil por las circunstancias de las personas pobres.
texts.en:
Yohana de la Concepción Alarcón is 33 years old, married, and has two children. Yohana’s economic activity involves the sale of chickens as well as groceries. She has had the business for five years, having started at the suggestion of her husband who studied zoology. Her intention is to maintain her source of income and, at the same time, grow the business a little to continue providing for the family’s needs. At the beginning, things were very difficult because she didn’t have many customers. For this reason, Yohana established a grocery store that offered products such as snacks, eggs, soups, soaps and detergents. With this combination, her small enterprise could get ahead. She would like this financing through Kiva so that her poultry and grocery store businesses can continue to offer what her customers demand. Her dream is to provide her children with a good education so they can become professionals. Along with this sentiment, she would also like to improve the family’s financial situation since the cost of living becomes more difficult each and every day for people who are poor.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yaner

texts.es: Yaner tiene 27 años, es soltero, vive en la casa de sus padres juntamente con sus hermanos. Desde muy niño se ha dedicado a los trabajos del cultivo de las plantas de cítricos y café; y desde hace 10 años se dedica al transporte de pasajeros con el motocarro de su padre, generando ingresos adicionales diarios de 50 a 60 soles. Iniciando su labor a las 4.00am hasta 10.00pm, de lunes a viernes; los sábados y domingos son días exclusivos en la chacra. Yaner comenta que los cultivos de la chacra no se deben descuidar, ya que en temporadas de cosecha se gana mucho dinero, que en el pasado le permitió comprar el motocarro a su padre, desde entonces Yaner se ha dedicado a trabajar con ella, aunque a veces tiene ciertas dificultades y hay que repararla o cambiar repuestos, pero ya ase acostumbró a esa rutina. Su deseo es comprarse un motocarro propio para obtener todas las ganancias e ir ahorrando y convertirse en un prospero empresario. Yaner está muy entusiasmado con su banco comunal, acaba de recibir el cargo de presidente y tiene anhelos de trabajar con todos los integrantes para el bienestar del grupo, cabe mencionar que ha inculcado en los integrantes el realizar los pagos en las fechas señaladas. El dinero que solicita es para comprar llantas nuevas para la moto, porque ya es tiempo de renovar, ya que en tiempo de lluvia las llantas usadas corren el riesgo de provocar un accidente.
texts.en:
Yaner is 27 years old, single, and lives with at home with his parents and siblings. He has worked from a very young age growing citrus and coffee plants, and for the last 10 years he has worked as a taxi driver using his father's three-wheeler van, generating an additional daily income of between 50 and 60 soles. He works from 4am to 10pm, Monday to Friday, reserving weekends exclusively for farm work. Yaner states that the crops must not be left to ruin, since the harvest seasons prove very profitable, having previously allowed his father to buy his three-wheeler. Since then Yaner has devoted himself to working with the vehicle, and though he occasionally experiences problems and has to carry out repairs or change spare parts, he is used to this routine. He wants to buy his own three-wheeler van to earn a full-time income and save up enough money to become a successful entrepreneur. Yaner is very enthusiastic about his local communal bank, having just been appointed President, and is very keen to work with all of the members for the good of the group. It is worth mentioning that he has successfully taught his fellow members to make repayments promptly. He will use the requested money to buy new replacement tyres for the three-wheeler, as using worn tyres in the rainy season could cause an accident.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new tyres for his three-wheeler van

loans.name: Mirko

texts.es: Mirko tiene 27 años de edad, es soltero, vive en la casa de sus padres. Su familia es natural de la sierra, por motivos de estudios migró a la ciudad, a un kilómetro de la ciudad lograron adquirir sus terrenos hace 5 años, con el liderazgo de sus padres se dedicaron a sembrar café, cítricos y plátanos. A Mirko le agrada realizar la labor de un agricultor, lo que no le gusta es vender los productos en el mercado, pero cuando las frutas están maduras tiene que  comercializarlo sea como sea, aunque no le guste. Sus anhelos son de producir y cosechar en grandes cantidades. Mirko es un cliente muy dinámico, y tiene muchas expectativas positivas acerca del banco comunal, los demás integrantes acaban de nombrarle tesoro, y él alegremente juró cumplir su cargo con responsabilidad, y motivó a los demás clientes a realizar sus pagos en forma puntual. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes, para el abonado correspondiente de sus chacras de café y los cítricos. Desde ya Mirko está muy agradecido con todos aquellos que hacen posible este crédito, el cual le permite seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Mirko is 27 years old, single, and lives with his parents. His family originally come from the mountains, but they migrated to the city for educational reasons, and managed to buy their land a kilometre from the city 5 years ago. Under his parents' direction, the family worked planting coffee, citrus trees and banana trees. Whereas farm work appeals to Mirko, he doesn't enjoy selling produce at market, but the ripe fruit must be sold regardless. What he really wants is to grow and harvest produce on a large scale. Mirko is a highly motivated client, encouraging the other clients to keep up with their repayments, and his prospects at the local communal bank are very promising, the other members having just appointed him Treasurer, a role he has gladly vowed to perform with full responsibility. He will use the money he is currently requesting to buy fertilizers for his coffee and citrus plantations. Mirko is extremely grateful in advance to all those who make this loan possible, which will help him to keep on working.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis tiene 26 años de edad, hace 4 años vive con su pareja y madre de sus 2 hijos, por el momento viven en la casa de su suegros. Tiene un negocio de venta de muebles de segunda mano en un local alquilado. Los recuerdos de su infancia están en los campos de cultivo, hasta ahora realiza dicha actividad pero solo dos días  a la semana cuando es tiempo de cosecha de las frutas. La compra y venta de muebles usados es un negocio muy rentable, al terminar de cada venta llega a ganar hasta 700 soles, pero nos dice que en esta época sus ventas están bajas, entonces está cosechando los plátanos cada fin de semana, hasta que mejore la demanda de muebles. Aunque le gusta mucho estar en su tienda de muebles, Luis no descuida sus cultivos porque, para él, son para de su vida. Luis recién está aprendiendo sobre los bancos comunales, y está muy agradecido por ser parte de uno, este es su 1er préstamo, con el que se compromete a pagar las cuotas en las fechas programadas. El dinero que solicita es para el incremento de muebles usados y materiales como tiner y laca, que usa para dar brillo a cada mueble y pueda venderlos a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Luis is 26 years old and has lived with his partner, the mother of their two children, for four years. For now they live in his in-laws' home. He has a business selling secondhand furniture in a rented premises. His memories of childhood are in the fields, and until now he has done that wonderful activity but only two days a week when it is fruit harvest time. The purchase and resale of used furniture is a very profitable business. After each sale he can earn up to 700 soles ($225 USD), put he tells us that at this time his sales are down. Because of this he is harvesting bananas every weekend, until the demand for furniture improves. Although he really likes being in his furniture store, Luis does not fail to care for his crops because, for him, they are part of life. Luis has recently begun to learn about municipal banks, and is very thankful to be a part of one. This is his first loan, and he is committed to paying the installments on the arranged dates. The money that he asks for is to buy more used furniture and materials like paint thinner and lacquer, that he uses to polish every piece of furniture to be able to sell them at a better price.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his merchandise

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.es: Doña Juana C. cuenta con 43 años de edad, es casada de oficios tejedor, “elaboración de cortes típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 3 telares, habita junto a sus 2 hijos conjuntamente con su esposo, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 18 años de elaborar cortes típicos en su residencia que se encuentra ubicada en la Aldea ChiP., del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas por semana, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Juana C. is 43 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and 2 children. Both she and her husband are tailors and make traditional women's clothing. They have three looms and 2 employees working for their business. They have been making traditional garments for 18 years from their home in the ChiP. Village, in the Totonicapá district in Guatemala.

Although customer demand has increased, the current economic situation makes it difficult for them to increase their capital. For this reason, Juana has turned to the Asociación ASDIR to request a loan to purchase raw materials so that she and her husband can increase their weekly sales. With this loan, they hope to help their children succeed and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Crafts (To purchase raw materials)

loans.name: Manuela Fabiana

texts.es: La Señora Manuela S. de 31 años de edad,  Casada de oficios Comerciante, “Compra y venta de Blusas Típicas para Mujeres” y su residencia se encuentra ubicada en el Paraje Pabeya del Cantón Juchanep del municipio y departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala cuenta con un pequeño negocio,  habita conjuntamente con su esposo y sus hijos, desde su niñez se dedicaba al Comercio gracias a ello ha podido llevar a su familia adelante donde es persona muy conocida, ella ha llegado a Solicitar a la Asociación Asdir un préstamo para la compra y venta de blusas para facilitar y poder cubrir la demanda a su clientela aprovechando la ganancia que dichas ventas le generaran y así poder darles mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Manuela S. is 31 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and two children in Paraje Pabeya, Juchanep, located in the Totonicapán district of Guatemala. Manuela has a small business purchasing and selling traditional women's blouses. Since childhood, she has been working in sales. Thanks to her business, she has been able to help her family succeed and is well-known in her town.

Manuela is requesting a loan for her business from the Asociación Asdir so she can fulfill customer demand, take advantage of the profits she can make from these sales, and improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Retail (purchase and sale of blouses)

loans.name: Rosario Ventura

texts.es: La Señora Rosario Vásquez de 35 años de edad,  Casada de oficios Tejedora, “Elaboración de cortes Típicos para Mujeres” cuenta con un pequeño Taller,  habita conjuntamente con su esposo y sus hijos, desde su niñez se dedicaba a la artesanía, gracias a ello a podido llevar a su familia adelante donde es persona muy conocida, y su residencia en el Caserío Palemop I de la Aldea Vásquez del municipio y departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala, ella ha llegado a solicitar a la Asociación Asdir un préstamo para la Artesanía con el fin de comprar materia prima para facilitar y poder cubrir la demanda de su clientela aprovechando las ganancias y así poder darles mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Rosario Vásquez is 35 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and children in Caserío Palemop I, Vásquez, located in the Totonicapán district of Guatemala. Rosario is a seamstress and makes traditional women's garments with the help of a small loom. Since childhood, she has been working in her craft. Thanks to her business, she has been able to help her family succeed and is well-known in her town. Rosario is requesting a loan from Asociación Asdir to purchase raw materials to meet customer demand, increase her profits and provide a better quality of life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Crafts (Creation of traditional garments)

loans.name: Cecilia Cruz

texts.es: Doña Cecilia Menchú cuenta con 28 años de edad, es casada de oficios tejedora, “Elaboración de cortes típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 3 telares, habita junto a con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, llevan 6 años de elaborar cortes en su residencia que se encuentra ubicada en la Aldea Vásquez, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ellos puedan aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas por semana, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Cecilia Menchú is 28 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and 2 children. Both she and her husband are tailors and make traditional women's clothing. They have three looms and 2 employees working for their business. They have been making traditional garments for 6 years from their home in the Vásquez Village, located in the Totonicapán district in Guatemala.

Although customer demand has increased, the current economic situation makes it difficult for them to increase their capital. For this reason, Doña Cecilia has turned to the Asociación ASDIR to request a loan to purchase raw materials so that she and her husband can increase their weekly sales. With this loan, they hope to help their children succeed and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Crafts (purchase of raw materials)

loans.name: Juana Susana

texts.es: La señorita Juana Pérez tiene 20 años de edad, es Soltera de oficios tejedora, “Elaboración de cortes típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 3 telares, habita junto con sus hermanos menores que ella, se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 3 años de elaborar cortes en su residencia que se encuentra ubicada en la Aldea Vásquez, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima ya que de esa manera podrá aumentar sus ventas y mejorar su condición económica.
texts.en:
Juana Pérez is 20 years old. She is single and lives with her younger siblings. Juana and her siblings are tailors and make traditional women's clothing. They have three looms and 2 employees working for their business. They have been making traditional garments for 3 years from their home in the Vásquez Village, located in the Totonicapán district in Guatemala.

Although customer demand has increased, the current economic situation makes it difficult for them to increase their capital. For this reason, Juana has turned to the Asociación ASDIR to request a loan in order to purchase raw materials. With this loan, she hopes to increase her sales and improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Crafts (to purchase raw materials)

loans.name: Ruth Viridiana

texts.es:
El negocio de la señorita Ruth Viridiana Z. le esta haciendo falta variedad de mercancía, pero en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para surtir. 
  La señorita Ruth Viridiana y su mamá la señora  María Guadalupe son las que atienden al negocio ya que es la fuente de ingresos para ellas. 
Están solicitando un préstamo para poder tener más inventario en su negocio y así más ingresos, con el cual planean pagar este crédito.
texts.en:
Ruth Viridiana Z.'s business is lacking merchandise, but currently there is not enough money to buy more. Ruth Viridiana and her mother, María Guadalupe, tend to the business, given that it is the source of income for them. They are asking for a loan so that they will be able to have more inventory in their store and in this way, greater income, with which they plan to pay back this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for their store

loans.name: Anacleta Anastacia

texts.es: Doña Anacleta Menchú cuenta con 30 años de edad, es Madre Soltera de oficios tejedora, “Elaboración de cortes típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 3 telares, habita junto a  sus 2 hijos, se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 8 años de elaborar cortes en su residencia que se encuentra en la Aldea Vásquez, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas por semana, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Anacleta Menchú is 30 years old. She is a single mother and lives with her 2 children. She is a seamstress and makes traditional women's clothing. She has three looms and 2 employees working for her business. Doña Anacleta has been making traditional garments for 8 years from her home in the Vásquez Village, located in the Totonicapán district in Guatemala. Although customer demand has increased, the current economic situation makes it difficult for her to increase her capital. For this reason, Doña Anacleta has turned to the Asociación ASDIR to request a loan to purchase raw materials so that she can increase her weekly sales. With this loan, she hopes to help her children succeed and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Crafts (to purchase raw materials)

loans.name: Lucia Teodora

texts.es: Doña Lucia T. cuenta con 40 años de edad, es casada de oficios tejedora, “Elaboración de cortes típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 3 telares, habita junto a con su esposo y sus 4 hijos, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 15 años de elaborar cortes en su residencia que se encuentra ubicada en la Aldea Vásquez, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala, actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ellos puedan aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, aprovechando la oportunidad para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Lucia T. is 40 years old, married, and has 4 children who live at home. She and her husband are tailors by trade, and their workshop has three looms. Their business also employs two other people. Doña Lucia has 15 years experience sewing for people from her home in Aldea V., in the Totonicapan district of Guatemala, and currently, there is a high demand for her work. Unfortunately, the current economic conditions make it difficult to raise the necessary capital, and for this reason, the couple has asked for a loan from ASDIR. They will use the loan to buy material so that they can increase their sales and take advantage of this opportunity to better the lives of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy material

loans.name: José Ponciano

texts.es:
El señor José Ponciano R. esta terminado la construcción de su vivienda pero le esta haciendo el techo, pero tiene el proyectos de ponerlo de concreto para que sea mas seguro y duradero. 
  Este solicitando un préstamo para  la comprar de material, porque en este momento no cuenta con el capital necesario para poder llevar acabo la mejora. Él no pagara mano de obra ya que se dedica a la construcción de casas y en horas adicionales a su empleo se dedicara a su mejora. (En la foto no aparece el señor José Ponciano si no su esposa la señora María Guadalupe Domínguez ya que él se encontraba trabajo).
texts.en:
José Ponciano R. is finishing the construction of his home. He is making the roof, but he has plans to make it out of concrete so that it is more secure and durable. He is asking for a loan to buy materials because currently, he does not have the capital necessary to be able to carry out the improvement. He will not pay for labor, given that he dedicates himself to the construction of houses and in hours outside of his employment he will dedicate himself to the improvement. (José Ponciano does not appear in the photo, but instead his wife, María Guadalupe Domínguez, appears since José was working).

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To create a concrete roof

loans.name: Koem

texts.en: N., aged 60, lives in Pursat Province, Cambodia, where she has a plot of land in her village to cultivate different kinds of vegetables. She currently plants morning glories, Chinese kale, and cabbages, and she can make around $3 from her cultivating. She is widowed and has four children; all four of them are single. Two of her children are employed as domestic building workers. In view of the fact that vegetable planting is N.'s main source of income, she would like to request a loan of $600 to purchase a little more farmland for planting vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase a little more farmland

loans.name: Sot's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sot C. is group leader of six members who all live in Da village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables.  Her husband, Mr. Choem Chein, is a cow middleman. Mrs. Sot C. is requesting a loan to buy rice seeds and lotus seeds to grow on her field and her lake. She hopes to increase her income and improve family living conditions with this loan. She is 53 years old and the mother of six children, one of whom is a security worker while the others are enrolled in the local school. Mr. Pao P. could not come to take a loan but his wife did, so she is presented in the picture instead.

All the members in this group loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and lotus seeds to grow on her field and her lake.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita F. F. vive en Apopa municipio de San Salvador, como madre soltera, ha enfrentado todas las dificultades de la vida, pues su marido la abandono, dejándola sola con su hija. Con valor y fe en Dios, Margarita nunca se ha rendido, y ha educado y mantenido por si misma a su hija.
Con un negocio ambulante de venta de ropa y otros accesorios, Margarita es digna de admiración y orgullo, pues  siempre ha mantenido la frente en alto en su humilde profesión. En este momento Margarita solicita un préstamo para comprar nueva mercadería y le brinde nuevas ganancias para llevar a cabo su sueño de abrir un pequeño puesto fijo, en donde ofrecer sus productos.
texts.en:
Margarita F. F. lives in the Apopa municipality of San Salvador. As a single mother she has faced many difficulties in life, as her husband abandoned her, leaving her to raise her daughter by herself. With courage and faith in God, Margarita has never given up, and has educated and supported her daughter on her own. With a roving business selling clothing and other accessories Margarita deserves admiration and pride, as she has always held her head high in her humble profession. Margarita is currently seeking a loan to buy new merchandise and earn new income, in order to realize her dream of opening a small permanent stall where she could sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise, and use the income to pay for a permanent stall

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en: Mrs. K. Ly is a leader of a group of four who all live in the Andoung Snay village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a 52-year-old widow with a child who helps with her business. She has been selling basic products such as rice, sugar, salt, bean oil, and so on at her general store. Her business has been doing well and she wants to expand it. Thus, she needs a loan to be able to purchase more rice to earn more profits.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy rice, sugar, salt, and bean oil for her business.

loans.name: Mrs. Seng Hieng Sang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nine people living in the Thnal village in Kampong Chhnang province will share in this village bank loan, and they will use their portion of the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Seng Hieng S., the 28-year-old village bank president, is a cashew seller, and her husband, Mr. S. Samreth, is a motor repairer. She is applying her share of the loan to buy motorbike supplies for her husband business so he can earn more income. They have three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study. 

Three members in this group loan hold end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy motorbike supplies for her husband's business so he can earn more income.

loans.name: Sophors' Group

texts.en: Mr. Sophors S. is a leader of a group of four who all live in the Ta Krong village in Kampong Chhnang province. He is a firewood seller, and his wife, Mrs. Yeim Him, is a farmer who owns a piece of land that she uses to cultivate rice and vegetables. Currently, he does not have enough money to purchase firewood to re-sell to his customers. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy firewood to re-sell to his customers.

loans.name: Yenni Guisela

texts.es: Yenni Guisela H.  reside en San Ramón en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Desde hace ya tres años, vive con su esposo quien trabaja fuera de casa como obrero, la familia vive en casa alquilada, pues sus dos hijos pequeños, les causan demasiado gastos como para podes hacerse de una casa propia. Su hijo de 5 años ya  asiste al kínder , y el más pequeño tiene tan solo tres meses. Yenni ha montado en su casa un salón de belleza, donde trabaja todos los días y para incrementar sus ingresos lo ha surtido con diversos artículos como relojes, carteras, perfumes. Con el sueño de poder darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos, Yenni y su esposo solicitan un préstamo para invertir en su negocio, comprando productos que ayuden a vender más, pues les es necesario establecer una base económica solida, que brinde un respaldo en la futura crianza y educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yenni Guisela H. lives in San Ramón in the district of Cuscatlán, and has lived with her husband for three years. He works outside the home as a labourer, and the family lives in a rented house. With two small children they have too many expenses to be able to own their own home. Their five year old son is in kindergarten, while their younger son is only three months old. Yenni has set up a beauty salon at home, where she works every day. To increase her income she has diversified into selling other items including watches, wallets and perfume. With the dream of being able to offer her sons a better future, Yenni and her husband are seeking a loan to invest in the business, buying products that will help them to make more sales. It is important for them to establish a solid economic base that offers support for raising and educating their sons in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products to sell in a beauty salon

loans.name: Hung's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hung K. is a group leader of four wH. all live in Tang Kruos Lech village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a chicken breeder. Her husband, Mr. Suos Hak, is a farmer wH. owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, he faces an obstacle because he does not have enough money to buy rice seed to grow on his field. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Hung K. decided to request a loan to buy rice seed to support the field. She is 47 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, another is a farmer wH. helps their father work and the others are enrolled in the local school. Mrs. Norn T. could not come to take a loan but her husband did, so he is presented in the picture instead.

All the members in this group loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds to grow on the field.

loans.name: Bunsan

texts.en: Mr. Bunsan C. is a 36-year-old who lives in the Thmey village in Kampong Chhnang province. He is a construction worker who makes a small income to support the family. His wife, Mrs. Chhun Dany, owns a small store where she sells DVDs and CDs to the villagers. She wants to start breeding pigs to earn more income. Thus, Mr. Bunsan C. decided to ask for a loan to buy six piglets and pig food for his wife’s pig-breeding business.

loans.use: To buy six piglets and pig food for his wife’s pig-breeding business.

loans.name: Sy

texts.en: Mr. Sy H. lives in the Ty Buon village in Kampong Chhnang province. He is 32 years old and the father of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study.  His wife, Mrs. Toem Sora, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice.  He sells bamboos in the local village. In his business, he has a problem because he cannot provide delivery service for customers, which would increase his income. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy a horse to use with a cart for his bamboo deliveries. His wife is pictured with him.

loans.use: To buy a horse to use with a cart for bamboo deliveries.

loans.name: Seng's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Seng C. is a villager in Lvea village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a chicken breeder. Her husband, Mr. Prum Soeun, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice.  He has a problem with this plantation because his field is infertile which is badly affecting to his crop. Thus, Mrs. Seng C. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive. She is 34 years old and the mother of two children who are enrolled in the local school. 

All the members in this group loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Sary's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sary K. is a leader of a group of six members who all live in the Chamka village in the Kampong Chhnang province. She is a 52-year-old wife and mother.  She is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock to re-sell later a better price. Her husband, Mr. Yoeung San, helps her in this business and they have a child who is a driver who can also make a little income to help support the family. Since their business is doing well, they want to expand it by purchasing more rice to earn more profits.  

Five members in this group loans hold end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more rice to keep in stock to re-sell later at better price.

loans.name: Seun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Seun Mao is a loan group leader of four people who all live in Chamka village in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband, Mr. Phom Nan, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. In their plantation, they have a problem because their field is infertile. Thus, Mrs. Seun Mao decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to make her crop more productive. She is 50 years old and the mother of a child who is employed in a garment factory. 

Three members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the other has monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to make her crops more productive.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
M., 46 years old, is a food vendor. Every day she cooks food in her small restaurant to earn a bigger income for the family. Her business is close to the school and that gives her regular customers. As a former manicurist, she offered manicures and pedicures to people and was paid Php 60 for her service. But by doing so, she thought she wouldn’t achieve her dream so she started a food business and wants to make it grow. The restaurant business is easy for her because she knows how to cook. She started her business in 2000 with Php 10,000 capital.

She is asking a loan from CEVI to purchase vegetables for her small restaurant. Her husband, Nador M., helps her run their business.

CEVI helps Elizabeth achieve her dreams. She is provided with credit assistance, training and insurance coverage that CEVI gives to all its clients.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and other ingredients in her food business.

loans.name: Mohammad Rafiq

texts.en: M. Rafiq is the son of A. M.. He lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He lives with his family of six members. His younger son is engaged and is going to get married. M. Rafiq needs money for the expanses for his son’s wedding. As most people know, in Afghan people have different customs and they have to spend more money on weddings, so he requested an individual loan of 30000 Afghani for the term of 10 months. He would like to say that the loan process is the best because it can support those who really need money.

loans.use: Wedding expense

loans.name: Bernadith

texts.en:
“I am mother who has big dreams for my children. I am actually dreaming of having bigger store in the future,” says Bernadith D., a mother of two kids and a friendly store owner from Dauis Bohol.

She started her business in 1999 with the capital of Php 5,000. Her business is situated near her house along the highway. People in the neighborhood and passersby are coming in to buy foods and other necessities.

She is asking a loan from CEVI to buy additional stock for her store. She believes that with her additional capital in her business, she will earn better, bigger profits.

CEVI is supporting store owners in Dauis Bohol. All CEVI clients are provided with credit assistance, training and insurance coverage to make their business grow.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks in her store

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza has been a fruit and coconut seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 2 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $550. Every day she works at her business for 14 hours. She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more fruits and coconuts for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money.

Aziza is 27 years old, married, and has three children aged 11, 7 and 3.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and coconuts for her bussiness.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicita C., now 53 years old, owns a store. She has three lovely kids and all of them are studying. Her husband, Gil C., is a fisherman. Together they worked hard to sustain their family.

She is asking a CEVI loan of Php 12,000 to buy more goods for her sari-sari store and to buy old refrigerators also. Fish vending was her previous business but when she got married she decided to have a sari-sari store. She started her store in 2003 with capital of Php 3,000.

She is happy about being part of the CEVI credit program. Now, she enjoys receiving the credit assistance, training and insurance coverage that CEVI gives to all its clients.

loans.use: To buy more goods in her store

loans.name: Tuache Uvivu Group

texts.en:
Kamaria has been a bread, nut, katles and juice seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 3 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $550. Every day she works at her business for 16 hours. She is requesting loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more breads, nuts, katles and juice for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business to save money and pay school fees for their children.

Kamaria is 47 years old, married, and has four children aged 24, 22, 9 and 5. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Zaina and Asha. Each woman also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more food (breads, nuts, katles and juice) for her business.

loans.name: Amanullah

texts.en: Amanullah is the son of H. and lives in district 9 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is a businessman and all the family members benefit from the income he generates. He has a retail shop. He would like to advance his business and make some changes in it. He wants to take an individual loan of 30000 Afghani for the term of 12 months. He says that this is a wonderful program that can support all entrepreneurs to start and sustain a business.

loans.use: Buying more materials

loans.name: Salha

texts.en:
Salha has been a chicken and juice seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 2 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $90. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more chicken and juice for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and to save money for future use.

Salha is 30 years old, married, and has one child aged 6.

loans.use: To buy more food (chicken and juice) to expand her business.

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma has sold charcoal and fish in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 6 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $45. Every day she works at her business for 14 hours. She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy food for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and to save money.

Mwajuma is 33 years old, married, and has four children aged 12, 11, 9 and 6. She also cares for two additional dependents.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal, fish and oil in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Shamsuddin

texts.en: Shamsuddin who is a young man lives in district 1 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He has got a burger and ice cream shop where he works hard during all seasons, however in winter, he can not sell ice cream. Instead he sells some extra Afghani food then. He wants to expand his business and buy the essential things related to his business. He would like to receive an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani for a term of 12 months to support his family in a better way and progress well.

loans.use: Buying more needed materials for his cafe

loans.name: Maisha Bora Group

texts.en:
Mtumwa has a small store of charcoal and firewood and has also been a fish seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for a year. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $550.
