She has experience in the field for more than 15 years, thanks to her parents because they taught her many things in agriculture, how to have good results and a good income.

Galina's business was launched in 1999. She has more plans that she aims to perform in the near future. Galina works together with her son who is 20 years old; he is a student, but when he has free time, he always helps his mother with great pleasure. One future plan of the borrower is to increase working capital and namely to buy seeds and fuel to irrigate the 15 hectares of arable land to be more productive.

loans.use: to increase her working capital

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret W. is currently in the business of selling bread and eggs. Margret is 39 years old and married. Her husband is a nurse at the hospital. She has four children and they all go to school. She is requesting a loan to expand the business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business selling bread and eggs.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: La dame Adama D. est mariée, mère de 05 enfants. Elle s’active dans l’achat et la revente de tissus Thioup (teint à l’indigo Cette activité lui permettra d’améliorer ses conditions de vie et de subvenir aux nombreuses dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Ms. Adama D. is married and the mother of five. She is active in buying and selling “thioup” cloth (dyed with indigo). This business will enable her to improve her living conditions and to cover numerous day-to-day expenses

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy "thioup" cloth in builk for resale

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady N. est une femme mariée. Elle veut, avec ce prêt renforcer son commerce de divers produits alimentaires : mil, maïs, arachide. Son objectif est d’acquérir des biens personnels et d’appuyer financièrement sa famille.
texts.en:
Khady N. is a married woman. She wants to use this loan for boosting her commerce in various foods: millet, corn, and peanuts. Her objective is to acquire some personal assets and to support her family financially.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy millet, corn, and peanuts from wholesalers for retail sale

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes A. sells groceries and food supplies like maize, beans, and rice at BRM junction. Agnes has received junior high education.  She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a merchant. Agnes has been selling groceries, food supplies such as maize, beans, and rice for about 8 years. She is responsible for helping her husband pay rent, utility bills, and other basic expenses of the family. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy food supplies in larger quantities for re-sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to complete the family building she started with her husband.

loans.use: increase her capital to buy food supplies in larger quantities for re-sale

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet H. is a widow and has 4 dependents. She has received schooling through senior high. Janet sells soft drinks at Nyankumasi near Cape Coast, which she has done since 2002. Janet uses her income to pay for the children's school fees, rent, utility bills, and other financial expenses. Janet will use the loan to purchase more soft drinks to meet the increase in demand by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Janet plans to reinvest for the expansion of  her trade in soft drinks.

loans.use: purchase more soft drinks for re-sale

loans.name: Maty

texts.fr: Maty S. est une femme mariée, mère de 08 enfants plus 02 autres dont elle a la charge. Elle souhaite avec ce prêt renforcer son activité qui consiste au commerce en détail de mil, maïs, pâte d’arachide, huile de palme. Cette activité va lui permettra de beaucoup améliorer les revenus de son ménage.
texts.en:
Maty S. is a married woman and the mother of eight children, plus two others to support. She would like to use this loan to bolster her business, which consists of retail commerce in millet, corn, peanut butter, and palm oil. This business will enable her to improve her household income a lot.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods wholesale, such as millet, corn, and peanuts for resale

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. is married and has 2 children. She has received schooling through primary education. Comfort sells groceries and other food supplies at Jukia near Cape Coast, which she has done since 1974. Her husband is a farmer.

Comfort uses her income to help her husband pay rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Comfort will use the loan to purchase more groceries and bags of rice, cartons of cooking oil, and other food items to meet the increase in demand by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to reinvest for the expansion of her sales of groceries and other food items.

loans.use: purchase more groceries and bags of rice, etc. for re-sale

loans.name: Rejina

texts.en: Rejina D. is a hairdresser who owns a beauty salon at Nyankumasi Ahinkro near Cape Coast. Rejina has received junior high education.  She is a single parent and has 2 children. Rejina has been a hairdresser since 2004. She is responsible for paying the children's school fees, rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. Her loan will be used to buy different and varied hair products to meet the demand of her customers who come to the salon. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest for the expansion of  her beauty salon.

loans.use: buy different and varied hair products for her beauty salon

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
El señor Julio N. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz con su esposa, la señora Maria Laura y sus dos hijas.
El señor Julio es rentista del magisterio de esta ciudad y su esposa es ayudante en construcciones particulares.
Con anteriores créditos, el señor Julio realizo la construcción de una loza de hormigón armado y la construcción de dos habitaciones en obra fina.
El crédito es para la conclusión de la obra fina (pintado, ingreso de  de luz eléctrica, enchufes, etc.) de las dos habitaciones que se encuentran en la planta baja de su casa.
Esta es la doceava vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califican favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Julio N. lives in the zone of Pasankeri, on the western side of the city of La Paz. He lives in his own home with his wife Maria Laura and their two daughters. Julio is retired from the teaching profession, and his wife works as an assistant in private construction. With previous loans, Julio was able to build a foundation of reinforced concrete and two well-finished rooms. This loan is to completely finish the two rooms (painting, electrical wiring and plugs etc.), located on the ground floor of the house. This is the twelfth time that he has sought a loan, and the socioeconomic analysis classified him favourably as eligible for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials, stucco, paint, electrical plugs etc. to finish construction of two rooms in his home

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
El señor Roberto Q. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz con su esposa, la señora Matilda Huchani y sus tres hijas.
El señor Roberto es oficial de bajo rango en la policía nacional y su esposa es empleada en un restaurante, como ayudante de cocina.
El crédito es para la instalación de alcantarillado de su vivienda con servidumbre al vecino ( esto es comun en la ciudad de La Paz, se usa una parte del alcantarillado del vecino cuando la casa está localizada en una parte que está muy lejos de la calle principal donde corre el alcantarillado maestro de la zona).
Esta es la cuarta vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califican favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Roberto Q. lives with his wife Matilda Huchani and their three daughters in a house he owns in Pasankeri to the west of the city of La Paz. Roberto is a low-ranking official in the National Police and his wife is employed in a restaurant as a cook's helper. The loan will be used to install a sewer connection from the main city sewer line to his home with an offshoot to his neighbour's (this is common in the city of La Paz: one part of a neighbour's drainage is used when the house is too far from the main road where the main sewer line for the area is located). This is his fourth loan and our socio-economic analysis has determined that he qualifies for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for the installation of a sewer connection to his home.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel Ramírez Cayo vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposo, el señor Francisco Quispe y su hijo.
La señora Isabel es cocinera, vendiendo almuerzos en un puesto ambulante de su zona, y su esposo trabaja  como chofer de transporte publico.
Con créditos anteriores construyeron dos habitaciones en obra gruesa, las mismas que aun no pueden ser habitadas.
El crédito es para la conclusión de la construcción en obra fina de las dos habitaciones (las paredes y los tumbados deben ser revocados con estuco y luego recién pueden ser pintados, las conexiones eléctricas deben ser finalizadas, etc.,).
Esta es la octava vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Isabel Ramírez Cayo lives in the Pasankeri zone on the western side of the city of La Paz. She lives in her own home with her husband Francisco Quispe and their son. Isabel is a cook, and works as a street hawker selling meals in her neighbourhood. Her husband works as a public transport driver. With previous loans they completed the basic construction of two rooms, however they are not yet inhabitable. This loan is to completely finish the construction of the rooms: the walls and ceiling need to be covered in stucco and then painted, the electrical wiring needs to be completed etc. This is the eighth time she has sought a loan, and the socioeconomic analysis classified her favourably as eligible for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials, stucco, paint, electrical connections etc. to finish two rooms in her home

loans.name: Rehema H.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania. This is 30-year-old Rehema K. from Mbeya. She is married with 2 children, 3 and 12. Rehema has been running a business selling potatoes since 2004. She buys potatoes from the farmers and sells them in town.

She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Rehema currently earns about 96 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 250 USD in order to purchase 50 bags of potatoes in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase her capital by increasing the number from 50 bags to 100. Rehema thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase 50 bags of potatoes in bulk for re-sale

loans.name: Emma Estela

texts.es:
Emma tiene 56 años de edad, es casada, nació en un municipio del país, localizado a 40 kilómetros de la ciudad de Guatemala.  Empezó su negocio de venta de artículos de primera necesidad hace 4 años cuando se traslado a vivir a una comunidad de las orillas de la ciudad de Guatemala.  Cuando ella comenzó su negocio, no había otro negocio en su comunidad, por lo que el mismo era muy importante para los vecinos de dicho lugar.  Ella comenzó vendiendo frutas y verduras, luego vendió pan, arroz, fríjol y otros productos de consumo diario.  Su negocio ha ido creciendo a medida que las ganancias se lo permiten, ahora vende además algunas herramientas que se necesitan en dicho lugar, tales como clavos y palas.

Emma necesita el préstamo para surtir más su tienda, ya que sus clientes le demandas más productos.  Ella confía que el préstamo le ayudara mucho en su negocio.
texts.en:
Emma is 56 years old and married. She was born in a small rural town, about 40 km from Guatemala City. She began her current business selling groceries and basic consumer goods 4 years ago, when she moved from the countryside to one of Guatemala City's suburbs. She began selling fruit and vegetables and then later, bread, rice, beans and other daily necessities. When she started this business, it was the only one like it in her community and because of this, her business became a very important one in that neighbourhood. Over the years, Emma's store has slowly grown larger and today, she even sells some tools commonly needed in the community, like nails and shovels. Emma needs this loan so that she can further expand the range of products on offer in her store, just like her clients have asked her to do. She is confident that this loan will be a great help.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy goods for her store

loans.name: Gonzalo Mercedes

texts.es: El señor Gonzalo Mercedes Martínez tiene 59 años, está casado, y tiene tres hijos quienes todos estudian o trabajan. Gonzalo Mercedes ha trabajado como taller de soldadura hace treinta años, y su propósito para su negocio es mejorar su taller para obtener más espacio para todas sus herramientas. Don Gonzalo necesita este financiamiento por lo que tiene que comprar los materiales para cumplir con los trabajos que tiene pendiente. Sus sueños son de mejorarla calidad de vida de su familia para que no pasen necesidades. El monto que solicita es de C$ 13.000 córdobas a un plazo de 12 meses.
texts.en:
Gonzalo Mercedes Martínez is 59 years old, married, and has three children who either study or are working. Gonzalo Mercedes has worked as a soldering shop for thirty years, and his goal for the business is to make improvements and obtain more space for all of his tools. Gonzalo needs financing because he needs to buy materials to complete still-open work orders. His dream is to improve the quality of life of his family, so they will not be lacking of anything. The amount he requests is 13,000 córdobas at a term of 12 months.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Ms. Nina B. is the provider and breadwinner in her family; she has had to face many problems in her life, in order to help her children to have all their needs fulfilled. Nina's main activity is growing cereals and grain legumes, including the production of seeds. Nina is requesting a loan from MicroInvest to purchase all kinds of seeds she needs to increase her harvest. Through this she believes that she could increase her business to support her family.

Nina has been running her business since 1997 with very little capital. The business is located in Falesti district, Pruteni village. The land is plowed with the help of her horse Castan who helps his master by saving her money that she would otherwise have to spend to buy fuel. One future plan of Ms. B. is to increase her working capital for growing cereals.

loans.use: purchase seeds for her farming business

loans.name: Dorice

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania. This is 37-year-old Dorice L. from Mbeya. She is married with 4 children, between the ages of 6 and 18. Dorice has been running a poultry business since 2007. This client’s business is buying small chicks, raising them, and selling them when they grow up and are ready for consumption.

Dorice works at the business 6 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by her husband. Dorice currently earns about 110 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase about 150 chickens to increase her project. In the future, she plans to start a new business. Dorice thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase about 150 chickens to increase her project

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio Pavón tiene 57 años, está casado, y tiene 3 hijos. La actividad económica de Don Antonio es la elaboración de canastas, por lo que el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de hace dieciocho años. En esta manera, sus propósitos para su negocio son de obtener los materiales a un precio más bajo para realizar la compra de materia prima, y producir los artículos equivalentes a la demanda. Más tarde con la ayuda de los préstamos de Kiva, Don Antonio solicita de nuevo financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo ya que necesita realizar la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de sus productos. El solicita C$ 9.000 córdobas a un plazo de 9 meses.
texts.en:
Antonio Pavón is 57 years old, married, and has three children. The economic activity of Antonio is that of making baskets, and he has had this business for eighteen years. His intentions for the business include obtaining materials at a lower price and producing his baskets based on demand. With help from Kiva’s loans, he requests additional financing to have working capital. This will allow him to buy the raw materials he needs to produce his goods. He is requesting 9,000 córdobas for a term of 9 months.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing O. is 45 years old and married with 2 children who are in school, Blessing sells fairly used clothes. She travels to Cotonou, a seaport town in a neighboring country, every 2 weeks to purchase fairly used clothes to sell. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is requesting the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more fairly used clothes to sell. She says thanks to Kiva and all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fairly used clothes to sell

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela trabaja tiene una tienda donde todas las tardes a partir de las 18:00 vende Pollos a la broster y salchipapas, el esposo es transportista de taxi; estas dos actividades constituyen su principal fuente de ingresos con los que cubren la manutención de sus tres hijos. La familia vive en alquiler  en una casa ubicada en la zona de Villa Mariscal Sucre Rio Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra insumos por cantidad como ser papa, pollo, arroz, para de esta manera reducir el costo de los mismos e intentar mejorar sus ingresos.
 
Es el Tercer  crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago que demostró con nuestra institución le permite acceder a otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Marcela owns a shop, where every afternoon from 6.00pm onwards she sells fried chicken and 'salchipapas', a type of fast food that consists of thinly sliced pan-fried beef hot dogs or sausage and french fries, mixed together and eaten with different sauces. Her husband works as a taxi driver. These two activities make up their principal income sources, with which they cover the costs of raising their three children. The family lives in a rented house in the Villa Mariscal Sucre Rio Seco zone of the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to buy basic food supplies in bulk, including potatoes, chicken and rice. In this way she can reduce her expenses and try to increase her income. This is her third loan with Impro. Thanks to her good repayment history with the institution she is able to apply for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicken, rice, potatoes and other supplies in bulk for her shop

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora trabaja en el área rural de La Paz, es pequeña agricultora y productora de leche de vaca; trabaja con su esposo, ambos son de la tercera edad por esa misma condición fue discriminada en otras instituciones y su petición de préstamo fue negada.

Viven en la comunidad Chuñu chuñuni de la provincia los Andes a dos horas y media de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El crédito que ahora solicita lo destinará a la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana calidad para incrementar su producción de leche y mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
 
Segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago que demostró con nuestra institución le permite acceder a otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Teodora works in a rural area of La Paz. She is a small famer, and produces cow's milk. She works with her husband, and both are senior citizens. For this reason they were discriminated against by other institutions and had their loan request rejected. They live in the Chuñu Chuñuni community of the Los Andes province, two and a half hours from the city of El Alto. The loan she is now seeking will be used to buy a medium quality dairy cow to increase her milk production and improve her income. This is her second loan with Impro. Thanks to her good repayment history with the institution she is able to apply for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a medium quality dairy cow

loans.name: Salman

texts.en:
Salman S., 45, is a farmer, not only devoted to his work but also to being the father of a family consisting of his wife, 2 sons, and his elderly parents. He works hard raising cattle, which he has taken out to graze in the early mornings since 1998. Without a doubt it is not an easy task, but the love for his family gives his work reason and meaning.

Salman also has a car and uses it as a taxi to take people from his village to the city. But the main source of income in his family is still calf-breeding. Currently, Salman wants to improve his situation by increasing the number of his cattle which in the long run will provide better income. For this purpose he has applied for a loan of 1200 USD to purchase two calves. If you support him, he will be forever grateful.

loans.use: purchase two calves

loans.name: Mustagim

texts.en: Mustagim K. is married with one son. He has a great passion for cattle breeding and has been in this business for 4 years together, with his wife. He would like to expand his business by adding another two calves to the three he has. This is because springtime and the wedding season are near and demand for meat will be very high soon. Mustagim is requesting 1200 USD in order to buy two calves and to feed them. With the additional income Mustagim will be better able to cater for his family's financial obligations, especially the education of his current and future children.

loans.use: purchase two calves

loans.name: Dilgam

texts.en: Dilgam A. is a 23-year-old, single man who lives with his parents. Dilgam sells cosmetic and bath goods as shampoo, hair color, soap, perfume, washing powder. He proudly states that he has been in this line of business for 3 years. Dilgam purchases his goods from the neighboring city. The income he is able to generate from his business allows him to support his family (he is the sole breadwinner in his family). Now, Dilgam is requesting a loan in the amount of 1200 USD over a 15-month term, the proceeds of which will be used to expand his inventory of goods (i.e., he plans to purchase additional goods). Dilgam is a very hard-working man. Beside his main business Dilgam also works as teacher in the local school. Dilgam thanks everyone for their support, and he promises to repay his loan on time.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Qatiba

texts.en:
Qatiba K. is a very hard-working woman. She tries to make more money for the family by working hard each day. About 9 years ago, she decided to start raising and selling animals. This way she can pay for the education of her two children who have high hopes for the future. She raises calves and later sells them according to her clients' demand at the markets. She prepares them ready to eat for the eating pleasure of the people in her country.

Since Qatiba aspires to a great future, she decided to expand her business with the sole purpose of improving her family's living conditions and helping pay for her children's education so that they can one day become good citizens in society.

loans.use: purchase two calves

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en:
Kamil A. is 52 years old and is a married man with four adorable children. As an aspiring and hard-working man, he has always dreamed of achieving success in whatever he does. Thus, when he chose livestock breeding, he decided to become a successful businessman one day. He has been engaged in this business since a very young age, because his father was a farmer, too.

Being a school teacher, Kamil was receiving a very low salary and this pushed him to start his own business. He saw a new business opportunity: rearing calves, which is very profitable because of the constant demand for meat at the market. With this loan, Kamil will purchase calves and feed for them to expand his business. He plans to use the profits from his business to educate his children, improve the structure of his home, and improve the standard of living of his family.

loans.use: purchase two calves

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience I. is 48 years old and married with 8 children. She has a tailoring shop where she makes dress and sells tailoring materials. She is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more tailoring materials. She says thanks to Kiva and all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh J. is 35 years old. He is married with three children. He started his business in 2003 when unemployment and poverty pushed him to find a new source of income to support his family.

Saleh sells home products as well as office supplies. His store helped him step by step improve and expand the business with the goal of improving his family’s standard of living and continuing to pay for his children’s education.

Saleh also uses his car to bring goods from neighboring cities and also, he uses this car as a taxi to take local people to other villages. Today, Saleh faces a need for a loan of 1200 USD to purchase more office supplies because these products are in high demand. Your support can help his business and his family.

loans.use: purchase more office supplies to increase income

loans.name: Aidee

texts.es: Aidee tiene 36 años de edad, es madre de tres hijos de 10,7 y 6 años, posee su casa propia donde vive con su pareja desde hace 12 años. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y comida en un kiosco que tiene muy cerca de su casa, desde que comenzó a tratado siempre de mantenerlo surtido y de dar una buena atención a sus clientes. Empieza a trabajar a las 6 de la mañana con la venta de pan hasta las 9, luego inicia las preparaciones del menú que ofrecerá durante el medio día. A pesar que el lugar donde cocina es muy incómodo, Aidee continúa porque le gusta mucho su trabajo, termina de atender por la noche y si aun tiene clientes se queda hasta las 10 pm. Su anhelo es construir su casa en la  misma ubicación de su kiosco, porque es un lugar estratégico para la venta, porque circula mucha gente, de ese modo, ya no se quedarían despiertos sus hijos hasta muy tarde y estaría más cómoda en el momento de cocinar. Aidee es una socia muy activa en su banco comunal, el ciclo pasado tenía el cargo de fiscal, asegurándose que no existiera ninguna anomalía con los integrantes. Este es su 5to préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado pagar sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad. El dinero que solicita es para incrementar su mercaderías para su kiosco, y ese modo captar  más ingresos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Aidee is 36 years old and mother of three children, aged 10, 7 and 6. She owns her own home, where she lives with her partner of 12 years. Aidee works selling groceries and food in a kiosk near her house, and she always tries to keep it well stocked and to provide good service to her clients. She begins work at 6 in the morning, selling bread until 9, when she begins to prepare the menu she will offer at lunchtime. Although the space in which she cooks is very uncomfortable, Aidee continues because she really enjoys her work. She serves clients into the night, even staying until 10 pm if customers continue coming. She would like to build her home in the same location as her kiosk, because it is a great location for sales, with many people passing by. This would mean her children wouldn't need to stay up late and she would be more comfortable while preparing food. Aidee is a very active member of her village bank, in the last cycle she was in charge of the fiscal department, ensuring there were no problems with members. This is her fifth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and in this time she has shown that she is able to pay her quotas very responsibly. The money she is requesting is to increase the merchandise available in her kiosk, in order to earn more money for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing amount of merchandise

loans.name: Abdulali

texts.en:
Abdulali Q. is 45 years old. He is married with three children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells various kinds of foodstuffs such as: cookies, candies, macaroni, detergents, and many others in his grocery store which he built 10 years ago. Currently Abdulali has about US$ 500 in inventory. His monthly net profit is about US$ 100.

Today Abdulali is requesting a loan of 1200 USD for a term of 15 months to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. One of his dreams is that his children might progress by means of their studies, for which he is doing his very best. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: purchase more foodstuffs to generate more income

loans.name: Mike

texts.en: Mike A. is 60 years old and married with 10 children. He has a bakery where he bakes breads and meat pies which he learnt how to bake in Switzerland and in Germany. He is requesting the loan amount of N 80,000 to purchase more baking materials. He says thanks to Kiva and all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baking materials

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah M. is married and has 4 dependents. She has received schooling through junior high. Deborah sells groceries and other food supplies at Kwadoegya near Cape Coast, which she has done since about 4 years ago. Her husband is a merchant.

Deborah uses her income to help her husband pay rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Deborah will use the loan to purchase more groceries to meet the increase in demand by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Deborah plans to complete the family building she started with her husband.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries for re-sale

loans.name: Agafia

texts.en:
Ms. Agafia B. is 56 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is working as a teacher of the Romanian language in a middle school in Falesti district, Drujineni village, but her salary is not enough to enable her to complete working capital for growing of cereals and grain legumes, including production of seeds. It took her a long time together with her husband to save money needed for the education of their children.

Agafia is requesting a loan to purchase seeds to develop her business. She will repay the loan from her monthly salary. A future plan of the borrower is to sell merchandise on the wholesale market in the district.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for her farming business

loans.name: Gullu

texts.en: Gullu M. is 56 years old. She is married with four children. She started her own business more than 20 years ago because her husband’s salary was not enough for their family's expenses. Gullu sells washing powder, soap, shampoo and eggs that hew poultry produce. Her family is living with her husband's parents and the generated income allows Gullu to support her large household. Gullu dreams of her children getting a higher education. Today she requests a loan of 1200 USD for the term of 15 months. She is going to use the funds to purchase a wider range of goods. With the income she plans to buy her own store and educate her children. Gullu thanks everyone for their support and promises to repay the loan on time, as she did with her previous loan.

loans.use: purchase more bath goods and diversify food items

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es: Eleuterio tiene 44 años, está felizmente casado con la madre de sus 4 hijos, 3 de ellos viven en Lima y el menor vive con ellos. Desde muy niño se ha dedicado a labrar la tierra por ser de padres agricultores, pero desde hace dos años, dos veces al mes, también se está dedicando a la venta de carne, obteniendo como mínimo 150 soles de ganancia. Pero aunque el negocio de la carne sea muy rentable Eleuterio, dice no sentirse cómodo con esa actividad, porque las labores agrícolas le agradan mucho más, atender y cultivar sus sembríos lo llena de mucha satisfacción, y en la etapa de la cosecha transporta al mercado su producto, llegando a cotizar a un buen precio. Este esforzado agricultor no pierde sus la esperanza de llegar a  sembrar en grandes cantidades, pero en distintas fechas, para de ese modo hacer un capital y lograr comprar más terrenos de cultivo. Eleuterio trata de  no faltar a todas las reuniones programadas de su banco comunal, el ciclo pasado tenia el cargo de vocal, y se encargaba se pasar los comunicados del asesor de crédito a los demás integrantes. Este es su 5to préstamo, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado pagar sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes para el buen desarrollo de su planta, e insecticidas para contrarrestar el gusano que ataca a la papa.
texts.en:
Eleuterio is 44 years old and happily married to his wife, mother of 4 children. Three of them live in Lima, while the youngest lives at home. Being the child of farmers, Eleuterio has worked the land from a very young age, however for the past 2 years, he has also worked twice a month selling meat. From this he earns at least 150 soles of profit. Although the meat business is quite profitable, Eleuterio says he does not feel comfortable with this work, he much prefers agricultural work. Growing and caring for his plants fills him with satisfaction, and harvesting his product and bringing it to market can earn good money. This hard-working farmer does not lose his hope to eventually plant great quantities, but at different times, a method which allows him to build capital and purchase more land to cultivate. Eleuterio tries not to miss a single scheduled meeting of his village bank, and in the last cycle he was responsible for transmitting advice from the consultant to the other members. This is his fifth loan, and in this whole time he has been very responsible with his payments. The money he is requesting will be used to buy fertilizers to feed his plants, and pesticides to protect his potatoes from worms.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Ben (L’Entente) Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Ben sont toutes mariées, elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et 2 enfants vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier koko de la ville de Koutiala (région de Sikasso, république du Mali). Elles se sont  connues   à travers des liens   de voisinage et de travail.
Elles exercent presque la même activité d’achat et de vente  d’habits  et de chaussures. Elles sont très sollicitées dans cette activité. 
Afin  de satisfaire  le besoin de leurs clientèles qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Ben a décidé d’intégrer  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son cinquième  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter des balles de wax en gros et une quantité importante de chaussures à Bamako (la capitale de la république du Mali). Les pagnes  sont vendus en détail, au comptant ou à crédit au marché de Koutiala et au niveau des entreprises. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen  de 140 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle, qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux besoins de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités.
 Elles ont pour ambition de diversifier leur commerce en embrassant d’autres activités génératrices de revenu comme achat  de réfrigérateur  pour les boissons.
texts.en:
The five women of the group Ben are all married - their average age is 32, and they have 2 children living in large traditional extended families in the Koko area of the city of Koutiala (in the Sikasso region in the Republic of Mali). They got to know each other through neighbourhood and work connections. They are all engaged in almost the same business: buying and selling clothes and shoes. They are highly sought after in this business. In order to meet the needs of their clientele, which never stops increasing, the Ben group decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso, a microfinance institution, with whom they are on their fifth group loan. All of their previous loans were repaid properly. They intend to use this loan to buy pagnes wax (a type of brightly coloured African clothing) in bulk and to purchase a significant quantity of shoes in Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali). The pagnes are sold at retail, either in cash or on credit, at the market in Koutiala and also to companies. They each hope to realize a monthly profit of 140,000 FCFA during this cycle, an amount which will be used to pay off the loan and to meet the needs of their extended family, with the remainder being invested in their businesses. They are planning to diversify their business by embracing other income-generating activities such as purchasing a refrigerator to store drinks.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and re-sell clothing and shoes

loans.name: Vasif

texts.en:
Vasif Q. is 40 years old. He is married with two children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells different kinds of foodstuffs such as: sweets, products, preserved foods, soft drinks, juices and other items in his grocery store. Vasif is not alone in this business. His whole family actively helps him with sales. Vasif's additional source of income is as an accountant in the local organization, but works there just to keep his accountant knowledge. 
Vasif applied for a 1200 USD loan to grow and expand his business. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once and a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: purchase and diversify more food products

loans.name: Benkadi (L’Unité) Group

texts.fr:
Les sept femmes du groupe Benkadi sont toutes mariées, elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et 3 enfants vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier dar-salam 2 de la ville de Koutiala (région de Sikasso, république du Mali).
Elles exercent presque la même activité d’achat et de vente  de friperie. Par ailleurs, elles vendent des légumes et fruits. Elles sont  très sollicitées pour leurs activités. 
Afin  de satisfaire  le besoin de leurs clientèles qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Benkadi a décidé d’intégrer  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son deuxième  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé. 
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter des balles  de friperie à Bamako (la capitale de la république du Mali). Les fruits et légumes sont achetés au fur et à mesure et sont vendus en détail au marché  de Koutiala et  environs (zangasso, koro barrage). Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen  de 80 000 FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux besoins de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités. 
Elles ont pour ambition d’agrandir leurs activités telle que l’ouverture d’un magasin de friperie.
texts.en:
The seven women of the Benkadi group are all married; they have an average age of 36 and 3 children and live in big traditional extended families in the district called Dar-Salam 2 of the town of Koutiala (Sikasso region, Republic of Mali).

They work in almost the same business, buying and selling used clothing. They also sell vegetables and fruit. They are much in demand for these businesses.

In order to satisfy the needs of their ever-growing clientele, the Benkadi group decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are on their second solidarity loan (group loan). The preceding loan was correctly reimbursed.

They intend to use this loan to buy bales of used clothing in Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali). The fruit and vegetables are bought little by little and sold retail in the market at Koutiala and in the surrounding area (Zangasso, Koro Barrage). They each hope to earn an average profit of 80,000 F CFA during the term of the loan. That money will be used to pay the interest on the loan and support their extended family, with any remainder invested in their businesses.

Their ambition is to expand their businesses, for instance, to open a used clothing store.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of used clothing, fruit, and vegetables

loans.name: Rami

texts.en: Rami N. is 36 years old. He is married with two children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells home products, cookies and bananas since 1998. This is the one and only financial source for his family. His store is very famous in his community thus allowing him to have a good clientele. Today Rami is requesting a loan of 1200 USD for the term of 15 months to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. Rami’s main goal is to educate his beloved children so that someday they’ll become successful entrepreneurs. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: increase his stock by purchasing more food stuff

loans.name: Livia

texts.es: Livia tiene 31 años de edad, vive con su pareja desde hace 7 años, es madre de 3 hijos, en la actualidad esta viviendo en una casa alquilada. La agricultura es la actividad a la que se dedica, y la que también le da muchas alegrías; en esta oportunidad ha sembrado mayormente papa, seguida de arvejas. Las siembras que realiza son en chacras alquiladas. Esta labor la realiza junto a su esposo, pero a él no le gusta tanto como a ella las labores del campo, en estos momentos están cosechando y transportando sus productos al mercado de su localidad logrando vender cada saco de papa a 55 soles. Las miras a futuro de Livia es incrementar su producción para que con el tiempo pueda adquirir su terreno y construir su casa propia. Livia es algo sumisa, y prefiere no recibir ningún cargo en su banco comunal, pero sí ha demostrado puntualidad en sus pagos, este es su 5to préstamo con MFP. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes, para que desarrolle el fruto y se comercialice como calidad A1 en los mercados.
texts.en:
Livia is 31 years old, and lives with her partner of 7 years and three children in a rented home. Agriculture is the field in which she works, and it is one which makes her very happy. This season she has planted mostly potatoes, followed by peas. Her planting is done on rented farmsteads. She works together with her husband, but he does not enjoy working in the fields as much as she does, so he focuses on harvesting and transporting their products to the local market, where they sell potatoes for 55 soles (about 17 cents US) a bag. Looking to the future, Livia wants to increase production so that in time she can buy land and construct her own home. Livia preferred not to be in charge of any department of her communal bank, but she has shown that she is punctual with her payments, this is her fifth loan with Kiva partner MFP. The money she is requesting will be used to purchase fertilizers, in order to get her fruit up to A1 standards in the markets.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer

loans.name: Kwame

texts.en:
Kwame A. is married and has 4 dependents. He has received schooling through primary education. Kwame makes and sells palm oil at Dosi near Cape Coast, which he has done for about 9 years. His wife is a farmer. Kwame uses his income to pay for the children's school fees, rent, utility bills and other financial expenses.

Kwame will use the loan as additional capital to enable him to expand the purchase of palm fruit for the production of the palm oil to meet the increase in demand by his customers. With the new profits from his expanded business, Kwame plans to reinvest for the expansion of his trade in palm oil.

loans.use: additional capital to enable him to expand the purchase of palm fruit

loans.name: Anselma

texts.es: Anselma está felizmente casada hace 23 años, cuenta con 57 abriles y tuvo 6 hijos, uno de ellos falleció y ahora vive con tres de ellos en su propia casa. Por el afán de subsistencia de su familia se ha dedicado a infinidad de actividades, pero por ser esposa de un agricultor está sujeta mucho más a las labores agrícolas; siembran café, cacao y plátanos. Hace 8 meses, en el tiempos que no está en la chacra trabaja vendiendo frutas y verduras con una prima en su puesto del mercado, donde también ofrece sus propios productos. Anselma está feliz por la buena producción de los plátanos que ha tenido, pero ahora está notando que contando con un puesto es mucho más rentable vender ella misma sus productos que venderlos a los compradores que van hasta su chacra, por ello está muy motivada con en adquirir un puesto en el mercado y de ese modo incrementar sus ingresos económicos. Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP, y también la primera vez que es parte de un banco comunal, y ha hecho un compromiso de pagar las cuotas en las fechas indicadas, además está con muchas expectativas acerca del trabajo en grupo. El préstamo que Anselma está solicitando es para la compra de abonos para su chacra de plátanos, también para adquirir dos sacos de papa que le servirá de capital para su negocio mientras espera la cosecha del café.
texts.en:
Anselma is 57 years old and has been happily married for 23 years. She has had six children, one of whom died. Now, three of her children still live at home. While the family has tried their hand at a variety of business over the years, they have always been farmers. A farmer's wife, Anselma has always shared in the agricultural work, planting coffee, cocoa and plantains. For the past 8 months, she has also sold fruit and vegetables at the market with her cousin, who has a stall there. Anselma has been happy with the income her plantain crops have been bringing in, but her experience with her cousin has made her realize how much more money she could make if she sold her crops herself, rather than selling them wholesale to the buyers that come directly to the farm. She has become very motivated to get her own market stall and in this way, increase her earnings. This will be her first loan from MFP, and also the first time that she has ever been part of a Communal Bank. She is committed to making her payments punctually and really looks forward to working with her group. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer for her fields and also, to buy some potatoes in bulk that she will use as capital until her coffee plants are ready to be cultivated.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and potatoes

loans.name: Jamil

texts.en:
Jamil M. is a 27-year-old man. Jamil has been running his own small business for three years. He rents a store where he sells foodstuff, detergents, tooth-paste and other items.

Jamil is very friendly and polite which attracts clientele. He is requesting a loan of 1200 USD so that he can purchase more goods to sell and increase the range of products for sale. Jamil's dream is to provide his parents and future family with a better life and one day build his own store. Jamil promises to repay his loan during a 14-month time period and thanks everyone who decides to support him.

loans.use: purchase more foodstuffs for his little store

loans.name: Bertine

texts.fr:
La signification d’ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique d’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux a 0% d’intérêt aux gens très vulnérables et il est dans un groupe qui lancent bientôt un programme de la microassurance santé. 
 
K. Bertine a 50 ans et elle a deux enfants qui s’appellent Marker et Espertine. Bertine n’a pas pu allée a l’école pourtant ses enfants sont scolarisés. Ca fait 10 ans qu’elle a commencé la vente de divers comme les sardines et les vivres. Elle s’approvisionne au Marché Dantokpa, le marché central de l’Afrique d’Ouest. Actuellement, elle connaît la mévente, pourtant le crédit lui a permis de répondre aux ses besoins et dans le futur elle voudrait commencer par vendre en gros.
texts.en:
Bertine K. is 50 years old and has two children named Marker and Espertine. Bertine wasn’t able to go to school, though her children are. It’s been ten years since she started selling various goods, such as sardines and staple foods. She supplies herself at the Dantokpa Market, the central market of West Africa. Presently, she has been experiencing a drop in sales. The loan has however enabled her to meet her needs. In the future she would like start selling in bulk.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr:
Mme Coumba a 29 ans mariée et mère de 2 enfans. Elle vit dans une famille monogame avec son époux et ses 2 enfants dans le 1er quartier  de la ville de koutiala ( Region de Sikasso ). 
Mme Coumba n’a pas fréquenté l’école et s’est très vite intéressée aux activités génératices de revenu notamment la vente des fruits et légumes qu’elle a appris auprès de sa maman. Elle est à sa 10 ème  d’année d’expérience dans le commerce. Son activité est très rentable et lui procure assez de revenus, elle peut vendre plus de 2 gros caisse de pomme de terre par jour. 
Pour pouvoir élargir et augmenter son fonds de roulement, elle a fait recours  à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 4 ans. Après 7 prêts solidaires(prêt de groupe) tous remboursés sans difficulté,  elle est à son 1er prêt  individuel. 
 Avec ce prêt, elle  compte acheter , 10 caisses  de pomme de terre à Sikasso ( 3 ème Region du Mali ) et dans les villages environnants de Koutiala auprès de producteurs. Elle  vend  en face de   l’hopital de koutiala à une clientèle constituée de femmes et d’ hommes,  au comptant ou à crédit.
Elle compte générer un bénéfice de 65.000FCFA par mois qu’elle envisage d’ utiliser  pour  le remboursement des intérêts de son prêt,  participer aux charges quotidiennes de la famille et investir le reste dans d’autres activités.
texts.en:
Ms. Coumba, 29,married and the mother of 2 children, lives in a monogamous family with her husband and her two children in the first district of the town of Koutiala (Sikasso region).

Ms. Coumba did not go to school and became interested, early on, in earning money, more specifically in selling fruit and vegetables, a skill she learned from her mother. She is now on her 10th year in this business. Her business is very lucrative and brings in a good deal of revenue for her; she can sell more than two big boxes of potatoes per day.

In order to expand and increase her working capital, she came to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso four years ago. After 7 solidarity loans (group loans), all reimbursed without difficulty, she is on her first individual loan.

With this loan she intends to buy 10 boxes of potatoes in Sikasso (third region of Mali) and in the villages surrounding Koutiala from producers. She sells opposite the hospital of Koutiala to a clientele made up of women and men, for cash and credit.

She expects to generate a profit of 65,000 F CFA a month that she plans to use for reimbursing the interest on her loan and for participating in daily expenses for the family, investing the remainder in other activities.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of potatoes for re-sale

loans.name: Champ De Victoire Group

texts.en:
Charles sells salted fish imported from Angola. He started his first business running a telephone booth and selling beverages outdoors in 2000. His beginning capital was US$ 250. With hard work and determination, his business prospered and in 2004 he was able to rent a place for his business and move it indoors.

In 2005, that building was sold by the owner and Charles had to move out and look for another place to do business. Unfortunately, his new place was located in an area where he was not known. So, he had to start building up a new customer base. As Charles’ goods did not match the needs he saw in that area, he changed his business and became a salted fish seller.

Charles is now well-known and liked in this new area. He has been with Hope DRCongo since 2007. Since that time, his business has prospered, and the loans he has received have helped him rent a well-located business place. He makes about US$ 80 in profit each week. His working capital is US$ 600.

Charles is 42 years old, married, and the father of four children, aged between 1 and 17 of whom two go to school. His ambition is to become a salted fish wholesaler in his new area.

loans.use: To rent a place and move his business indoors in order to avoid the heavy rain and the strong sun

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Lazim

texts.en:
Lazim A. is a 39-year-old, married man with two children. Lazim sells confectioneries such as candies, cookies, pastries, and foodstuffs as sugar, salt, mayonnaise, and other items. He is proud that he has been in this line of business for approximately 8 years.

Lazim purchases his goods from the neighboring city. The income he is able to generate from his business allows him to support his family; he is the sole breadwinner in his family. Now, Lazim is requesting a loan in the amount of 1200 USD over a 14-month term, the proceeds of which will be used to expand his inventory of goods (i.e., he plans to purchase more foodstuffs). Lazim thanks everyone for their support, and he promises to repay his loan on time.

loans.use: purchase more foodstuffs for his little store

loans.name: Nuria

texts.es: Nuria tiene 33 años, es casada hace 11 años, madre de dos hijos viven en su casa propia. Ella y su esposo son agricultores, tienen cultivos de fruta cítrica en terrenos de sus familiares, cosechan desde enero al mes de marzo, al pasar esta temporada, no tienen otros ingresos, por lo que su esposo trabaja como albañil y Nuria realiza distintas actividades, una de ellas es vender ropa con su hermana cada 15 días, los fines de semana (como aparece en la foto); y fue con este negocio que Nuria conoció a personas que se dedican a la sericultura; desde entonces, hace un año, empezó a criar gusanos de seda. A esta labor le presta mucha atención porque le complace y cree que le será muy rentable. Nuria sueña en convertirse en una próspera negociante, y no esperar con mucha ansiedad solo las cosechas de sus cítricos para tener ingresos económicos. También tiene muchas esperanzas de progresar como persona, y dentro de su banco comunal. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y está comprometida en pagar las cuotas en las fechas señaladas, para no caer en morosidad. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes y para sembrar fréjoles, asimismo abonar sus cítricos, y si le alcanza algo de dinero lo invertirá en la crianza de gusanos.
texts.en:
Nuria is 33 years old and has been married to her husband for 11 years. They have 2 children, who are both living at home. Nuria and her husband are farmers. They cultivate citrus fruit on their family's plots and they harvest the fruit between January and March. Because their farming does not bring in any money the rest of the year, Nuria's husband also works as a builder and she dedicates herself to a variety of activities. For example, she sells clothes with her sister every other weekend (see photo). Once, while she and her sister were selling clothes, they met people who farmed silk and who had been raising their own silkworms for a year. Listening to these people carefully, Nuria realized that the idea of becoming a silk farmer really appealed to her. She also thinks it will be quite profitable and would love to become a successful businesswoman in this trade. It would be wonderful to have another steady income, and not to have to wait so anxiously for the citrus harvest each year. Nuria also hopes to become a very active member of her communal bank and thus grow as a person. This is her first loan from MFP, and she is committed to making her repayments punctually. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer for the citrus trees, to plant beans and, if there is any money left, she will use it to start raising silkworms.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for fertilizers

loans.name: Beni Group

texts.en:
Béatrice W. is 49 years old and the mother of four children, of whom two are twins. They are aged between 17 and 25. Besides her own children, she also takes care of an orphan aged 17. Three of the children in her care are enrolled in school.

Béatrice began her business in 2004 selling a five-kilo bag of sugar. Her beginning capital was US$ 5. As she used to sell near a garage, she quickly noticed what the mechanics’ needs were. She then catered to their needs by buying and selling peanuts and cakes. Over the months, those mechanics become loyal customers. With hard work and good management, she used her profits to increase her inventory from one five-kilo bag of sugar to ten.

Béatrice joined "Beni", one of Hope’s groups, last September. The two loans she has received have helped her to diversify her business by beginning to sell loaves of bread. Beatrice’s business makes a profit of about US$ 40 per week. Her dream is to open a beverage store and a clothing shop. Beatrice’s strategies are based on keeping up good relationships with her customers and knowing their daily needs.

loans.use: To reinforce the working capital of the various businesses

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Elvis

texts.es: Elvis tiene 33 años, hace 8 años está casado con la madre de sus dos hijos, en la actualidad están viviendo en una casa alquilada. Los fines de semana se dedica a sus plantaciones de fruta, y desde hace 2 años alquila un motocarro para realizar servicio de taxi en su localidad. En esta labor trabaja desde las 4.00am hasta 11.00pm, de lunes a viernes, en época escolar llega a obtener 80 soles diarios, y en tiempos de vacaciones, 40 soles, de ello tiene que pagar 25 soles por el alquiler del vehículo. En este momento Elvis tiene dificultad de trabajar con la moto porque se le venció su licencia de conducir, mientras no cambie de categoría tendrá dificultades con los policías de transito. Para el futuro desea comprar su propio motocarro, porque la actividad es muy rentable y adicionando a esto, lo que obtiene por su producción agrícola, mejoraría su situación económica. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, en su banco comunal ha hecho el compromiso de no caer en morosidad, además tiene deseos de trabajar con esta modalidad de aquí en adelante. El dinero que solicita es para que realice el cambio de categoría a su licencia de conducir, y de ese modo seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Elvis is 33 years old and has been married for 8 years. He and his wife have 2 children and they live together in a rented house. On weekends, he dedicates himself to his orchards, but during the week he rents a motorized rickshaw and runs a taxi service. He has been driving for 2 years now, and from Monday to Friday, Elvis works from 4am to 11 pm. He rents the rickshaw for 25 soles a day and earns 80 soles a day during the school year. During school vacations, he earns 40 soles a day. Currently, Elvis is having difficulty with his work, because his driver's license has expired and he worries about getting stopped by the traffic police before he manages to raise the money he needs to renew it. In the future, he would like to own his own rickshaw because then his driving would be quite profitable, and combined with the proceeds he earns from his fruit cultivation, his financial situation would rapidly improve. This is his first loan from MFP and he is committed to never falling behind on his payments, especially because he hopes to be a client of his communal bank for a long time to come. He will use this loan to pay the fees to renew his license so that he can keep working.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To renew his driver's license

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es: Eugenia tiene 40 años, tiene 5 hijos, D. los cuales dos D. ellos realizan estudios superiores en Lima, y con el resto viven en su casa D. L. chacra. L. agricultura es una actividad que L. ha dado penas, cuando no hubo producción, y también alegrías en tiempos D. buena cosecha. En una D. esas cosechas exitosas D. café logró comprar más campos D. cultivo, asimismo adquirió un motocarro que le permite sacar sus cosechas D. L. chacra a L. ciudad y hace poco ha obtenido el permiso para transporte público en L. municipalidad, generando ingresos económicos adicionales para su hogar. Los cultivos D. sus chacras los realiza junto a su esposo y sus hijos, y ahora que su moto está lista para circular por L. ciudad su esposo L. manejará, y cuando tenga labor agrícoL. L. alquilarán. Eugenia es muy activa en s banco comunal, pese a L. distancia en que vive, está bien enterada D. todas las actividades que realizan donD. participa con mucho dinamismo. Este es su 3er préstamo, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado pagar sus cuotas en las fechas programadas sin caer en morosidad. El dinero que solicita es para terminar D. pagar los trámites para L. circulación D. su motocarro, y también invertirá en L. compra D. fertilizantes para su chacra D. café.
texts.en:
Eugenia is 40 years old. She has 5 children, 2 of whom are studying in Lima and 3 of whom live at home. The family lives on the plot of land they cultivate together. It hasn't been easy making a living off of agriculture because sometimes there hasn't been anything to harvest. Then again, there have also been good times, when the harvest was large. Once, the family had such a good coffee crop, they were able to buy more land and even a scooter. Not only does the scooter make it easier for them to transport their crops to the market in the city, but they have also received a license to use it for public transportation. Now, when it is not needed at home, Eugenia's husband will drive the scooter as a taxi and bring in some extra income. Eugenia is a very active member of her communal bank and despite how far away from the other members she lives, she is always involved in their activities. This is her third loan, and she has always been punctual with her payments. She plans to use this loan to pay off the cost of getting her scooter licensed and also, to buy some fertilizer for her coffee plants.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Transport license and  fertilizer.

loans.name: Hamidou

texts.fr:
Mr Hamidou a 39 ans, veuf et père de 4 enfants, il habite  dans le quartier Darsalam II de la ville de koutiala ( Region de Sikasso ).
Pour des raisons familliales, Hamidou n’a pas eu la chance d’étudier. Cet aventurier a commencé ses activités par le gardiennage, et  avec son salaire, il a pris l’initiative d’exercer une activité génératrice de revenu. Aujourd’hui il est vendeur de boissons de fabrication moderne au centre culturel de koutiala et cela depuis 2 ans.  L’ activité qu’il mène est rentable, surtout  pendant les saisons chaudes de l’année où les êtres humains ont besoin des boissons fraiches pour se raffraichir. 
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante,  Mr T. décida de solliciter un prêt auprès de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt  indivduel .
 Hamidou compte acheter, 40 casiers de boissons (non alcoolisées et alcooilsées) auprès des depositaire agréés de la place. Il vend généralement au comptant et en détail à une clientèle  composée de femmes et d’ hommes.
Il compte réaliser sur un bénéfice de 50.000FCFA par mois qu’il utilisera  pour  le remboursement des intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux nombreuses charges de la famille et investir le reste dans son activité   
Son ambition  est l’ouverture d’un dépôt de boisson à koutiala ville.
texts.en:
Mr. Hamidou, age 39, is a widower and the father of four. He lives in the Darsalam II district of the city of Koutiala (Region of Sikasso). For family reasons, he didn't have the chance to attend school. This adventurer first began working as a caretaker. And with this salary, he took the initiative to generate revenues. Today, he is a retailer of modernly-produced beverages at the Koutiala cultural center and has been for two years. The work he does is profitable, especially during the hot seasons of the year when human beings need cold drinks as refreshment.

In order to satisfy his burgeoning customer base, he decided to request a loan from the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which he is on his first individual loan. He plans to buy 40 cases of drinks (alcoholic and soft drinks) from local authorized dealers. He generally sells in cash and at the retail level to customers composed of women and men.

He intends on realizing a profit of 50,000 francs CFA per month that will be used to pay the loan interest, to cover numerous family expenses, and to invest the rest in his business. His ambition is to open a beverages outlet in Koutiala City.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies of beverages

loans.name: Thérèse

texts.fr:
La signification d’ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique d’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux a 0% d’intérêt aux gens très vulnérables et il est dans un groupe qui lancent bientôt un programme de la microassurance santé. 
 
K. Thérèse a 55 ans et elle s’est mariée avec ASSIGNANME Archile. Ils ont trois enfants qui s’appellent Aurelien, Jeanne, et Léa. Ca fait 30 ans qu’elle a commencé de vendre les pagnes, une vêtement traditionnelle béninoise, et les bijoux. Actuellement, Thérèse vend aussi les cartes de recharges et les chaussures. Le revenu de crédit lui a permis d’acheter une moto. Elle a loué la moto quotidiennement à un chauffeur qui travaille comme un taxi moto et qui lui rembourse. Dans le futur, elle voudrait commencer par vendre les pagnes et les bijoux en gros.
texts.en:
Thérèse K. is 55 years old and married to Archile ASSIGNANME. They have three children named Aurelien, Jeanne, and Léa. It’s been thirty years since she started selling pagnes (traditional Beninese clothing) and jewelry. Currently she also sells mobile phone cards and shoes. Loan income has enabled her to buy a motorbike, which she rented out each day to a taxi-moto driver, who then reimburses her. In the future, she would like to start selling pagnes and jewelry wholesale.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and jewelry

loans.name: Johnny

texts.es: Johnny tiene 38 años de edad, viene conviviendo cerca de 8 años con su pareja, es padre de dos hijos que son el motivo de su desvelo, esta familia vive por el momento en una casa alquilada. Desde muy pequeño ha visto trabajar a sus padres en las labores agrícolas sembrando café y frutos cítricos, y fue esta labor que les dio ciertas comodidades cuando aun vivía con sus padres. Pero ahora que su padre ya está anciano, él se hizo cargo de las chacras. Paralelo a ello, hace 6 meses exactamente viene trabajando con un motocarro alquilado haciendo servicio de transporte de pasajeros, iniciando su labor a las 6.00am hasta 11.00pm de la noche, donde obtiene neto la suma 40 soles diarios. En el poco tiempo que viene trabajando con la moto se ha dado cuenta que  le agrada este tipo de trabajo, inclusive ha pensando comprase una propia, porque le sería más rentable. Y sumando a esto las ganancias obtenidas por sus cultivos, sabe que mejorará considerablemente su situación económica. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, tiene muchas expectativas positivas del trabajo en su banco comunal, el resto de los integrantes lo han nombrado secretario y él recibió el cargo con mucho entusiasmo, espera no defraudar a sus compañeros, ni a los que confían en su trabajo. El dinero que solicita es para el pago del alquiler de la moto por 4 meses adelantados, y evitar que lo alquilen a otra persona; el resto del dinero es para la compra de fertilizantes de para sus cultivos de cítricos.
texts.en:
Johnny is 38 years old, has lived nearly 8 years with his partner, and is the father of 2 children who are the motivation for his efforts. The family lives, for the moment, in a rented home. Since he was very young, Johnny has seen his parents working as farmers, growing coffee and citrus fruits, and it is this work which has given his parents the few comforts they currently have. Now that his father is older, Johnny is in charge of the fields. At the same time, for the past six months exactly, he has been using a rented motorized rickshaw to chauffeur passengers. He begins this work at 6 in the morning and works until 11 at night, making a net 40 soles a day. In the short time he has been driving he has realized he enjoys this kind of work, and has thought of buying a rickshaw of his own, as it would be mO. profitable. Adding to this the profits from the crops, he knows that he will be able to significantly improve his economic situation. This is his first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he has many positive expectations about working with a communal bank. The other members have named him secretary, and he accepted the post with a great deal of enthusiasm. He hopes not to disappoint his co-members or those who trust in his work. He is requesting the loan in order to pay the rent on the rickshaw for the next four months, to avoid it being rented to another person. The rest of the money will be used to buy fertilizers for his citrus plants.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Advance payment of rent for motorized rickshaw used for work

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel A. is married and has 4 dependents. He has received schooling through senior high. Emmanuel makes and sells palm oil at Ayaase Road near Cape Coast, which he has done since about 2 years ago. His wife is a petty trader.

Emmanuel uses his income to pay for the children's school fees, rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. Emmanuel will use the loan as additional capital to enable him to increase the purchase palm fruit for the production of the palm oil to meet the increase in demand by his customers. With the new profits from his expanded business, Emmanuel plans to reinvest for the expansion of his trade in palm oil.

loans.use: additional capital  for the production of the palm oil

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en: Ludmila G. is an elderly person; she is 65 years old and she is living in Falesti district, Drujineni village. Her business is raising cattle for sale at the market. Ludmila has requested a loan to buy another cow to increase the number of cattle she is raising; also that will serve as her alternative source of income to develop her business. Her business greatly helped her in sending her children to school. Ludmila is very happy that there are people as lenders from Kiva that support small entrepreneurs like her.

loans.use: to buy another cow

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard B. is married and has 3 children. He has received schooling through junior high. Richard sells bread which he bakes himself opposite Jakai Primary School near Cape Coast, which he has done for about 4 years. His wife is a petty trader.

Richard uses his income to pay for their children's school fees, rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. Richard will use the loan to purchase more flour, sugar, margarine, and other ingredients for the baking of bread. With the new profits from his expanded business, Richard plans to reinvest for the expansion of his business baking bread.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, margarine etc. for baking bread

loans.name: Sognon Hermine

texts.fr:
La signification d’ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique d’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux a 0% d’intérêt aux gens très vulnérables et il est dans un groupe qui lancent bientôt un programme de la microassurance santé. 
 
D. Sognon Hermine s’est mariée avec KEHOUNDE Mathias et ils ont deux enfants qui s’appellent Aurore et Landry, tous les deux scolarisés. Hermine vend le divers depuis 9 ans et elle a ajouté les cartes de recharges. Le revenu de ses derniers crédits lui a permis d’acheter les biens durables et les pagnes, des vêtement traditionnelle béninoise, et aussi les accessoires de ses activités. Dans l’avenir elle voudrait commencer par vendre les cartes de recharges en gros.
texts.en:
Sognon Hermine D. is married to Mathias KEHOUNDE, and they have two children named Aurore and Landry, both in school. Hermine has been selling various goods for 9 years, and she has added rechargeable phone cards to her array. The income generated from her previous loans allowed her to buy durable goods, pagnes (traditional Beninese clothing), and also accessories for her business. In the future, she would like to begin selling rechargeable phone cards in bulk. The meaning of ALIDE in the local language of Benin, Fon, is "there is always a path for the poorest." Benin is a small country in West Africa next to Nigeria, and its GDP per capita is $1,500. ALIDE offers special zero-interest loans to highly vulnerable people, and it is part of a group that will soon launch a micro health insurance program.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and re-sell various goods

loans.name: Gisele

texts.fr:
La signification d’ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique d’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux a 0% d’intérêt aux gens très vulnérables et il est dans un groupe qui lancent bientôt un programme de la microassurance santé. 
 
B. Gisele s’est mariée avec AMINOU Charles et ils ont quatre enfants ensemble qui s’appellent Sese, Carmen, Elise, et Hubert. Tous ses enfants sont scolarisés. Gisele vend les produits de beauté et les mèches depuis 5 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au Marché Dantokpa, le marché principal de l’Afrique d’Ouest. Dans le futur elle voudrait renforcer ses fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
Gisele B. is married to Charles AMINOU and they have four children together, named Sese, Carmen, Elise, and Hubert. All the children are in school. Gisele has been selling beauty products and weaves for 5 years. She supplies herself at the Marché Dantokpa, the principal market in West Africa. In the future, she would like to strengthen her basic working capital. The meaning of ALIDE in the local language of Benin, Fon, is "there is always a path for the poorest." Benin is a small country in West Africa next to Nigeria, and its GDP per capita is $1,500. ALIDE offers special zero-interest loans to highly vulnerable people, and it is part of a group that will soon launch a micro health insurance program.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and re-sell beauty products

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
