loans.name: Doung's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is being requested by four borrowers, all of whom live in Kok Chork Commune, in Siem Reap Province. The group leader, Mrs. N. has been selling groceries out of his house for more than five years. She has a lot of customer that buy her wares as she is well known in the village. She is married and has four children. All four of them are single and in school. Her husband is a staff member at Cambodia national airport. Mrs. N.'s business is going smoothly and she has currently sold all the groceries from her stocks. Therefore, N. would like to request a loan to buy additional grocery inventory to re-sell for profit. 

The other three borrowers are:  Saroeum, 36, is a local souvenir seller, who asks for a loan as capital to expand her business.  S. is aged 32 and sells groceries in the area of Airport. She is applying for a loan to buy a variety of grocery products for sale.  S., 38, sells soft drinks and she needs a loan to enlarge her business.

loans.use: To buy additional grocery inventory for resale

loans.name: Asaf

texts.en:
Asaf is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town. He is settled in the Fuzuli region, in the Mahmudlu-1 village. Asaf was born in 1984. This young man is married and has a little daughter, who is one year old. 

Asaf has been in the sheep breeding business for six years. He is requesting a loan to purchase ten pregnant sheep to improve his sheep-breeding business.

He will sell the lambs of these sheep after six months and buy more pregnant sheep. This is a usual method for increasing the flock of sheep breeders. In the future, Asaf plans to build a winter stable and summer shed for his sheep.

loans.use: To purchase ten pregnant sheep

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Mambo ("Hello") from Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Juliana M. from Mwanza. She is separated from her husband, and has 3 children between the ages of 11 and 19 years old. Juliana has been running a grocery business since 2008. Her shop is a very basic structure made of wood with a tin roof. She sells items such as beer, soda and water. She works in her business for 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Juliana currently earns about $160 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 USD to purchase drinks like beer, soda and water. In the future, she plans to open another business. Juliana thanks you for your support!

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Faraja C. from Mbeya. She is single with three children between the ages of seven and 12. Faraja has been running a grocery business since 2006. Her business is to purchase items wholesale and sell them on a retail basis. She works at the business for 16 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by one employee and one family member. Faraja currently earns about 70 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 450 USD in order to buy more drinks in bulk. In the future, she plans to move the business to a better location, to increase her stock and to open a new business. Faraja thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy groceries in bulk

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru:
Муродов Джамшед Ашуралиевич 1982 года рождения, женат. Начал свой бизнес с продажи хозтоваров и его стаж в этой деятельности 7 лет. Он торгует на рынке "Станция" города Вахдат хозяйственными товарами. В его ассортименте имеются электропечь, электроплита, электрочайники, нагреватели, светильники, ведра и тазики. Также в продажи имеются разновидность чайников, кухонные комбайны, посуды, термосы, утюги. Покупает товар в оптовом рынке Корвон и у поставщиков из Китая.
Джамшед хочет пополнить свой товар, увеличить товарооборот и получить больше доходов. Он хочет получить с помощью программы Кива займ в сумме 2000 сомони чтоб закупить электропечи и термосы.
texts.en:
Jamshed Ashuralievich M. was born in 1982. Jamshed is married. He has a business which he started seven years ago by selling household items. Now he sells household items at the station market of Vakhdat town. He sells a variety of electrical appliances and kitchenware. He buys wholesale from shuttle traders who bring goods from China. Jamshed would like to increase the assortment of goods and increase cash flow. He is applying for a loan of 2000 somoni for purchasing electrical ovens and thermos bottles.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase thermos bottles and electrical ovens

loans.name: Habibullo

texts.ru: Хабубулло мужчина в возрасте 35 лет , женат имеет троих детей.Жена швея на дому.Сам Хабибулло работает врачом в районной больнице.Он врач терапевт ,весь Уткансой его знают и обращаются за медицинской помощью.Кроме своей основной работы он занимается откормом скота.У него сейчас дома две коровы и 7 баранов.В его отсутствие за скотом ухаживает его жена и сыновья.Для увеличения численности скота Хабибулло решил получить кредит.Для чего и обратился в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Habibullo A. is 35 years old. He is married and has three children. His wife is a seamstress and works from home. Habibullo is a physician at a local hospital. He is well known in Utkansoi and people often turn to him for medical help. In addition to his regular job, Habibullo raises livestock. When Habibullo is at work, his wife and sons take care of the two cows and seven sheep that they own. Habibullo is applying for a Microinvest loan because he would like to purchase more livestock.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cattle

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 29 year old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Ibrahim has metal business, working in aluminum. He builds and repairs windows and doors. Ibrahim requested a loan of 600 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. 

This is his second loan and he has always repaid his payments on time. His previous loan helped him improve his business, as well as his house. His clients are his friends and neighbors. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 39-year-old Jennifer M. from Mwanza. She is married with one child aged eight. Jennifer has been running a tailoring business since 1999. Client’s business is to make tailoring clothes. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, six days per week. Jennifer currently earns about 150 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase bedsheets and resell them. In the future, she plans to add more types of cloth. Jennifer thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase bedsheets for resale

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 25 year old woman who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon. Khadija has been working at door to door selling for a year. She sells make up, perfumes and accessories, as well as plastic boxes for food. Khadija requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her business. This is the first time that Khadija has requested a loan.

Her clients are her friends, neighbors and some shops. When she first started her business, Khadija didn’t have sufficient start-up capital. She decided to go into this business because of her experience in sales and her good reputation. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: Khadija will use the loan to purchase merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 48 year old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Ibrahim has been working as a car painter since 2003. He requested a loan of 1200 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a compressor, painting materials and tools for his business. This is his third loan cycle and he has always repaid on time.

His previous loans helped him improve his business as well as his financial situation. Ibrahim is special in his work as he is energetic and he knows how to treat his clients. His clients include friends, neighbors and others. Ibrahim decided to go into this activity because of his experience in the business which he learned when was young. In the future, he plans on improving his business and his family situation.

loans.use: Ibrahim will use the loan to purchase a compressor, painting materials and tools for his business.

loans.name: Tunzala

texts.en:
Tunzala (her husband is pictured) is a mother of one child. She was born in 1984, and is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, now settled in the Bala Bahmanli village. 

Tunzala and her husband have five years of experience in the animal-sales business. They are requesting a loan to purchase two calves to fatten for selling. This will improve their business and enable them to purchase more calves to fatten for selling.

loans.use: To purchase two calves

loans.name: Hamrokul

texts.ru: Хамрокул отец шестерых детей, жена работает в колхозе.Сам Хамрокул пастух в колхозе.Он хорошо разбирается в породах скота.И с молодости он имеет свой бизнес по купле и продаже скота, с чего и имеет доход для содержания семьи.У него большая семья.четверо детей учатся в училище.Хамрокул хочет увеличить свой бизнес.Он на фото вовремя выдачи.
texts.en:
Hamrokul A. is a father of 6 children. His wife works on a collective farm. Hamrokul works as a shepherd for the collective farm. He is good at livestock breeding and has had livestock business since he was young. This helps him support his large family. Four of his children go to community college. Hamrokul is applying for a loan because he would like to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cattle

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 49-year-old Lucia C. from Mwanza. She is widowed with four children between the ages of 12 and 25 years old. Lucia has been running a grains business since 1998. Her business is selling grain. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Lucia currently earns about 150 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase more grain and then resell it to customers. Lucia thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more grain for resale

loans.name: Hashim

texts.en: Hashim (his relative is pictured) was born in 1970. This man is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town and is settled in the Fuzuli region, in the Abdurrahmanli village. For ten years he has been in the business of selling a variety of products. He is requesting a loan of 950 AZN to buy more stock to sell. In the future, he plans to build a shop from which he can sell wholesale and retail.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products

loans.name: Omankul

texts.ru: Оманкул 39 летний мужчина , отец четверых детей, жена домохозяйка.Сам Оманкул работает трактористом в колхозе,его заработная плата не хватает для проживания семьи.Поэтому он имеет дополнительный доход, от купли продажи скота.У него сейчас 25 баранов.Из-за сезонности данного бизнеса Оманкул решил купить ещё десяток баранов.Сейчас на рынке скот дешевле чем раньше.Поэтому он обратился в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Omankul is 39 years old and has 4 children. His wife is a homemaker. Omankul is a tractor driver at a collective farm, and his income is insufficient. Therefore Omankul raises livestock. He owns 25 sheep. This business is seasonal; currently the prices are low, and Omankul would like to puchase another ten sheep.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cattle

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 49-year-old Sabina M. from Mwanza. She is widowed with three children between the ages of 15 and 28 years old. Sabina has been running a general store since 2006. Her business is to sell soft drinks such as soda, biscuits, books and rulers. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Sabina currently earns about 150 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 300 USD in order to buy soda, juice, beer and biscuits. In the future, she plans to open another business. Victoria thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy soda, juice, beer and biscuits

loans.name: Subon

texts.ru: Субон энергичный мужчина 47 лет , отец шестерых детей.Жена подрабатывает продажей козьей шерсти.Сам Субон имеет 40 белых красивых коз.Которых пасёт сам на горных пастбищах.Которые расположены вблизи гор.Козы питаются на пастбищах различными травами.И только вечером Субон пригоняет их домой.Во время мониторинга мы увидели коз очень далеко и на смогли их запечатлеть.Субон узнав что Микроинвест выдаёт займы на расширение бизнеса животноводства решил тоже стать кредитором Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Subon is an energetic 47-year old father of 6 children. His wife sells goat wool. Subon owns 40 goats which graze during the day on mountain hills. During monitoring we saw Subon's goats but did not take a picture. Having learned that MicroInvest gives loans for expanding livestock businesses, Subon decided to apply for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional seeds for his land

loans.name: Assane

texts.fr: Assane habite dans la ville de ngekhok il est agée de 37 ans il est marié et pere de famille .son activité principale est la vente de lait caillé .Il est ussie d'une famille vendeur de lait de pere en fils,il a fait de ce metier son principale activité .Il est le principale fournisseur de lait de la ville.Les revenus trires de son commerce lui permet d 'entretenir sa famille.le pret sollicité  lui permettra de renforcer ses capacités de  production pour faire face à la forte demande.
texts.en:
Assane lives in the city of Ngekhok. He is 37 years old, married, and the father of a family. He works mostly selling curdled milk. He is also from a family of milk merchants, from father to son, and this trade is his principal business. He is the main provider of milk in town. The income derived from his commerce enables him to support his family. The requested loan will enable him to boost his production capacity for coping with the strong demand.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ulviyya

texts.en: Ulviyya was born in 1971, and she is single. She is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town and is settled in the Fuzuli region, in the Horadiz village. She has run a cafe for four years. Ulviyya is requesting a loan to improve her cafe which will increase her income.

loans.use: To improve a cafe

loans.name: Norkul

texts.ru:
Норкул 49 летний мужчина , отец семерых детей, жена домохозяйка.Норкул  работает бригадой, строителем.В состав его бригады входят его три сына, которым более 20 лет.Они очень сплочённая семейная бригада.Также всей семьёй они занимаются откормом и продажей крупно рогатого скота.Сейчас у него 5 коров,из которых две дают молоко.Для увеличения коров и ремонта коровника он хочет получить займ.
На фотографии Норкул в день выдачи.
texts.en:
Norkul is 49-years old. He is a father of 7 children. His wife is a homemaker. Norkul is a construction worker. He works with a team that includes three of his 20+-year old sons. It is a close-knit family, which, in addition to construction work, raises livestock. Norkul has 5 dairy cows and is applying for a loan that would allow him to purchase more cows and renovate the cowshed. The picture features Norkul on the day of disbursement.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cattle

loans.name: Zena

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 29-year-old Zena P. from Mwanza. She is married with three children between the ages of four and ten years old. Zena has been running a cloth business since 2007. Client’s business is selling African clothes. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. She currently earns about 150 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase children's clothes and kanga (African tradition cloth). In the future, she plans to buy more cloth for resale. Zena thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase children's clothes and kanga

loans.name: Cleopatra

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Cleopatra S. from Mwanza. She is married and has been running a shop business since 2006. Her business is sell clothes. She works at the business for 16 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Cleopatra currently earns about 150 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase shoes, shirts, trousers and suits for women. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Cleopatra thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase shoes, shirts, trousers and suits for women

loans.name: Mamadou Moustapha

texts.fr: Agée de 33 ans il est marié et pére de 2 enfants .Pour gagner sa vie et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille il fait du commerce de detail de depuis plus de cinq (05) ans.Pour renforcer son activité il sollicite un pret .
texts.en:
He is 33 years old, married, and the father of two. To earn his living and provide for his family, he has been doing commerce at the retail level for over five years. He is requesting a loan for enhancing his business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 42-year-old Prisca N. from Mwanza. She is married with four children between the ages of five and 15 years old. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependent because she is an orphan. Prisca has been running a general store since 2007. Client’s business is to sell common items from her shop. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Prisca currently earns about 200 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to buy shoes, cosmetics and kanga. In the future, she plans to open another business. Prisca thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy shoes, cosmetics and kanga

loans.name: Mouhamadou Mactar

texts.fr: agé de 31 ans ,mouhamadou a apres les études primaires appris le metier de tailleur pour avoir une qualification professionnelle.Depuis 5 ans il gere son propre  atelier avec trois modestes machines à coudre qui ne luipermet plus de repondre aux exigences de la clientelle . ansi il sollicite un pret pour l"acquisition d"une  nouvelle machine plus performante.
texts.en:
Following his primary schooling, 31 years old Mouhamadou, learned to be a tailor in order to have a professional qualification. For the last 5 years he has managed is own workshop with three basic sewing machines that no longer allow him to meet the demand of his customers. Thus, he is soliciting a loan to acquire a new, more efficient sewing machine.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Agnes M. from Mwanza. She is married with 3 children between the ages of four and nine years old. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependent because their parents do not take care of him. Agnes has been running a general store since 2008. She owns a small duka or neighborhood shop in the city where she sells common household and grocery items. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Agnes currently earns about 120 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to buy more items such as rice, soup, beans, cooking oil and flour. In the future, she plans to open another business. Agnes thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more items such as rice, soup, beans, cooking oil and flour

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda P. sells bread and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Roda is 26 years old and is widowed.   She has 2 children who attend school.  A loan will help her increase her profits and allow her to expand her business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGO's measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: expand her business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose P. sells bread and is requesting a loan to expand the business.  Rose is 45 years old and married. Her husband is a soldier. They have 2 children who attend school.  A loan will help her increase her profits and allow her to expand her business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGO's measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina A. sells cakes and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Marcelina is 30 years old and married. Her husband is a driver. They have one child who attends school.  A loan will help her increase her profits and allow her to expand her business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGO's measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: expand her business

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr: Seynabou est une femme celibataire sans enfants agée de 32ans.Pour gagner sa vie et affirmer son autonomie par rapport aux autres elle fait du commerce des ustensilles de cuisine en plastiques.La boutique qu 'elle gere est montéesur fonds propres.Elle est une des principales fournisseur d'objets en plastique de la localité.Pour repondre à la demande des clients ,elle sollicite in pret pour renforcer ses marchandises.
texts.en:
Seynabou, 32, is a single woman without children. To earn a living and be independent of others, she sells plastic kitchenware. The shop she runs was set up with her own money. She is one of the main suppliers of plastic-ware in her locality. To respond to the needs of her clientele, she is asking for this loan to bolster her inventory of merchandise.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital for her little plastic-ware shop

loans.name: Yadicone

texts.fr: Yadicone est agée de 36 ans elle est marie et mere de plusieurs enfants .pour gagner sa vie elle vend depuis cinq (5) ans  des tissus  teintés pour femmes.Les revenus tirés de son activité plus permettent de participer aux depenses du menage.le pret sollicité lui permettra de renforcer son activité par l'achat de nouveaux tissus.
texts.en:
Yadicone is 36 years old, married and the mother of several children. To earn a living she has been selling dyed fabrics for women for the last five years. The income from this activity allow her to share the financial responsibility of the household. The requested loan will enable her to strengthen her business by buying new fabrics.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Margert

texts.en:
Margret E. sells tea, bread and cakes at the market and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Margret is 30 years old and married. Her husband is a lecturer at the University of Juba. They have 3 children who attend school.  A loan will help her increase her profits and allow her to expand her business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGO's measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: expand her business

loans.name: Dayandur

texts.en: Dayandur was born in 1970. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town and is settled in the Fuzuli region, in the Kurdmahmudlu village. He is married and has one child. He started his clothes-selling business eight years ago, and he is requesting a loan to stock up on seasonal clothes for his customers.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal clothes

loans.name: Elizerbeth

texts.en:
Elizerbeth K. sells beer at her bar and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Elizerbeth is 40 years old and married. Her husband is a builder. She has 4 children who attend school. A loan will help her increase her profits and allow her to expand her business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGO's measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: expand her business

loans.name: Khayyam

texts.en: This young man was born in 1979. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan in Fuzuli town and is settled in the Fuzuli region, in the Bala Bahmanli village. He is married and has two children. He has been operating his taxi business for five years, and he is requesting a loan to keep his vehicle in good working condition.

loans.use: For vehicle repair

loans.name: Abau

texts.en:
Abau Luke sells beans at the market and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Abau is 29 years old and single. A loan will help her increase her profits and allow her to expand her business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGO's measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en:
Sunday I. sells tea and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Sunday is 26 years old and married. Her husband is a teacher. She has 3 children who attend school.  A loan will help her increase her profits and allow her to expand her business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGO's measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: expand her business

loans.name: Raouf

texts.en:
Raouf is a 34-year-old man, engaged to be married, who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Raouf has been selling computer games and doing computer services for three years. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to install an Internet connection. This is the first time that Raouf has requested a loan.

Raouf is special because he is the only one doing this work in his area. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Raouf first started his business, he didn’t have the start-up capital but he managed anyway. He decided on doing his business because he has experience in working with computers. In the future, Raouf plans to expand and improve his business.

loans.use: to install an Internet connection.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan, 41, lives in Bekaa with his wife and their four children. He has been breeding livestock for six years. Hasan is requesting a loan of $1000 USD from Al Majmoua in order to purchase feed for the livestock and to repay his debts. This is the first time that Hasan has requested a loan. His clients are the markets of his region. Hasan decided on doing this business because he had experience breeding livestock. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase animal feed and repay debts

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric K. is married and has 3 children. Eric makes and sells palm oil at Odumasi near Cape Coast, which he has done for about 8 years. He owns a taxi which he uses to earn additional income. His wife is a petty trader. Eric uses his income to pay the children's school fees, rent, utility bills and other family expenses.

Eric will use the loan as additional capital to enable him to purchase more palm fruit for the production of palm oil to meet the increase in demand by his customers. With the new profits from his expanded business, Eric plans to save towards a house he wants to put up for his children, and also invest in his taxi which is giving him problems.

In the picture is him beside his taxi which generates a little income for him.

loans.use: additional capital to purchase more palm fruit for the production of palm oil

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Ms. C. is 35 years old and her business consists of growing cereals and vegetables in Falesti district. She has been in the business for more than 10 years. From the profit that she gets from her sales in the market in the village she earns money to live. She started her business in 1996 with very little capital but now her business is growing well.

Natalia needs to buy seeds for cereals and vegetables. All the work she does is for her children who need to be dressed and sent to school. The loan from MicroInvest will allow Natalia to earn more profit for her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and such for her farming business

loans.name: Yuryi

texts.en:
Yuryi is divorced. He runs a small car maintenance and repair business in his home town of Kamenka. Yuryi offers a good combination of high quality painting, leveling, and welding services and affordable prices. His business has been running for a year and a half. He has 25,000 Grivnas invested in this business. His monthly income is about 5,000 Grivnas. 

Yuryi has always been very serious about his debts. He hasn’t had a single late payment and has repaid 7 previous loans promptly. This time he is requesting a loan of 9,000 Grivnas to buy a painting compressor unit and improve the quality of provided services. Yuryi is always trying to keep up with modern technologies and innovations; recently he has purchased new tools for his business, including a welder, a grinding device, and a paint-spray gun. Before he launched his business he worked at a service station and gained good experience. Yuryi is a serious and responsible entrepreneur. He doesn’t talk much but always does his job well.

loans.use: To buy a compressor unit for painting cars

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Vasile

texts.en: Vasile is 62 years old and he is married and the father of 3 children. Two of them are studying at the university in Chisinau City. His main activity is growing cereals and vegetables. He also sells fruit. The inhabitants of this village work in agriculture because their land is rich and gives them a good harvest. Vasile requested a loan to buy seeds and also fuel to plow the land. The business is located in Falesti district.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and seeds

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is married with two grown children. Today she runs a small business selling baked goods and confectionery in a small store. Her business boasts a wide assortment of fresh inventory at reasonable prices. Oksana has been in this trade for 3 years. Her working capital amounts to 60,000 UAH. She makes about 5,000 UAH on the goods she sells every month.

Oksana works long hours to keep her business sustainable and growing. She is a friendly vendor and loves owning her business. Oksana’s customers are always satisfied with the quality of the products she sells in her little store. She manages to keep fresh groceries even when the heat is at its worst and food products can easily spoil. Oksana is requesting a loan of 5,000 UAH to diversify the merchandise in her store. She believes that a more varied inventory will be more of an attraction for her customers and will increase her business income. We think that her natural ability to cheer people up with a word of encouragement or a smile will also help attract potential new clients and boost her sales as a result. One of the long-term plans Oksana and her husband have is to start a second business selling construction supplies in their home town of Kamenka.

loans.use: To diversify her merchandise

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera is divorced with two grown children. She lives in Energodar and sells groceries in a market called “Raduzhnyi” (“Rainbow”). The market is located in a densely-populated district of Energodar. Customers come to buy from Vera after work, which is why she has to work longer hours. Vera launched her trade only a year ago. She used to work at a firm that went bankrupt. Vera was forced to find another way to feed herself and her family and worked as a hired market vendor. After she worked for different employers she finally decided to start her own business and is happy to run her own trade today. Currently, she purchases merchandise twice a week. Vera has about 25,000 UAH invested in inventory. Her income amounts to 5,000 UAH a month. 

Vera is very energetic. Her commitment and determination to invest all her efforts into her venture have significantly improved her business. However, Vera is hoping to continue expanding her business. She is seeking a loan of 7,500 UAH to begin constructing a vending kiosk, which would considerably improve her working conditions.

loans.use: To begin construction of a vending kiosk

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi A. is married and has 5 dependents. She has received no formal education. Esi sells yams and palm oil at the Jukai market near Cape Coast, which she has done for about 10 years. Her husband is a farmer.

Esi uses her income to help her husband pay rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Esi will use the loan to increase her capital to buy food supplies in larger quantities for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to reinvest for the expansion of her sales of food supplies. The containers beside her are some in which she keeps the oil she produces before sale.

loans.use: to increase her capital to buy food supplies

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana vive en la calle Illimani  de la zona 21  de Diciembre , ubicada en una zona periférica  de la ciudad de El Alto
 
Ella vive junto a su esposo, Rufino y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia.

Trabaja junto a toda su familia en un pequeño taller de confección de buzos deportivos los cuales los lleva para su posterior venta semanal, a la localidad de Juliaca provincia fronteriza entre  Bolivia y Perú.. 

El crédito lo destinara  para compra de telas  y así incrementar su producción, por lo tanto sus ingresos
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Juana lives on Illimani Street, in the neighborhood of "21 de Diciembre", located on the outskirts of the city of El Alto. She lives in her own house with her husband, Rufino, and her 4 children. She works together with her whole family in a small workshop where they make sweat suits for sport teams. They take them to be sold in a store in Juliaca which is located near the boarder of Boliva and Peru. She will use the money from the loan to buy fabric and then she will be able to increase her production and later her income with increase. This is the first loan that she will receive through Impro. Her business has been evaluated by Impro and she has been approved to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy Fabric To Make Sports Suits

loans.name: Genesis Group

texts.en:
“Genesis” is a group of five entrepreneurs seeking their first loan from Esperanza International. This group hopes to utilize their first micro-finance loan to further expand their existing business ventures or create new operations in order to increase their profit levels. Teodosia is the coordinator for this group in the city of Santiago.

Teodosia and her husband of ten years care for their eight-year-old god-daughter. Teodosia plans to utilize her first micro-finance loan to increase her inventory of the products she sells. Currently, on the streets, Teodosia sells a variety of men’s, women’s, and children’s shoes and clothing, as well as belts, perfume, and other assorted accessories. Teodosia is dedicated to the success of her business as she dreams of one day owning her own large variety store and converting a room in her house into a store. Loan funds will be used to increase current inventory levels and begin the process of creating a store.

Other members of Teodosia’s bank run similar entrepreneurial operations including a bed-making business and food and clothing sales.

On behalf of Esperanza and this group of business entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you for your support!

loans.use: buy more inventory for her traveling sales

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy O. sells clothing, footwear and saucepans and also manufactures palm oil.  She has been in this business for three years.   Mercy has a junior high education.  She is married, her husband is a farmer, and she has 6 dependants. They live near Dosi near the Cape Coast.

She supports her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more shoes, clothing and saucepan and also buy more palm fruit for the production of the oil.  Customers are demanding more of her products. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more shoes, clothing and saucepans and also buy more palm fruit for the production of the oil.  There is an increased demand by her customers.

loans.name: Ciobanu Eudochia

texts.en:
Eudochia C. is 45 years old. Her business has been around for about 10 years. Selling vegetables has been a difficult business as there have been bad weather conditions that have not been conducive to a good growing season with a rich harvest.

Eudochia is asking for a loan to invest in her fruit business, increasing her stock of vegetables to sell. This is an opportunity to increase her sales at the market in her village. MicroInvest gave her hope that the loan will develop her business.

loans.use: increase her working capital

loans.name: Esperanza En Dios Group

texts.en:
“Esperanza en Dios”, or Hope in God, is a group of five entrepreneurs seeking their first loan from Esperanza International. This group hopes to utilize their first micro-finance loan to further develop their existing business ventures or create new operations in order to increase their profit levels. Monica, the wife of the pastor who works in the Santiago Esperanza office, is the coordinator of this group.

Ramona and her husband Rafa have four children (18, triplets: 12). Ramona sells oil for cooking and homemaD. ice-cream. Currently she is able to sell 5 to 6 units of oil a week and 100 strawberry, cherry, and chocolate ice-creams at 5 pesos each (approximately $0.14) a day. Ramona desires to use her first micro-finance loan to purchase additional ingredients to increase the sales of oil and ice-cream and also start selling undergarments from her home. Ramona and her husband Rafa desire to see continued growth so that they may continue to proviD. for the needs of their four children.

Other members of Ramona’s bank run similar entrepreneurial operations including a “colmado” or small grocery store and clothing and undergarment sales. On behalf of Esperanza and this group of business entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you for your support!

loans.use: Purchase additional materials to sell and start undergarments sales

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana se dedica a dos labores una de ellas, la repostería, distribuyendo sus productos en las tiendas y colegios de la zona, y paralelamente es propietaria de un centro de llamadas telefónicas y servicio de fotocopias ubicado en la zona de alto obrajes de la ciudad de La Paz, frente a la normal de estudiantes. La señora vive con su hija quien estudia en la universidad y a la cual debe sustentar sus estudios ya que su esposo se encuentra de viaje.
Doña Juana invertirá el préstamo en la compra de material para su negocio hojas y material de escritorio para el centro de llamadas y harina para la elaboración de masitas ya que empieza el periodo escolar.
texts.en:
Juana has two businesses. One is a bakery, which distributes baked goods to the stores and schools in her area, the other is a telephone center and photocopy service located in the Alto Obrajes zone of La Paz city, across from the teacher training college. She lives with her daughter, who studies at the university. Juana is supporting her daughter while her daughter's husband is away. In preparation for the school year Juana will invest the loan in paper and office supplies for the telephone center and flour for pastries.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre (04) femmes du groupe Tiessiri (sont toutes mariées) avec une moyenne d’âge de 43ans et 03 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles traditionnelles à Bougoula ville un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région du Mali).
 Elles menent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente d’esence, de chaussures et  la restauration.
Elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et tous les précédents ont été bien dénoués.
Avec ce prêt, elles comptent acheter, 3paquets de condiments alimentaires, 1 sac de 100kg de riz pour faire la restauration, 4 boutielles de parfum , 10kg de  4kg de et autres pour la fabrique d’encens, 2 douzaines de paires de chaussures en plastique et 1bariles et ½ d’essence. Elles   s’approvisionnement à Sikasso ville et dans les localités environnantes. 
Les marchandises sont vendues au marché et dans les quartiers à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes et la plupat au comptant.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice de 32.000fcfa par mois dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The four women of the Tiessiri group (all married) have an average age of 43 and 3 children, on average. They live in traditional families in Bougoula township, one of the neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso (3rd region of Mali).

They have various businesses, among others selling gasoline, shoes, and food service. They are on their 5th loan with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and all the preceding loans have been correctly reimbursed.

With this loan they expect to buy 3 packets of condiments, 1 sack of 100 kg of rice to be cooked and sold, 4 bottles of perfume, 14 kg of raw materials used to make incense, 2 dozen pairs of plastic shoes, and one and a half barrels of gasoline. They do their buying in the town of Sikasso and surrounding localities.

The merchandise is sold at the market and in the neighborhoods to a clientele composed generally of women and mostly for cash. They each expect to make 32,000 F CFA per month profit of which part will be used for the needs of their families and the rest invested in their businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La Sra. Juana C. trabaja en un kiosco de venta de golosinas desde hace mas de diez años, su esposo don Isidro trabaja de portero en esa institución educativa, tienen cinco hijos, los dos mayores ayudan en el mantenimiento del hogar, y estudian a la vez, ambos esposos lograron adquirir un terreno en la ciudad de El Alto, y poco a poco van construyendo su vivienda.
Trabaja con Emprender desde el año 2004 comenzó con grupo solidario de tres personas llamado Carmelitas, posteriormente se individualizaron, por razones de trabajo. 
Actualmente ella saca crédito solo en épocas de clases, descansa en periodos de vacaciones, juntamente con su esposo son personas responsables y puntuales en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Juana C. has worked in a school kiosk selling candy for more than ten years. Her husband Isidro works as a doorman at the same school. They have five children, the two oldest help at home and study at the same time. Juana and her husband were able to buy a plot of land in El Alto city, and are slowly building their house. Juana has worked with Emprender since 2004; she began in a solidarity group called Carmelitas, consisting of three people. They later sought individual loans for work reasons. Juana only uses loans during the school season when she has business from students; she doesn't work during school vacation periods. Juana and her husband are responsible people and very punctual in repaying their loans.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Maria Cleofe

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Alegría Huamanga.
Maria es casada, tiene 44 años y 6 hijos, Maria tiene una bodega en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas, carnes, gas y también tiene teléfono publico. Además tiene cabinas de Internet. 
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, yogurt y gaseosas.
Los sueños de Maria son que sus hijos sean profesionales, cambiar de negocio e implementar un salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the "Alegría Huamanga" community bank. Maria is married; she is 44 years old and has six children. Maria has a store in her home where she sells groceries, vegetables, fruits, meat, propane as well as having a public telephone. In addition, she has internet stations. Maria needs a loan of 1,050 soles to invest in rice, sugar, oil, yoghurt and soft drinks. Maria dreams that her children will have a career, of changing her line of business and opening a beauty salon.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, yoghurt and soft drinks.

loans.name: Adisa

texts.en:
Adisa S. is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer and they live in Jukai near the Cape Coast.  She has no formal education. Adisa has been sells clothing, bags and has also been producing palm oil for four years. 

Adisa uses her income to support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Adisa will use the loan as capital to enable him to increase the purchase of palm fruit for the production of the palm oil.  Currently customers are demanding more of her products. With the new profits from her expanded business.  Adisa plans to reinvest into the business for the further expansion of her trade in food supplies and palm oil.

loans.use: Adisa will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to increase the purchase of palm fruit for the production of the palm oil.  There is a increased demand by her customers.

loans.name: Lungu

texts.en: Lungu Pelaghea is a hard-working person and she owns a small piece of land where she cultivates vegetables. Pelaghea faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to buy fertilizer to amend her field. To deal with this problem, Ms. Lungu is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for the fields; she would use the rest of loan to purchase fuel to water the field to make her crops more productive. She has been in this business for more than 5 years.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer and also fuel to water her crops

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Alegría Huamanga.
Maria es casada, tiene 38 años y 4 hijos, Maria tiene un puesto en el mercadillo Señor de Arequipa en donde vende abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, fideo, papel.
Los sueños de Maria son que sus hijos salgan adelante y sean profesionales, ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the "Alegría Huamanga" community bank. Maria is married; she is 38 years old and has four children. Maria has a stall in the small market of "Señor de Arequipa" where she sells groceries every day with the help of her children. Maria needs a loan of 1,050 soles with which she will buy rice, noodles, and paper. Maria's dream is that her children will prosper and have careers, and that she will expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, noodles, and paper.

loans.name: Fadenkene Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre (04) femmes du groupe Fadenkene (sont toutes mariées) avec une moyenne d’âge de 41ans  ont en moyenne 04 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier I, un des quartiers de la ville de Loulouni sous préfecture,  la 3ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles exercent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres l’achat - vente d’haricots, d’atiéke, d’essence et  la restauration.
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle ; elles ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt (prêt de groupe) et tous les précédents  se sont dénoués. 
Elles comptent acheter avec ce prêt, 2sacs de 100kg d’atiéke - un bidon d’huile alimentaire de 10litres, 3 sacs de 100kg d’haricot , 2sacs de 100kg de riz – 2 paquets de condiments alimentaires(pour la restauration) et 2 bariles et ½ d’essence.
Elles s’approvisionnement à Kadiolo ville, Loulouni et dans les villages environnants. Les marchandises sont vendues au marché surtout les jours de foires (aux forains), au bord du goudron et dans les quartiers à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 27.250FCFA par mois dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Les femmes du groupe Fadenkene ambitionnent d’être, un jour, chacune une commerçante grossiste et de s’octroyer un restaurant digne de ce nom ou aménager un point de vente adéquat.
texts.en:
The four women of the group Fadenkene (all married) have an average age of 41 and on average 4 children. They live in traditional extended families in District 1, a neighborhood of the town of Loulouni, third administrative region of Mali.

They have various businesses, among others buying and selling beans, atiéke (cassava grits), gasoline, and working in food service. So as to satisfy the needs of their clientele, they decided to join Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their 9th group loan, and all the preceding ones have been repaid.

They intend to use this loan to buy 2 sacks of 100 kg of atiéke, 1 jerry can of 10 liters of cooking oil, 3 sacks of 100 kg of beans, 2 sacks of 100 kg of rice, 2 packets of condiments (for food service), and 2 barrels and a half of gasoline. They do their buying in the town of Kadiolo and Loulouni and surroundings. The merchandise is sold at the market, especially on weekly market days (to itinerant merchants), at the roadside, and in the neighborhoods, to a clientele composed of men and women.

They each expect to make an average profit of 27,250 F CFA per month of which a part will be used for family expenses and the rest invested back into their businesses. The women of the Fadenkene group each hope one day to be a wholesaler or to open up a restaurant worthy of the name or a real shop.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Juana Felicitas

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Emprendedoras.
Juana es casada y tiene 7 hijos, Juana venD. comida D. manera ambulatoria en el mercado Santa Clara, Juana venD. desayunos que reparte a los comerciantes del mercado. Además Juana venD. cereales que compra D. las feriantes. Juana tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa.
Juana necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, aceite, fideos.
Los sueños D. Juana son progresar mas, que sus hijos estudien y surtir su tienda con mas productos.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the "Emprendedoras" community bank. Juana is married and has seven children. Juana is a street vendor, selling food at the Santa Clara market: Juana sells breakfasts which she distributes to merchants in the market. Juana also sells cereals which she buys from the merchants. Juana also has a grocery store in her home. Juana needs a 600 soles loan to buy rice, oil, and noodles. Juana dreams of progressing more, that her children get their education and of stocking her store with more products.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and noodles

loans.name: Edith Eloida

texts.es: La señora Edith M. P. se dedica a la venta de sopa en un pequeño Kiosco en una zona muy populosa de la ciudad de La Paz, Bolivia, vive con su esposo y sus pequeños hijos en condiciones muy humildes. Su esposo es propietario de un taller de mecánica y ambos trabajan en el taller cuando doña Edith tiene tiempo disponible, tienen dos hijos a su cargo y esperan con el tiempo mejorar su s ingresos para el bienestar sus hijos. En esta ocación Doña Edith solicita el crédito para la compra de material que usarán en el taller mecanico de su marido.
texts.en:
Edith M. P. sells soup from a small kiosk in a densely populated section of La Paz. She lives with her husband and small children in very humble conditions. Her husband owns a mechanic shop, and both of them work there when Edith has extra time. They have two children and hope to increase their income over time for their well-being. Edith is applying for a loan to buy materials that they will use in her husband's shop.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for her husband's mechanic shop

loans.name: Soutra Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre (04) femmes du groupe Soutra (sont toutes mariées) ont une moyenne d’âge de 41ans et 04 enfants. Elles vivent dans des  familles traditionnelles au quartier I, un des quartiers de la ville de Loulouni sous préfecture, la 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles menent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres l’achat - vente d’habits, de céréales, d’atiéke et d’ustensiles de cuisine.
Elles collaborent  avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle ; elles sont à leur neuvième prêt (prêt de groupe) et tous les précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elles comptent acheter avec ce prêt, 1tonne de  maïs, 2sacs de 100kg d’atiéke, 2douzaines de tasses – louches en aluminium et en plastique et des habits (une douzaine de complets pour enfants). Elles s’approvisionnement à Sikasso ville, Loulouni et ses localités environnantes. 
Les marchandises sont vendues au marché surtout aux forains et dans les quartiers à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes et la plupat au comptant.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 29.500fcfa par mois dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Les femmes du groupe Soutra ambitionnent d’être, un jour, chacune une commerçante grossiste et ouvrir un magasin ou une boutique.
texts.en:
The four (04) women of the Soutra group are all married and on average are 41 years old and have 4 children. They live in traditional families in District I, one of the areas in the Loulouni sub-prefecture, the 3rd administration region of Mali. They run various businesses which include, among others, the buying and re-selling of clothing, cereals, atiéke, and cooking utensils. They work with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to meet the needs of their customers; they are on their ninth group loan, and all their previous loans were repaid properly. With this loan, they intend to buy 1 tonne of maize, two 100-kilo bags of atiéke, 2 dozen cups, aluminium and plastic ladles, and clothing (one dozen children's outfits). They supply themselves in the town of Sikasso, in Loulouni, and the neighbouring villages. The merchandise is sold in the market, especially during market days, and in various districts to a clientele composed generally of women, most of whom pay in cash. They foresee realizing an average monthly profit of 29,500 FCFA each, of which one portion will be used for their family needs, and the other portion will be invested in their businesses. The women of the Soutra group each have the ambition one day to be a wholesale merchant and to open a shop or a store.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and re-sell various items

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
Cirila es socia del Banco Comunal Emprendedoras.
Cirila es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 3 hijos, Cirila vende mercería como artículos de limpieza, cintas, bastones, sus ventas los realiza de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Santa Clara. Además Cirila tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende bebidas.
Cirila necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cintas, cordones, palos.
Los sueños de Cirila son ayudar a sus hijos para que sean mejores que ella y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Cirila is a member of the Emprendedoras Communal Bank. Cirila has a live-in partner, is 23 years old, and has 3 children. Cirila sells various household goods, such as cleaning supplies, tapes, and canes, as a street vendor in the Santa Clara market. Cirila also has a store in her home where she sells beverages. Cirila needs a loan for 800 soles to invest in the purchase of tapes, laces, and wooden handles. Her dreams are to help her children have a better life than hers and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tapes, laces, and wooden handles

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Carmen Rosa C. G. se dedica a la compra y venta de ladrillos, está casada con el señor Jesús Quispe y tiene 2 hijos pequeños, es una de las clientes más antiguas de la institución.
Comenzó con el negocio de venta de papa y con mucho esfuerzo ahorro un pequeño capital con el que inició la compra y venta de ladrillos. Aunque es una persona joven administra muy bien su negocio.
El sacrificio de esta cliente se ve reflejado en su puntualidad y responsabilidad con sus cuotas, en un futuro piensa comprar un terreno y construir una casa para la comodidad de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa C. G. buys and sells bricks. She is married to Jesús Quispe and she has two small children. She is one of the institution's longest-standing clients. She started out in business by selling potatoes, and with lots of work saved enough money to start the brick business. Even though she is young, she runs her business well. Her punctuality and responsibility with payments reflects her dedication. In the future she plans to buy a piece of land to build a house for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Madame Aminata Traoré est une femme mariée de 40 ans et mère de 5 enfants. Elle vit avec son mari et ses enfants dans le quartier hérémakono nord de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Depuis 20 ans, Madame Aminata Traoré  fait de la restauration qu’elle a appris auprès de  sa soeur. Son restaurant est situé en face d’un carrefour très fréquenté par beaucoup de monde.
Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, elle décida de rejoindre le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwasi. Après trois prêts solidaires(prêt de groupe) avec une association de son quartier, elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Avec ce deuxième prêt, Madame Aminata envisage acheter régulierement des pintades, des poulets, de la viande et  divers condiments alimentaires pour la préparation des plats alimentaires.
Elle s’approvisionne à Bougouni et dans les villages environants. Elle a une clientèle diverse et variée.  La rotation de son activité est très élévée et elle espèrent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000FCFA.qui sera utilisé pour améliorer son restaurant et aider son époux à subvenir aux charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminata Traoré is 40 years old, married, and has 5 children. She lives with her husband and her children in the North Hérémakono area in the town of Bougouni (in the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). For 20 years, Mrs. Aminata Traoré has run a food service business, which she learned with her sister. Her restaurant is situated opposite a crossing used very often by a large number of people. In her search for complementary financial resources, she decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwasi, a microfinance institution. After three group loans with an association in her area, she is seeking her second individual loan. All of her previous loans were repaid properly. With this second loan, Mrs. Aminata intends to buy guinea-fowl, chickens, meat, and various condiments for the preparation of food dishes. She supplies herself in Bougouni and in the neighbouring villages. She has a diverse and varied clientele. The turnover of her business is very high, and she hopes to realize a monthly profit of 50,000 FCFA, which will be used to improve her restaurant and help her husband in meeting the family expenses.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy guinea-fowl, chickens, meat, and condiments

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes A. is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a farmer and they live in Jukai neat the Cape Coast. Agnes is a hair dresser who owns a beauty salon, and she has had her business for 17 years.

She has received schooling through Senior high. Agnes uses her income to support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Agnes will use the loan to purchase some new and varied products.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Agnes plans to invest in the expansion of her beauty salon.

loans.use: Tto purchase a variety of hair products to meet the demands of her customers who come to the salon.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Emprendedoras.
Rosa es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 2 hijos, Rosa junto a su esposo son artesanos y realizan trabajos en retablos en donde de plasma las costumbres de la zona, sus productos los comercializa en la ciudad de Lima a través de pedidos. Además Rosa tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa. 
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gas, cerveza.
Los sueños de Rosa son producir mas retablos, tener mas clientes y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Emprendedoras Communal Bank. She is 29 years old, married, and has 2 children. Rosa and her husband are artisans who craft altarpieces that express the regional culture. Their products are sold by order in Lima. In addition, Rosa has a small store in her house. Rosa needs a loan for 800 soles that she will use to by soft drinks and beer. Rosa hopes to make more altarpieces, have more clients, and give her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks and beer

loans.name: Maria Lucia

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras.
Maria es casada, tiene 52 años y 2 hijos, Maria tiene un restaurante llamado Marcos que esta ubicado en una calle concurrida de la ciudad de Ayacucho, la atención es durante todo el día, cuenta con 5 personas que se encargan de la cocina y atención al publico. Además atienden pedidos para compromisos diversos.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ollas, platos.
Los sueños de Maria son que su ultima hija sean profesional y que su negocio sea cada vez mejor.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Obreras Communal Bank. Maria is 52, married, and has 2 children. She has a restaurant called 'Marcos,' located on a busy street in the city of Ayacucho. It is open all day, and she has 5 employees who work in the kitchen and serve the customers. In addition they take orders for a variety of functions. Maria needs a loan for 1200 soles that she will use to by pots and dishes. Maria hopes that her youngest daughter can have a professional career and that her business keeps growing.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pots and dishes

loans.name: Roman Andrés

texts.es:
DON ROMAN C. es cliente de la instirucion desde el año 2007, se dedica a la reparación de automóviles y su especialidad es la reparación y recambio de cajas de cambio de minibús, actividad que amplía a medida que saca sus creditos en nuestra institución.
Es un cliente que mantiene a su familia de 5 integrantes, sus 3 hijos aun son pequeños y estan en la escuela. Don Roman es el unico que genera los engresos para la familia. Que vive en condiciones humildes, y esper´´an que el impacto del microcrédito sea de gran veneficio para sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Roman C. has been a client of the institution since 2007. He repairs automobiles, specializing in the repair and replacement of minibus gearboxes, a business he has expanded through loans from our institution. He supports a family of 5. His 3 children are still young and are in school. Roman is the only member of the family with income. He lives in humble conditions and hopes that his loved ones will benefit from the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras.
Mercedes es casada, tiene 36 años y 3 hijos, Mercedes tiene una panadería en su casa en donde elaboran diferentes tipos de panes, sus ventas lo realiza repartiendo de tienda en tienda. Además Mercedes tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
Mercedes necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina y leña.
Los sueños de Mercedes son implementar su panadería con todo los equipos necesarios y que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a member of the "Obreras" community bank. Mercedes is married; she is 36 years old and has three children. Mercedes has a bakery which she runs from her home and where they make differents sorts of breads. She sells her goods by distributing them from store to store. In addition, Mercedes has a grocery store in her home. Mercedes needs a 1,000 soles loan to invest in the purchase of flour and wood. Mercedes dreams of outfitting her bakery with all the requisite equipment and of having her children complete their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour and wood

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr:
Agée de 34 ans, Madame Bintou  F. est mère de (4) quatre enfants et vit dans une famille nucléaire avec son époux et ses enfants dans le quartier Badialan  de la ville de Fana au préfecture de Dioila (région de Koulikoro république du Mali).
Pour des raisons sociales elle abandonna l’école à l’âge de 14 ans pour aider sa mère dans les activités domestiques et économiques. Après 09 ans au service de sa mère, Madame Bintou  F. décida de s’installer  à son propre compte et cela dans l’achat  vente de pagnes.
Pour augmenter son stock et servir plus de clientes elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso qu’elle a fait la connaissance à travers les relations de voisinage.
Après  5 prêts  de groupe avec une association de son quartier, elle est à son troisième prêt individuel et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt : 80 pièces de 6 pagnes de différentes qualités. Elle s’approvisionne en pagne dans le marché de Bamako (capitale du Mali) pour venir les revendre en ambulant en détail au comptant ou à crédit  dans la ville de Fana à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes.
Elle se propose d’avoir 30 000FCFA de bénéfice par mois avec ce prêt. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de subvenir aux frais de santé et d’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
At 34 years of age, Mrs. Bintou F. is the mother of four children and lives in a nuclear family with her husband and children in the Badialan area of the city of Fana in the prefecture of Dioiloa (in the Koulikoro region in the Republic of Mali). For social reasons, she left school at the age of 14 to help her mother in domestic and business activities. After nine years working with her mother, Mrs. Bintou F. decided to establish her own business selling pagnes (a type of highly prized West African clothing). To increase her stock and serve more customers, she decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, which she learned about through various connections in her neighbourhood. After five group loans with an association in her area, she is seeking her third individual loan, and all her previous loans were repaid properly. With this loan, she intends to buy 80 sets of 6 pagnes of different types. She supplies herself at the market in Bamako (the capital of Mali), in order to re-sell them at retail in cash or in credit in the town of Fana, to a clientele composed essentially of women. She intends to realize a profit of 30,000 FCFA per month with this loan. This profit will allow her to meet the health and education costs of her children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and re-sell pagnes (a type of West African clothing)

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras.
Dora es conviviente, tiene 46 años y 4 hijos, Dora viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende abarrotes y pollos para crianza, y de las ferias compra cereales, quesos que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Dora necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pollos bebes.
Los sueños de Dora con implementar cabinas de Internet en su casa y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Dora is a member of the Obreras Village Bank. She is 46 and has a common-law husband and 4 children. She travels around to different markets in the region selling groceries, and chickens for people to raise. She also buys cereals and cheeses, which she sells in the markets in the city of Ayacucho. Dora needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she'll invest in baby chickens. Her dreams include opening an Internet cafe in her house, and having her children finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase baby chickens
